Moore leads on "Pulsate," establishing a funky rhythm that the others join.  Prevost starts "Summoning" with some atmospheric percussion, "summoning" the others to join.  The final piece, "Blurring of Boundaries," has a moving, elegiac feel.There are passages, including "Vibrations," where Smith's saxophone actually plays melodies and sounds more like a Sixties Blue Note album than we expect from the British free improv tradition.  I suspect that, although these are not compositions, Moore's funky rhythm and Smith's melodies may have been used regularly as the band toured, certainly apropos the name -- free jazz, rather than free improv.  Prevost can certainly play swinging jazz if he wants to, I know from hearing him on other recordings, but this session doesn't feature anything approaching a driving, propulsive beat.This is a great document of a movement and a little-known ensemble.  It is essential of course for fans of the late Paul Rutherford.  Anyone who admires Eddie Prevost based on his work with AMM or many other musicians should not miss it.  Harrison Smith and Tony Moore are not as well known, but they contribute here to music that is truly fine.The title is evocative, referring, I take it, both to the musical and political liberation movements of the Sixties that lived on for many years but which seem to have either died out or exist in extremely weakened form today.  Remembering that egalitarian vision as we listen to this music can inspire us to continue to act to bring about that imagined Future!

This early 2007 recording, released in 2008, is the latest batch of compositions from NYC alto saxophonist Rob Brown.  It is a departure from his two previous quartet sessions, Jumping Off the Page (2000) and The Big Picture (2004), both superb, and both of which featured the late trumpeter Roy Campbell, Jr. -- this time instead of trumpet, Brown is joined by Craig Taborn on piano (and electronics), while William Parker plays bass and Gerald Cleaver plays drums.Between Brown's angular compositions and the alto-piano interaction, CROWN TRUNK ROOT FUNK has the classic sound of a Sixties Blue Note album like Eric Dolphy's Out to Lunch (1964), and it is more introspective and subdued than those previous quartet sessions, with a cool, crystalline sound.My favorite tracks are "Clearly Speaking" and "Exuberance," which are the most up-tempo with the fieriest solos and the most energetic interactions.  "Lifeboat" also increases in velocity as it moves toward land, becoming an excellent vehicle for the band.  Parker's ability to bow high on the bass and sound like a horn is remarkable.  The closing ballad, "Worlds Spinning," is tragically beautiful, a meditation on worlds spinning in violent and unenlightened ways (think of Iraq in 2007).  Brown's sound here is powerfully moving."Rocking Horse" is based on a repeated three-note motif played by Parker.  Like "Ghost Dog," it moves deliberately, setting all four players in clear relief, and works within a clear structure as opposed to a free blowing improvisation.  I find the longest piece, "Sonic Ecosystem" (11'15) to be the least engaging.  It features Taborn's electronics as a tableaux against which the other instruments move slowly, almost statically.  On the one hand it serves to provide variety and texture to the album as a whole, but Taborn's electronics are not used nearly as effectively as they are on Tim Berne's Science Friction Live (2003).Rob Brown has been one of my favorite jazz musicians and one of my favorite alto saxophonists for years.  I recommend this album to anyone who also enjoys Brown's music, and to anyone interested in the best jazz of our time.

I have developed carpal tunnel, which causes pain in my wrist when I ride my motorcycle for more than 5 minutes. I bought this not expecting it to work, however after putting it on I was able to ride my bike for over an hour without severe pain in my wrist.
Good quality filter, fits perfectly on my GX390.
Good replacement for toro z4200 bushing part#46-6560. fits like the one that came from oem.

This sander worked great but it did not last long. In total I used it about 20 times totaling 3 to 4 hours altogether. It then started moving slow and when I would try to sand it wouldn't even move. Maybe the one I received was defective. I opened it open and nothing looked burnt. I ended up buying DEWALT D26451 3-Amp 5-Inch Random-Orbit Sander with Cloth Dust Bag that has been working great a lot better than this black and decker.

Cheap junk, bought this to clean out the threads on the hatch bolt holes of a 300zx. After just 3 turns the tap broke off in the bolt hole. I had the buy a tap/die kit from harbor freight in order to finish the hatch. If I knew these were so flimsy I would have just bought the cheap harbor freight tools in the first place.

I cut a door opening in a block wall and needed to install a lintel. I wasn't expecting to find large angle iron on amazon let alone with prime shipping. This metal is strong and heavy worked and not flimsy like tin foil. Work great for my project.

I dropped my ASUS Transformer so I needed a tablet to replace it. Since I only used it to read research papers in PDF I decided to give this cheap tablet a try. The first issue I had was that this tablet did not come with a PDF reader/viewer installed. So I needed to config WIFI in order to connect to the app store. The tablet shows a strong signal is being received. It connects but when you try to browse or go to the app store it disconnects but still show the signal is 100% or just wont reconnect. I thought maybe it was the security on my router so I turned everything off and still the same thing.After 4 days of trying I was able to get it to connect to download the PDF reader but the WIFI connection is pretty unstable. The second issue I have is the back of the tablet is very flimsy. When I am holding it the impression from my fingers on the back shows on the screen. The light of the screen and the quality of the screen is not the best, it gives of a funny glare/ mirror tint look from certain angles. The camera quality is not the best either, images look washed out.If you are looking for a disposable tablet then you can give this a try. if you are looking for something to connect to WIFI to check emails and browse while you are on the go , you might want to get something else the WIFI on this is too erratic.

I bought a computer glasses 3 years ago Computer Glasses with Clear Polycarbonate Double Sided Anti-reflective Coating, Scratch Coating and Uv Protection - Black Metal Frame - 51-19-140 that worked great and solved my blurred vision problem. I misplaced those glasses and tried to replace them but thy were not in stock at the time so I bought these instead. These glasses did not work for me. Looking at my monitor through these glasses still causes blurred vision, tired eyes after just 30 minutes. I thought maybe I was sent  one with magnification but that was not the case.This glasses is also cheaply made, feels like a toy or a novelty item. Feels and look like some cheap Chinese glasses that someone just put orange tint on the lens and repackaged as computer glasses. The lens get dirty very quickly. The only good thing about this purchase is the case the glasses come in. Maybe it will work for you but it did not work for me.

Works Great on pavers. In the powdered form this product works very well at removing dirt and oil from concrete. It does not remove very old oil stains, but it does remove some of the layers. Where this product really shines for me is on pavers. without even brushing or scrubbing this product is able to bring dirty pavers back clean. I actually mix it with water then spray it on in order to make it last longer and it works great.

I bought this to replace one of the cameras on a LaView security camera system. The camera is great for the price. The build quality is good. The lens has not logged up yet nor has rain water gotten inside. Compared to the other cameras on my LaView system, this camera has better colors, image looks less washed out, picture is a lot clearer doesn't have that foggy look. The ir works great I can actually see my back yard at night now where as with my other cameras I can't see anything. I plan on buying 3 more to replace the other cameras on my system.

Bought this set for use in my HD720, so far the batteries have performed well. I have charged these many times and so far the battery life has stayed fairly the same. I'll update when they start giving problems.

I have been using this for about 3 months now without any issues. even after being covered with rain dirt and mud I had no trouble unlocking the lock. I also had no problem with the lock interfering with attaching my safety chain.

not much to say about this. Bought it for my 2014 Ram 1500 and it fits like a glove. the cover looks good and feels good on the hands. the material it is made from is also of good quality and has held up very well to daily use.

Not much to say about this, the product is self explanatory. Used this to repair the broken flange on my toilet. Installation is simple and so far after 3 months my toilet is still secured down tight.

Bought this tape to put on my 14 foot trailer that I towing at night. Just like all other 3m tape I have used this one adheres very well. It has held up to the heat and rain of south Florida. The problem with this tape is how poor it reflects light. At the distance there is zero to no reflection it just looks like white tape on my black trailer. In order to see any reflection you have to be up close and even then it's still barely noticeable. Maybe my type was defective, but I can't recommend this product.

This nozzle works great. I use it when I do contract pressure cleaning. I find that it removes dirt much faster and easier than a yellow tip and you take less time to get the job done. The only issue I have experienced is the nozzle gaskets/o-ring do not hold up well to hot water over 140 degree. I bought 2 of these, the one that I used with the hot water 180 degree is leaking and sprays water out the sides. it only has about 1 hour of hot water through it. the  other one with no hot water through it is still working fine. I lowered the temp to 140 and I have not had any issues with leaks since.
I installed windows 7 on my Dell B120 and I bought this memory as an upgrade. I installed both ram and turned on the system and all 2gb was recognized by the OS. The system now runs smooth.

bought this to replace the broken screen on my Dell B120. You will have to use the inverter from your old screen but besides that the installation is easy. everything just plugs in including the inverter no cutting or soldering required.

Bought this to replace the damage keyboard on my Dell B120 and the fit is perfect. Installation is pretty straight forward and took just a few minutes. Looks identical to the keyboard that came on my laptop.

I have been feeding this food to my gold fish for over a year now and it is the best gold fish food I have found so far. Since I began feeding this food to my fish they have put on good size and their color are vibrant. The package appears small on the picture but you do get a lot of food for the price.

I bought these to use on my Hot water pressure washer. I run 200 degree water and after just 2 day the O- rings I bought from the local store breaks down and water leaks. I was not expecting much from these but to my surprise they are well made. I am on my third day using my pressure washer and no leaks. The local store is charging me $10.00 for 10 inferior o-rings and I got 25 for $2.00 here on amazon. can't beat the quality and price.

Used this on my ram 1500 to tow a 5000 plus pound trailer and so far it has been great. Price-wise it is cheaper than the oem  ram hitch but has the same specs 6,000 LB wc  600 LB tw and 10,000 LB/1,000 LB with weight distribution. The install was very easy took less than 10 minutes. The hardest part of the install is laying down on the ground to tighten the bolts. I have close to 2000 miles pulling my trailer with this hitch and no issues to report.

I used this to measure the boundary for a property I just bought. the tape worked great  its sturdy and easy to retract. I retracted it through bushes and shrubs without getting it damages. well worth the price

Not much to say about this, I use it to charge my android phone and it charges very fast. also works great on the kindle fire. Even with 4g, blue tooth, gps  and pandora running this charger still charges my phone fast. The charger is well built and so far it has held up well with no malfunctions.

I used these on a home I just bought that had carpenter ants. I really did not think this would work but to my surprise  it did. I have not seen any carpenter ants in weeks. Well worth the price. I dissolved it in a 1 gal sprayer bottle and sprayed around the house, easy and simple. Make sure you read the directions and follow all safety precautions.
not much to say about this. Used it when installing an Avic NAV in 2014 ram 1500. fits perfectly and made the install easy.

If you are buying this as a natural diuretic then it may not work for you. I tried this for 2 months. First I started taking 1 a day, then I started taking 1 in the morning and 1 at night. I then started taking 2 in the morning and at night and this did nothing to lowered my blood pressure, I'm pre-hypertensive. A person looking to lower their blood pressure may be better off making Hibiscus tea. These cap a not very potent. The research on hibiscus and blood pressure deals more with the tea form and not capsule form.Hibiscus is also high in vitamin C and helps boost immunity. However while taking these caps I  still caught a cold and these did nothing to help me get over my cold any faster. Others may have a different experience than I.

This is a good alternative for those who can't get the mute wire out or those that used the mute wire. The kit comes as pictured. installations is simple. My only issue with this kit is that it is over priced for what you get. The same seller sells  these on ebay for under $10 with free shipping but he/she charges shipping here on amazon.

I have been using 2 of these bulbs in an outdoor motion sensing light for about 4 months now without any issues.  The description for these light says "3000K warm white" but in reality these are more green than white. The light output is still decent, it lights up my back yard. but if you are looking for really bright lights then these may not be for you.

Some of these sellers are sending generic cable and not an original pioneer cable. The cable I received had no pioneer literature with it and after just one use the 30 pin fell apart. I had to buy a real pioneer cable from a local audio shop and that works great.

Really didn't need a spindle of 50 discs, but given the low cost I went for bulk. Haven't had to burn a CD/DVD in a long while (years) and now that I have a need, I couldn't find my old stock of discs. The spindle came on time, and so far I haven't run into any bad discs. Using Nero to do the burning. I'm happy with my purchase.

Needed a few of these 8GB thumb drives - so I purchased four of them. As you can see from the product photo, these are very small, but they work like the regular sized ones. They are formated as FAT32 which is what I needed for the older device I plan on using these for. I'm happy with the thumb drives and my purchase.

Yeah I know, this is an old version of the software from back in 2010. I purchased this to install on a Windows 7 computer from that same year. I figured that this older version of VideoStudio would work better and have less conflicts than if I bought the latest and greatest made for Windows 10. Anyway, all I plan on using this for is to make some video slideshows of pictures - so even this old package is a bit of overkill for doing that. Software works fine and I'm happy with it.

Solar light was dead-on-arrival. Disassembled it instead of returning it for a refund. Found that the rechargeable battery was a dud. Everything else worked like it suppose to. Soldered in a replacement battery and the unit worked OK. Since I had to crack the weatherproof sealed globe, I ended up just keeping this light out of the weather - sitting on a covered porch where it could get some sun. Not that happy getting a dud unit, but given it was fairly inexpensive and I was able to fix it - I'm satisfied with the light.

Wanted to upgrade my five year old computer to have some USB 3.0 ports. This Inateck expansion card seemed to me the most economical one with the best reviews. The card was easy to install, and other than a slight complication with installing the driver software I had this card up an running in less than 15 minutes. The complication with the driver was I had two choices of drivers to install - Red Card and Green Card. Had no clue what that was suppose to mean - then I realized it was asking what color the card was - Doh!. Installed the green.I installed this on a PC running MS Windows 7 Pro. I hooked up an external 4TB hard drive (USB 3.0) and the data transfer rate was way better than what I was getting with my 2.0 ports. I'm very happy with my purchase.

This past year I've sort of gotten into small digital cameras. First I bought a dash-cam for my car, and then later purchased one of the Polaroid Cube's and a Mobius action camera. Since then I've been thinking of getting one of the quad-copters to either use with one of those cameras or one with it's own camera. Problem is I don't really know anyone who actually has some to ask for advice. So I was happy when I was offered an advance copy of this Dummies book on the subject.I have to say it's very informative - I've been able to find answers to my questions and to ones that I hadn't even thought to ask. This book isn't the end-all be-all source of information on drones/quad-copters, but I would have to say that it's a good place to start. I'd recommend it to someone like me - starting from scratch with little or no prior knowledge.Still haven't decided if I'm going to buy one - besides learning about them, I want to first try some out and see how easy they are to operate. Maybe by next summer.

This game is played a bit different than the regular Monopoly games. There are some similarities though. You get four tokens (and passports), so that seems to limit the number of people who can play. The object of the game is to collect passport stamps - the person to fill their passport first wins. The game starts off with all the major stamps placed on the board - a specific sized one for each property. There are some generic gray stamps that stay in the bank. Landing on a spot you have the option to buy that stamp or it can get auctioned off. When a player lands on a spot that you have the stamp for - the owner is paid a 'Visitor Fee' (basically like rent in the regular game). Another difference are the Here & Now cards and the Chance cards. I think these are what makes the game fun to play. The things the cards can let you do makes the game challenging - just when you think you're going to get ahead, another player can use one of their cards and put a damper on your play. Makes for some lively social interactions (if you get my drift). The dice is a bit different - one die has a icon in the place of the 1 pip (sort of reminds me of the speed die). That icon is the 'Sneaky Swap', it can also still be the 1 in some rolls.Overall I have to say I've enjoyed trying out this new game (can't say the same for everybody here). I think we're still getting use to the way the game plays compared to regular Monopoly. The games tend to be a bit short - about an hour, but that might be because we still stop a bit and look at the rules to figure out what we're doing. Plus, given the different international locations on the board, we sometimes stop and an go look up where something is. (Helps to keep a globe handy). Fun game - and a bit educational.

Basic electric alarm clock. I like the large numbers. Purchased this to replace my old clock radio alarm clock, one that I've been using for more than 30 years. Hated to have to replace it. This new clock is fairly small and is just an alarm clock, which is fine for my needs. The alarm is a fairly annoying piezoelectric sounder that intermediately buzzes when the alarm goes off. There is a huge snooze button on top of the clock, but to actually turn the alarm off you have to find the slider switch on the back and use that. Problem is there is an identical slider switch on the other side of the clock (which is what you use to set the time & alarm). Hopefully I'll get in the habit of using knowing with to use.Setting the clock up timewise couldn't have been easier. Other than that all I needed to do is put in a 9-volt battery and plug the clock in. So far I'm happy with my purchase.

This is the first book that I've read in this series, and I think my first from this author. I thought the book was fine, it's the type of story that I like to read. My only issue is that I think I might have liked it better if I had read some of the previous books before this one. I do plan on picking up the first in the series and reading that too.Like I mentioned, the action/intrigue/thriller genre is a favorite of mine and with this novel you get a lot of that. The story is centered around a team of characters from various agencies and law enforcement who are trying to deal with what at first appears to be terrorists, but it's not as simple as that. There some twists involved - which was sort of expected. I enjoyed reading this and I'm happy to find a new author who's work I enjoy and look forward to reading some more of the series.

I've been using Remington razors ever since I started shaving many years ago. My first razor was an clunky model PM850 (which I still have and it still works). Even now, the two razors I use pretty much every day are a Remington DA 307 foil razor and a Remington model R-6150 rotary head razor. So when I was offered one of these new model PF7300 foil razors to try out for a month, I happily accepted it.The razor is very light-weight, I'm guessing it has a smaller battery & motor in it than the more expensive models. The power transformer is smaller and has a different plug on the end than the regular line of razors - looking at the voltage, that is different too (4.0V). Which I'm guessing why there is a different plug, so as not to use the wrong one. Since I've only been using this razor for the occasional shave and touch-up, I've only had to charge it twice since getting it. The charge seems to last a decent enough time.The razor does a pretty good job with my semi-heavy beard - but it's definitely not as powerful as my regular foil razor.  Still, I can see keeping a razor like this at the office or in your travel bag for those times when you need to freshen up a bit. I also think this would be a good inexpensive razor for a teenager just starting to shave.
Popular groups covering the iconic theme music for old Saturday morning cartoons. I had the audio CD and wanted to see the videos. Drew Barrymore as host is a bonus.
Purchased this 64GB memory card for my new LG G4 phone. Wanted a lot of room for music and taking photos. Chip working great - no problems. I'm happy with my purchase.

Purchased this so as to be able to hook up my old Pioneer LaserDisc player to my 1080p television. The best output the laserdisc player has is s-video. My tv has an s-video input (which I was using), but that was only getting me 480i. I was hoping with this upscaling converter to get a little better picture. I have to say that it's really hard to tell if the picture is any better than before. It's now 1080p - but given the source resolution it still looks just a tad better than VHS.I'm giving the converter five stars as it's doing what it's suppose to. The unit was easy to setup. There are just two buttons, one switches the output between 1080p & 720p and the other from s-video input and the composite video. There is a wall transformer that powers the converter. Anyway, I'm happy with my purchase.
What can I say - I saw this Kindle book on Amazon and just had to buy it (wonder why). Happy with with my purchase.Actually this is a decent book on the subject.

The batteries I got seem legit (reading some of the previous reviews gave me concerns). The packaging looks like the Energizer packs I've purchased locally. Tested all of the batteries with a battery tester and in several color changing LED tea lights (which is what I bought these for), they checked out fine. I'm happy with the product and the price I paid - what more can I say about ten button batteries..

Just finished the new book, found it to be as good as the first one. Really enjoying this series and can't wait till the next out is available. One minor complaint I might have is the book ends a bit abruptly, but I assume the next book will pick up from there. I'm happy with my purchase.

Picked this hand exerciser up during a recent Gold Box Lightning Deal sale and I'm happy with my purchase. I was looking to buy something like this and this one seems to be just perfect for my needs. I like that it is adjustable from 20~90 pounds with just a few turns of the knob (the yellow bit on the front of the unit). Twisting the knob causes the end of the spring to move farther down from the fulcrum point increasing the resistance needed to squeeze the grip. The unit seems well made for how inexpensive it was. I'm happy with it and thinking of buying a second one to keep at work.

I'm happy with the t-shirt. The fit is a little smaller than what I was expecting for XL - fits more like a large. The t-shirt is a Jerzees HiDensi-T which is a pretty good shirt. I washed the shirt as soon as I got it and threw in a white towel just to see if there would be any color bleeding - the towel came out unstained. There is a tag (two actually) on the collar - I ended up cutting them off as they are pretty scratchy. If I had to complain about anything, the only thing that might be is the GD logo silkscreen is a bit fuzzy. There is some small text underneath it which didn't print very legible - the larger parts are fine though. I'm happy with my purchase.

Pretty much does what it's suppose to - scoop ground coffee out of the bag. The amount of coffee this scoop holds is enough for my single cup of coffee in the morning. I'm happy with it, but I thinking of getting one of the ones with a longer handle.

I'm constantly needing to measure something (or so it seems). And I get tired of looking for the tape measure because nobody seems to bother putting it back where it goes. So when I ran across these Stanley Fatmax keychain tape rules I picked up a couple to keep around the house. Not really planning on using either of these for keys, but I do like that they have that loop on them. I took a bit of light chain and attached the one tape measure to one end and screwed the other end of the chain to my work bench. Sort of along the lines of those pens on chains that you use to see in banks. Hopefully that will keep it around when I need it.These tape measures seem to be well built - thoughts same as the bigger units that Stanley makes. I like that you can lock the tape in position. Not really sure how long the rewind spring will last, that is usually the first thing that gets glitchy on these tape rules. But right now the rewind action seems smooth. I'm happy with the two I purchased.

Wanted an inexpensive case with a built-in kickstand - this one filled that need. It also came with a screen-protector and a stylus. Didn't really need the stylus, but I appreciated getting the screen-protector. The case is very plasticly and makes for a lumpy bump in your pocket - but it does the job and fits the phone snuggly.

I was all excited to be able to try out one of these new LG G4 phones and had been reading everything I could on them before it was sent to me. Which I think is the source of my disappointment in this phone. Apparently Verizon felt the need to disable a number of the features that LG put into the phone. One being the FM radio. That was something I was really expecting to be there. It is something my current cell phone has and something that I use a lot while at work. While it might seem to be a small thing, it's pretty much the deal breaker for me.Add to that, that I also took the phone into the local Verizon store with the intent of transferring over my cellphone account to them. Going in Saturday morning I found the store empty except for the three employees. So I was able to sit down with one and not only discuss changing service but had him go through the features and functions of the phone. Apparently he was demoing a G4 himself and been using it for awhile. Asking him about the FM radio he said it had been disabled, but that I could use Verizon's Slacker Radio app instead â€“ but just remember that will make use of your data plan. He also mentioned that the theme feature was disabled as well as the multi-use profile function. Getting to talking about actual service plans â€“ he suggested since this was a demo, to go with their no-contact monthly pre-pay plan. And that for $45 I could get unlimited calls & text and 1GB of data. Hmm, that's less than what I'm getting with my current provided I told him â€“ for $45 I'm getting the same calls & text, but also 5 GB of data. Yes, he said â€“ but Verizon's network is so much better. How much better?, I asked. With my current 4G LTE service I can watch You-Tube videos with no problems and stream music and watch videos. That's around here he said â€“ if you travel you probably wouldn't have that same level of service. Problem I have with that, I don't really travel. So in the end I passed on switching my service over.So I've been just using the phone without cell service and connecting via wifi. I have to say the LG phone itself is great â€“ it takes fantastic pictures. And the speed of the processors make apps fly. I even like that the main buttons are on the back of the phone in the center. I especially like the Amazon suite that the phone comes preloaded on the phone. It combines all the other  Amazon apps together into one screen.I also purchased a case for the phone and a 32GB micro-SD card. I was happy to find that there are a lot of different cases available for this new phone (there doesn't seem to be any for my current phone).So in the end, I love the LG G4 phone itself, just don't like how Verizon disabled it so that you had to use their data plan instead. (Which is why I'm giving it three stars.) So if you're thinking of getting one of these â€“ get the phone somewhere else than Verizon.

First off, I'm a big fan of Ed McBain's other series - 87th Precinct, and I'm a fan of the Hard Case Crime series of books. So I was very happy to get an advance reader copy of this 'new' book. I put new in apostrophes because this story was actually written decades ago. The story reflects that â€“ it is set I'm guessing in the mid to late 50's. A time when it cost you a dime to use a payphone. Two dollars could get you a taxi ride to the other side of the city. And ten dollars would get you two hits of heron.The story centers around Ray Stone â€“ a piano player with a serious drug habit, who wakes up one morning to find a dead girl in bed next to him. He then tries to find his next fix and along the way decides to also find out who killed the girl â€“ all the while trying to keep ahead of the cops who are looking for him.The story was pretty good â€“ not quite the same as the 87th Precinct series. And I had a hard time imagining a strung out drug addict functioning enough to play detective. I did like the feel of the time that the story conveyed. So I'm giving the story 4 stars. Coming in at around 200 pages this is was a very quick read. Included in the book was the 21 page short story â€œDie Hardâ€.

Enjoyed the book. Thought that it was a good continuation of the series. However, I think the first book was slightly better. There are a few typos, but nothing that is too distracting. I'm looking forward to the next book in the series.

I was in need of a new audio cable this week-end while away on a car trip. Stopped at one of the local big-box stores and picked up one of these. It was inexpensive and it worked for what I needed it for (connecting a cell phone to the car stereo to listen to music). So I'm pretty happy with my purchase of the product. The audio quality was fine.

Purchased this to give as a graduation present. I've had one of these little books for years and think it is an essential source of information - better than an encyclopedia (and a whole lot easier to carry around). It's got a lot of technical stuff, but also a lot of stuff for regular people too. Highly recommend.

The seeds I got did not sprout. I split the seeds into two groups - holding 1/2 back. The first batch I followed the instructions on the package. Which were;Start indoors in any season. Soak in water for 24 hours then cold stratify for 30 days. Sow seed 1/16" deep in lightly mulched seed bed and tamp in soil. For the seed bed I used one of the Jiffy 5710 12-Pellet Indoor Plant Start Greenhouses. Got no sprouts. I then tried just soaking the second batch of seeds in water for 12 hours and planting them in another of the Jiffy seed starters. Which is a technique that I usually used in the past with other plant seeds and have been successful. Still nothing.I don't think it's bad seeds - just that they are hard to start. I may try doing these chocolate vines again next year.Just a note - my two star review is mainly for my disappointment at my not successfully starting these seeds. I was still happy with my purchase - the order was filled adequately.

I'm happy with the trash bags, but I'm a bit confused with them too.I readily accepted a sample of these Hefty Extra Strong - Multipurpose 30 Gallon large trash bags. But when I got them in the mail, they looked familiar to me. Upon arriving home I found out why. The trash bags I'm currently using are the Heft Extra Strong - Trash Can Liner 33 Gallon extra large trash bags. The boxes look identical. My confusion is why have both a 30 gal bag and a 33 gal one. Putting the two different bags up together to see the differences in measurements - one is about 3 inches longer (side-ways) than the other, and one is about two inches longer (from top to bottom). So the Trash Can style is wider, but the Multipurpose is longer. Other than that, the plastic is the same thickness (1.05mil). Not trying to complain - just making an observation.I'm happy with the product (both of them). I actually purchased the Mega Pack of the extra large bags with the intent of cleaning out my garage last month - but with all the rain we've been having that project hasn't progressed as far as I wanted. These heavy-duty Hefty bags have worked well for what I have been able to do. I've been setting the filled bags out for trash pickup without putting them in the bin and haven't had one break open on me yet.

I've been needing something like this. Getting older, I've had a few scary moments in the bathroom when I've slipped coming out of the bath or shower. No major injuries - but I did pull a towel bar off the wall once. This grab bar is a definitely lot more substantial than that towel bar.Placement of the grab bar was something I thought awhile on. I wanted it to be useful for both the tub and the shower stall that are in my master bathroom. The location needed to be also suitable for attaching the mounting brackets, as they need to be screwed into some framing studs. In the end I installed the grab bar vertically on the end of the wall separating the shower and the bath. Doing that also ensured that there would be plenty of solid wood for the screws.Mounting the grab bar took probably thirty minutes - and that including the time needed to get my shop vac out and clean up the dust. You have to first mount a pair of brackets, which come already attached to the bar. Basically you hold the bar to the wall where you are planning on putting it, and mark where the holes need to be drilled for the mounting screws. I went ahead and put three screws into each bracket. The screws are about three inches long and you really need to follow the instructions and use the correct sized drill bit for the holes. Too small and you're not going to be able to put in the screws, too big and the screws may not be secure. Once you got the holes made, it's as simple as screwing in six screws to mount the bar. Then when you have done that, you have to remove the bar itself so that you can put on the end caps that cover the brackets. There are three tiny set screws that hold the bar to the brackets - removing them took some dexterity (least for me). Putting them back in even more. These things are tiny and the allen-head wrench that comes with them is small too. I lost one of the set screws trying to put it back in it's hole. You actually get two spares (so I imagine I'm not the only one who lost one).The bar looks great. It's shiny chrome - which actually matches the rest of the fixtures in my bathroom (which are also Moen products). Pulling on the bar to test it - you can tell it is a heavy-duty fixture. I'm very happy with the look of it. Hopefully I'll never be in the position of needing it - but I'm glad to know it's there if I do.

Purchased this mount so that I can use one of these Polaroid Cube Mini Lifestyle Action Cameras as a dash-cam. I needed something that the camera's magnetic mount would attach to. This mount came with a couple of stick-on 1-5/8" x 5/8" metal strips that you can postion where you need them. The strips work perfectly with the camera. The suction cup seems to hold the mount & camera to the windshield securely. I'm very happy with my purchase, it's pretty much exactly what I wanted.

I have been waiting years for this, years!! Well, a lot of us have been waiting years for this. Luckily Universal Studios didnâ€™t let Raimi use the original cut for Army of Darkness (originally titled Medieval Dead and with a different ending where Ash uses the Necronomicon to return home but ends up in a post-apocalyptic future). For years there were rumors of another Evil Dead film, or a reboot, but since television has gotten so good, Iâ€™m really glad that this was the medium they chose to tell more adventures of Ashley J. Williams.I watched the pilot Halloween night on Starz as was intended, and it was everything I wanted it to be. Bruce Campbell was perfection as always, it was so amazing to see Bruce back in the role of Ash after all these years, itâ€™s almost like no time has passed. After picking up a girl and taking her back to his trailer, they â€œpartyâ€ and to impress her Ash reads a bit from the Necronomicon, not a good idea. Never read from the book! There are tons of awesome deadites in the pilot, lots of creepy and gross moments that harken back to Evil Dead 1 and 2. I love all the call backs to ED 1 and 2, music cues and flashbacks (though there is no mention of Army of Darkness at all, maybe in future episodes but that adventure was not mentioned in this first episode). I want to say more but I wonâ€™t spoil anything either. I loved that there was more Three Stooges style slap stick humor, this just felt right at home with the rest of the films.Ash is a lone hero, but often times his stubbornness and arrogance gets in him in trouble. Luckily for Ash, he has some help. Ray Santiago plays Pablo, Ashâ€™s coworker who looks up to Ash and sees the potential in him to be a true hero. Dana DeLorenzo plays Pabloâ€™s friend and also works with Pablo and Ash, she doesnâ€™t really see Ash in the same light that Pablo does. We are also introduced to Jill Marie jones as Amanda Fisher, a cop who runs into some deadites and has a very brief encounter with Lucy Lawless who plays Ruby. Sam Raimi gives us a lot to chew on in the pilot, but is also keeping a lot secret, I get the feeling there will be some great mysteries to be revealed throughout the season. The humor, the action, the horror, itâ€™s all on point. This is everything I wanted it to be and more. I think any fan of Evil Dead 1 and 2 or Army of Darkness is really going to enjoy watching more adventures of Ash vs. Evil Dead. FULLY APPROVED.

I can easily say that the best things about The Phantom Menace was pod racing, and the lightsaber duel against Darth Maul. Most of the marketing for Phantom Menace really pushed Darth Maul too, his face was everywhere, and he looked great. S.H. Figuarts did a stellar job of capturing the likeness of Ray Park who played Darth Maul on screen. This figure is just so nice. Of all the characters from the prequel trilogy that could be turned into an action figure, Darth Maul would be at the top of my list.Now I understand why people dislike the prequel trilogy, I get it. But I still think Darth Maul was great, he was very Boba Fett, a lot of style, great design, very few lines of dialogue, dead super quick. This figure really captures the essence of the character, the accessories and articulation really help bring this figure to life. Darth Maul comes with fisted hands attached out of the box, a set of dual bladed holding hands, a set of single bladed holding hands, and a set of force push or action hands. We also get his lightsaber hilt which the blades plug into holes on both ends, and then there is the cut lightsaber hilt (after Obi-Wan cut Maulâ€™s lightsaber hilt in half in Phantom Menace) as well as an alternate head with a very intense grimace.S.H. Figuarts continues to impress. This weekend they are putting on a show and showcasing their future figures for their Star Wars line. Weâ€™ll be getting Kylo Ren, Captain Phasma and First Order Troopers from The Force Awakens. Weâ€™ll also be getting Mace Windu and Jango Fett from Attack of the Clones, as well as Han, Luke and Chewie from A New Hope. Itâ€™s a great time to be a collector of 1/6th scale Star Wars action figures. I really loved Figuarts Luke from Return of the Jedi, I think Darth Maul might actually be a better figure. I think the likeness to the actor is spot on, I think this figure is extremely accurate to the source, the articulation and accessories are great. S.H. Figuarts is using a new process to apply faces where they essentially print on the face so itâ€™s accurate and no bleeding or missed sections. This is a fairly small figure and the fact that his eyes and teeth and small earring and face paint are applied so immaculately is a testament to Figuarts new technology. The dual horizontal and vertical butterfly joints in the shoulders allow for a great range of realistic motion. I applaud S.H. Figuarts for their attention to accurate detail, their ability to push the boundaries and use new technology, and their clear love for the license they have. This is a must own figure, very much worth the $50 price point. This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

Iâ€™ve had this figure on pre-order for quite some time, and now that itâ€™s finally here in hand, I am not disappointed at all. This figure was worth the wait. I was young when Batman the Animated Series aired, but I watched the first episode when it played, and Iâ€™ve loved it ever since. For me, this is the definitive Batman. Kenner put out a line of BTAS figures back around â€™92 when the show debuted, I had the Power Belt Batman which was really the only figure in the Kenner line that looked like this, like how Batman looked on the show. I loved that figure, and I love this figure too.Gone are the days of the brittle, clear joints that DC Collectibles had been using for their BTAS line, this figure is rock solid. The joints are stiff, the small ankles hold up this broad shoulder crime fighter. The joint holes at the hips are gone, this figure is aesthetically pleasing both in design and execution. If I had to list complaints there wouldnâ€™t be many. I wish maybe there had been some shadowing or a thin line painted on the lip area to make it stand out more, and an additional cape that covered his body, like when Batman is in full on detective mode and hiding in the shadows. Other than that, and some limited range or articulation, this is an amazing figure.Aside from the grapnel gun and batarang, you get two sets of hands. The figure comes packaged with fists attached, you get two batarang holding hands and two open grip hands, presumably for the grapnel gun. And like previously released Batman and Robin figures, you also get an additional hand with the grapnel gun sculpted in, which is great. Also included is the figure stand with turn around images on it. Not tons of accessories, but all the appropriate ones. Since all of these figures are episode specific in their design and release, I understand why they donâ€™t include a bevy of accessories with each figure. There is no diaphragm or ab crunch and the arms at the elbow donâ€™t quite hit 90 degrees, but you can still get this figure in some good action poses, especially with the grapnel gun or batarang.I love BTAS, and I love this Batman figure. DC Collectibles made good with a lot of customers after qc issues when this line started, and theyâ€™ve clearly learned from and corrected their mistakes. This line keeps getting better and better and I canâ€™t wait to see what other figures they have prepared for this line. I know next summer we will be getting Raâ€™s Al Ghul and Commissioner Gordon. Keep â€˜em coming DC. If youâ€™re a BTAS fan, get this figureâ€¦ now! This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

I am relatively new to collecting Hot Toys figures. Earlier this year I bought my first figure from Hot Toys, Guardians of the Galaxyâ€™s Star Lord, which is an amazing figure, a work of art really. I also ended up getting the Rocket and Groot 2-pack from Guardians of the Galaxy as well, and again Hot Toys just knocked it out of the park with the sculpts, paint and accessories. Now we get Han Solo, Captain of the Millennium Falcon, and I am yet again just blown away by the craftsmanship on this figure. Hot Toys is just killing it this year with their Marvel and Star Wars lines. I took a bunch of pictures of Han (which the pictures donâ€™t really do him justice, so much better in hand) because in different lighting and from different angles he looks more lifelike and more like Harrison Ford. From afar, this just really looks like Hot Toys took a time machine to 1977 and shrunk down Harrison Ford in his Han Solo costume and boxed him up just for me. This figure just looks real.The box is a slip box like a shoebox and has a nice piece of art lying over the clamshell where the figure is. What we get is the figure, a swappable hair piece (for wearing the headset) a headset, a comlink, two pairs of ungloved hands and 3 pairs of gloved hands, DL-44 Heavy Blaster Pistol (and if you ordered from the Hot Toys site you got the Stormtrooper Belt with the E-11 Blaster Rifle) and you also get extra wrist pegs and magnets for the holster (the snap on the holster is magnetic, nice). There is also a display stand with a crotch cradle for keep the figure upright securely and displayed in essentially whatever pose youâ€™d like.The head sculpt, the body, the tailored clothing, the accessories, the stand, the articulation, the paint, this is just a work of art. If you are a Star Wars fan and absolutely love Han Solo (like many of us do) and you have around $200 to throw down, I highly suggest you purchase this figure before itâ€™s out of production. Once this figure is gone, the price will just keep going up. And man, this is a figure to own. I know the high price tag can put a lot of people off, and I get it, I do. Throwing down $200 plus on a toy is kinda crazy, but this is more than a toy. This is cutting edge technology utilized by some of the most talented sculptors on the planet to bring to life one of the most iconic film characters ever. This is a piece of art, an action figure, a dream come true really. Each year since Iâ€™ve been alive there have been new Han Solo figures released. I have pretty much all of them. In the last 30 years Iâ€™ve acquired some 35 different Han Solo figures or more. This, this is the one to own, this figure is the closest to the real deal you could possibly get. Art can be expensive, this figure is wearing hand tailored clothes, has a hand painted face, comes from Hong Kong, so yea it can be a bit pricey. To me, itâ€™s worth the price. Hot Toys made another masterpiece with their Han Solo figure, this comes FULLY APPROVED.

This book is great. This is the Enchiridion from Adventure Time and Marceline the Vampires Scrapbook. The book was bigger than I thought it would be which is a great surprise. This book is about double the size of the Adventure Time Encyclopedia (which this book is a great companion to) and I like that half the book is the Enchiridion and the other half (just flip the book over) is Marcelineâ€™s Scrap book. Both halves of the book get a good number of pages to impress and expand on the ever growing world of Ooo.I really like all the detail, you can tell this was made with love and fans of the show (Written by Martin and Olivia Olson who both play characters on Adventure Time, Olivia plays Marceline). Thereâ€™s cool little things like taped down pieces, tons of little scribbles and sketches. I really like the parchment style scrolls and spell sections in the Enchiridion and the hand drawn sketches in the scrapbook. This book is really great for the price (under $20) this is a great book for any fan of Adventure Time, and can really be appreciated by anyone of any age. I didnâ€™t want to show too many pictures and spoil the good stuff, lots of good jokes and Easter Eggs inside the book(s). The Adventure Time Enchiridion and Marcyâ€™s Super Secret Scrapbook is mathematical and you have to get it, FULLY RECOMMENDED.

As a big fan of Tim Seeley's Hack/Slash, I was super excited to get this. There isn't a whole lot of merchandise for this comic series. This statue is PVC, the bat and Vlad's mask come in the box separate and are pretty easy to place into Cassie's hands. The paint is applied really well and clean, nice quality for the price. FULLY APPROVED.

Poe Dameron, an X-Wing pilot, is one of the new Episode VII Force Awakens figures from the Black Series line that I was a bit lukewarm about. I saw some pictures of the figure and expected to get a wonky painted face. Luckily for a figure I ordered here on Amazon and didnâ€™t get to hand pick, I got a great figure. People have complained about the sculpt not looking like the actor Oscar Isaac who plays Poe Dameron, but I donâ€™t think the sculpt is the issue, I think itâ€™s the subpar Hasbro paint job that kills this figure for most. But like I said, I was lucky enough to get a good one, so Iâ€™m pleasantly surprised.All I know of Poe Dameron is heâ€™s Black Leader for a squadron of X-Wings. I really like the updated flight suit that he wears, it keeps enough of the aesthetics of the old trilogy but with a cleaner more modern look. The helmet looks a little big and odd from the front, from the sides and back it looks ok. Maybe the proportions are off or itâ€™s just not the best helmet sculpt, I like the figure without the helmet better. Aside from the helmet we get a set of hands without flight gloves that have wrist articulation (the black gloved hands only have a cut at the wrist where you peg in the hands, so theyâ€™re not ideal for gun holding) and swapping out the hands was easy enough. You also get a pistol that holsters nicely onto Poeâ€™s belt. Articulation is on par with what weâ€™ve been getting from the Black Series, the flight suit harness can make posing the legs a bit tricky as It tends to be in the way. Also, the upper torso articulation on my figure was very stiff, took some finagling to get it loose.Iâ€™ve been really pleased with these first issue releases of Black Series figures for the Force Awakens. Weâ€™ve gotten a good balance of heroes and villains, and weâ€™ve gotten a few female characters as well. Canâ€™t wait to see what figures will be released next. If you can only find a few of these figures, this is one to get. Poe Dameron comes with some cool accessories, has a cool look and design and poses well. Hopefully you can find one at a reasonable price and with a decent painted face. This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

This is one of those rare occasions where I have a figure I know nothing about, so this review is only on the figure itself. I think the design is great, I canâ€™t say how accurate this figure is to the source as Iâ€™ve seen no photos of this character. The anticipation for Episode VII The Force Awakens is real, and Iâ€™m grabbing all the cool looking figures I can at reasonable prices. The Hasbro 6â€ Black Series figures shouldnâ€™t cost more than $20 upon their release. Figures that are out of production like X-Wing Pilot Luke, Darth Maul, R2-D2 will all run closer to $100, but all of these Force Awakens figures are still in production. Right now theyâ€™re selling out quickly, but within the next few weeks you should be able to find them. I check Amazon daily so Iâ€™ve had some good luck.Guavian Enforcer, weird name. Sounds like some sort of fruit loving killer. The design though, I love the helmet, I love the very intricate line work in the suit. I got really clean paint applications on this, no bleeding or missed portions. The thigh cuts were super stiff, but with a little time and care, I got them to move. The articulation overall is like all of the other figures in the Black Series line. The wire on this figures left leg looks like it would make for issues when posing, but I didnâ€™t have any issues, I was able to pose him/her/it, (no idea if this character is a robot or a girl or a girl robot or what) without issue. The guns fit well enough into the figures hands, only the right hand has a trigger finger but the left hand still holds the guns ok. For a character I know nothing about, this is a great looking figure with an awesome sculpt, decent articulation (head articulation is the best weâ€™ve gotten from any Black Series figure yet, head can look all the way up) some cool weapons and a unique design. I canâ€™t wait to see what this Guavian Enforcer is all about. This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

This shirt is great. I've had some hit or misses when buying T-shirts here on Amazon. Either they fit funky, or the design washes off and fades (and not in a cool retro way, but a crappy quality s#&$@y kind of way). This shirt fits perfect (I'm 5'7" and 160 pounds, ordered a large) and it's soft. I washed it before wearing and the image didn't fade or crack at all. The shirt color and image are exactly as pictured. It's great to have such a cool shirt already for the Force Awakens so many months before release. And I'm really pleased it's exactly as pictured and good quality. For $15 this shirt is a no-brainer for anyone who wants a cool Episode VII shirt. I really wanted a good quality cool shirt with Kylo Ren and Captain Phasma, this is that shirt. FULLY APPROVED.

This fits great, the graphic didn't fade or crack after the first wash, it looks just like the picture, I'm pleased. There isn't a whole lot of options for Hellboy fans in the way of T-shirts, especially based on the comics and not the films. So this is a solid buy for any fan of the comics, FULLY APPROVED.

I like Hellboy, well really I love Hellboy. You kinda have to if you're going to pay $20+ for a giant sticker to put on your wall. Now this isn't a sticker, it doesn't have an adhesive on it like a normal sticker, it's something you can take off the wall and re-stick on another wall. Though I wouldn't recommend doing that too many times because this will eventually not stick as well and the corners will start to curl off the surface of the wall. This arrived rolled in a box, so that's good (no creases). I wiped down the wall I was going to put this on to get off any dust and hair. The biggest thing to note is that what I got is different than what is pictured. Underneath the Hellboy title, is a big symbol of the B.P.R.D. which was a very pleasant surprise. There is also a lot of black shading under the title so the decal itself is bigger overall than pictured. If you're a Hellboy fan and want something cool to put on your wall that doesn't involve hammers and nails, this is an affordable and cool way to go. FULLY APPROVED.

I don't like writing negative reviews, especially since I know they can influence peoples decision to purchase, but I cannot recommend this shirt. I love the cream color of the shirt, and the image itself. But The shirt is very uncomfortable (feels rough and stiff) and the graphic itself dissolved after one wash. I washed this shirt before ever wearing it (as one should) and after just one wash and never getting to wear it, most of Catwoman disappeared in the middle of her body, just cracked and washed right off. The product info on this shirt states "T-Shirt Will Not Fade, Crack or Peel After Multiple Washes", not true, this peels/fades/cracks after the first wash. And not in a cool vintage looking way. I doubt I'll end up wearing this shirt now, and for $20, I might as well have just ripped a twenty dollar bill in half and eaten it.

Iâ€™ve gotten a few of the DC Collectibles Batman: The Animated Series figures now, and I love them. They take me back to my childhood, which wasnâ€™t all that great, but Batman made it better. I feel bad for those who have had issues with DC Collectibles BTAS line, fragile joints that break, paint chipping, overall defects. Iâ€™ve managed to get lucky and get figures Iâ€™ve ordered online and not had any sloppy paint, and no breaking limbs or joints. The Batman and Joker and Catwoman I got all had stiff ankle joints and knee joints I could tell would snap if forced, I hit them with a blow dryer for 30 seconds, and no problem. Loosened the joints right up and now theyâ€™re fine. Yea, it sucks we have to do that, but the alternative is worse. If you plan on keeping your figure blistered to the card, Amazon may not be the best place to get yours. Amazon forces these figures into boxes that are too small, so the card will be bent/curved/folded. I planned on opening mine so I didnâ€™t care, and the cards the figures were blistered to werenâ€™t too badly destroyed, not as bad as some figures Iâ€™ve ordered from Amazon.So here we get the Joker, my favorite Joker to date. A little bit Romero, a little bit Nicholson, a lot Hamill. I know for a lot of people Mark Hamill is and always will be Luke Skywalker, and Iâ€™m sort of in that camp. But to me, Mark Hamill is and always will be the best Joker ever. He is able to do things with his voice that I just donâ€™t think anyone else can match, (though Troy Baker gets close to sounding like Hamillâ€™s Joker) Hamill has a hell of a voice. And DC Collectibles has made a hell of a figure. Here is Joker from the BTAS episode â€œThe Last Laughâ€ (if you have Amazon Prime you can watch all 4 volumes of BTAS for free, I highly suggest you do) as well as episode specific accessories from this episode.Youâ€™ll get two fists which are on the figure right out of the blister, two sets of gripping hands, and two sets of trigger finger type hands. You also get a small yellow handled knife, a very small blue comb (I mean very, very small), a pearl necklace, a clear breathing helmet and a scope. Joker can hold most of the accessories with some work and patience, but the tiny accessories are small and kind of pointless. I would have preferred a clock attached to a keg of dynamite, or a pistol, something better. I really like that there are scene specific accessories to this line of figures, but maybe DC Collectibles could have found a better episode to pull from, I donâ€™t know. But random accessories is better than none, so Iâ€™ll take â€˜em without any more complaints. Iâ€™ve read of some sloppy paint on the Joker, mine is great. The teeth are all painted well, the eyes, lips. I didnâ€™t have any problems with chipped paint on the gloved hands or anything. Thatâ€™s something to watch out for I hear. The articulation is on par with the rest of this wave and wave 1, stronger joints and no pin holes in the sculpt which is nice. The rubbery jacket doesnâ€™t hinder articulation much, if at all. Standard articulation, ball joint neck, ankle pivot, hinged hips, pretty much what weâ€™ve been getting. I am loving this series so far. Iâ€™ve been waiting years for figures like this, Iâ€™m really elated with this line. DC Collectibles is really winning me over with this series and their Arrow TV Series figures, theyâ€™ve picked up their game in the last few months. For the price, the sculpt and accessories, the Joker comes FULL Y APPROVED.

This figure is my favorite of the DC Collectibles Batman: The Animated Series so far. I canâ€™t say Iâ€™m a huge Robin fan, but I did like his character a lot in BTAS, and this figure does him justice. Overall I think the sculpt is fantastic, though a bit on the small side. Robin was fairly ripped in the show, here the figure looks more like a boy. Maybe the figure should have been a bit taller or more broad in the shoulders, but I still think itâ€™s an amazing action figure.Now Iâ€™ve read and watched reviews of these figures and have heard the complaints about the fragile joints and sloppy paint, though that seemed much more prevalent in the first series of figures released. I donâ€™t have any issue with my Robin figure. The paint is applied even and smooth and in all the correct spots, without any chipping. Aside from the head sculpt, I think the paint is the strongest part of this figure. Itâ€™s vibrant and bright, more so than any other figure in the series so far. Iâ€™ve read complaints about sloppy paint on this figure so be on the lookout if youâ€™re buying this in the store. I also like that they sculpted Robin with a smile, it gives more life to the figure.For accessories we get a bunch of alternate hands. We get two fists, two gripping hands, to flat hands, and a hand that has the grapple gun sculpted into it.  We also get a bola whip that seems to be a tad too short, a grapple gun that you can put into one of his hands, and an alternate cape that can be put on by removing his head and switching out the capes. One cape drapes over Robins shoulder and the other cape is more pulled back. I think this is a fantastic figure, I feel like itâ€™s stronger in terms of quality than the earlier releases from this line, but still a bit too thin to pose confidently or be rough with. I still found myself being very careful, I donâ€™t want to snap one of his skinny legs or ankles. I advise hitting these figures right outta the blister with some hot air from a blow dryer before moving any of the joints, just to be safe. I know I know, you shouldnâ€™t have to, but you do. So unless you want to be disappointed really quickly, Iâ€™d play it safe.

I like DC Collectibles figures, I think they look less cheap than most Marvel figures, which suffer from gummy/rubbery limbs and mediocre sculpts. Though DC Collectibles has been plagued with fragile joints as of late, I have not had any issues with any of my Batman the Animated Series figures.Man-Bat, one of my favorite characters from Batman the Animated Series. Granted heâ€™s basically a Jekyll and Hyde archetype, I loved the character design for Man-Bat in BTAS. I had the original figure from Kenner back in 1992, I just really like this iteration of the character and of Batman in general. BTAS is my most favorite version of Batman. This figure is solid, the design, the sculpt, all top notch. The paint application on mine is pretty great, there was a tad bit of extra white around one of the fangs, but I just scraped that off with my pocket knife and now it isnâ€™t an issue. The accessories are small but great, you get the tape recorder that has the sound of the Man-Bat attacking a security guard that Batman later uses to identify the source, and three little bottles of the serum from the BTAS episode â€œOn Leather Wingsâ€.The articulation is where Iâ€™m sure most people will complain. The legs are articulated well enough for my taste, and they are sturdy enough to hold the figure upright without the stand that the figure comes with, which is great. The head doesnâ€™t turn far enough up to get good flight poses for the figure, and the wings do not have any articulation at the elbow or wrists, which is unfortunate. Luckily the arms are easy enough to replace with the second set of arms. This figure comes with two sets of arms/wings which I think is awesome, so Iâ€™m not as bothered that neither set are articulated. The set of arms attached to the figure right out of the box are the outstretched flight wings. The second set of arms are with the wings mostly folded in, more for a walking around and fighting look. The arms just pop out at the shoulder and just plug right into the figure, fast and easy. Maybe a little too easy, since the large flight wings are a bit heavy they have trouble staying out in a flight position and want to dip down from the weight. Other than that, this is great. Itâ€™s a big figure in a bigger box than the other BTAS figures currently being produce by DC Collectibles and itâ€™s the same price, nice move DC! This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

This figure is a bit on the pricey side, but itâ€™s easily the best Captain America figure from The Avengers film on the market (save for the ¼ scale NECA Captain America but thatâ€™s a bit too big for my taste, and pricey). This is also the best likeness of Chris Evans in figure form out there. Some people complained that the face on this figure is too pale, I get that but it doesnâ€™t bother me. I think itâ€™d be more weird if he was really tanned. Is this figure worth $65? It depends on how much you like Captain America, or Captain America from the Avengers film. I like action figures quite a bit, and I like Japanese import figures, though they can be ridiculously overpriced. If this figure was $40 Iâ€™d have gotten 2. This figure really should be around the $40 mark, but what you get for $65 is still pretty awesome. And Iâ€™m a pretty big Captain America fan so I think itâ€™s worth it.I like when Figma includes multiple different faces and wish they had done so this time, but they didnâ€™t. Itâ€™d have been nice to have an angry fighting face or something. You can take off Capâ€™s face and move his eyes, thatâ€™s better than nothing. You also get the standard Figma stand and sandwich bag for all the accessories which I like quite a bit, a peg board with 4 sets of hands (two flat hands for holding the shield, 2 gripping hands, 2 lose gripping hands, two hands with the fingers flayed out for throwing the shield poses, and a â€œHulk Smashâ€ pointing finger (and Cap comes out of the box with two fisted hands, so 5 sets of hands in total , plus the right handed pointing finger). Now Iâ€™ve seen a lot of reviews complaining about the shield and the straps falling off. That wonâ€™t be an issue if you plug in the two straps correctly. Both straps fit into the shield very specifically in just one way and one way only, if you donâ€™t match the cuts in the shield and straps, itâ€™s going to keep falling off his arm. My only complaint about the shield is that it doesnâ€™t somehow attach to Capâ€™s back. The paint job on the shield is excellent, as well as the rest of the figure. I donâ€™t have any issues with bleeding or missed paint spots on my figure. The articulation is superb as always, Figma is really good about articulation for the most part. People have also complained about latissimus muscles on Caps back looking like wings when the figures arms are up. It doesnâ€™t bother me.Look, $40 or more for one action figure is a tough pill to swallow, I get it. So you have to decide how much you like action figures and how much you like Captain America. I love both of those things and I knew this figure would meet my expectations, and it did. It even exceeded them, this figure looks much better in person, pictures donâ€™t really do it justice. If you can find this figure cheaper Iâ€™d say pull the trigger without hesitation and get it. If youâ€™re on the fence because of the price, just weigh how much you love Cap and maybe save up for it, itâ€™s a fantastic action figure. This figure comes FULLY APPROVED.

People complain about the Revoltech joints and the ratchety sound they make when you move them, but that doesnâ€™t bother me. People seem to have too high a standard in how they grade an action figure, they are looking for perfection. When it comes to cheap, mass produced molded plastic, youâ€™re not going to get perfection, period. You canâ€™t even get perfection when you shell out $400 on a Sideshow Collectible figure. My expectations are simple, It shouldnâ€™t break out of the box, the paint should be at least 85% on the mark, and the accessories should fit in the figures hands and holsters. Rarely is a small 6â€ figure going to look exactly like the source (NECA got pretty close with their Arnold Schwarzenegger Predator action figures last year though), and rarely is there that perfect blend of asthetics and poseability. This figure gets awfully close though.I think this is the best Star Wars 6â€ figure currently available. I was a big fan of the first line of the Star Wars Black Series figures, but they seem to have gotten worse over the last few waves, save for a few figures here and there. I am eagerly looking forward to Bandaiâ€™s S.H. Figuarts Star Wars line slated to release around August of this year. After getting my hands on this Revoltech Stormtrooper, Iâ€™m pretty excited to see their Boba Fett figure that is scheduled to come out later this month. So whatâ€™s in the box? Here you get two fisted hands that are already on the figure out of the box, a right and left trigger hand, and a right and left gripping hand. You also get the standard E-11 blaster rifle, and the bigger DLT-18 Heavy Blaster Rifle. I think this is the most accurate looking Stormtrooper figure on the market to date in this scale. The fragility of some parts of this figure are what keep this from being perfect. Yes, this figure is just about perfect. The snap piece on the holster popped out of place just simply by holding the figure and posing it. I tried super gluing it back but the peg is so small it keeps popping out. It drives me nuts. I also snapped off the bottom piece of the DLT-18 rifle just seeing how sturdy it was (it is not sturdy, not at all). This isnâ€™t a super fragile figure, the joints are rock solid, but the rifle and the holster are weak, so watch out for that if youâ€™re taking yours out of the package.Aside from a few issues with the fragile nature of the holster and Heavy Blaster Rifle, this figure is damn near perfect. You can get this dude in any position you can think of. Revoltech did a fantastic job on the articulation with this figure and how the armor hides a lot of the joints, far more than any of their Iron Man figures. If you love Japanese import figures, Star Wars, or Stormtroopers, you have to get this. Iâ€™m serious, even with the issues, this is one of the best figures of the year so far and I doubt any other company will top this Stormtrooper any time soon. FULLY APROVED.

I love this figure. I was really pleased with the DC Collectibles Arrow 2 pack previously released with Arrow and Billy Wintergreen, I didnâ€™t think we would ever get action figures from this show. That 2 pack sold well and was received well, so now weâ€™re getting more figures and in single releases. Canary came out in January and thatâ€™s one of the best female action figures I own. It was accurate to the source and had great articulation and accessories, it was just an extremely solid figure. But this Deathstroke figure just takes the f%$#ing cake. This is my favorite figure of the year so far next to Revoltechâ€™s Stormtrooper (though that figure has some issues with fragility which bummed me out), the sculpt is source accurate, the articulation is great, the paint application is smooth and even, and  comes with plenty of good accessories.The metallic paint on the body armor looks great, there doesnâ€™t seem to be any recycled parts from the Billy Wintergreen figure from the Arrow 2 pack, the sculpted armor doesnâ€™t hinder the articulation. This is just another solid figure from DC Collectibles (who in the last year or so has been plagued with some serious quality control issues, Iâ€™ve had no problems with this figure at all) and I just flat out love the character of Deathstroke, I loved him even more after watching season 2 of Arrow. I think Manu Bennett brought something really magical to the character of Slade Wilson and his portrayal of Deathstroke. Deathstroke just looked really awesome in the show and itâ€™s represented really well in this figure. This figure comes with a pistol that can be holstered on his right leg, which is always a plus. I hate figures that come with pistols and holsters but the pistol cannot be holstered, itâ€™s just a waste. You also get a small knife that can be sheathed on the back of Deathstrokeâ€™s belt in a horizontal position and a large knife that can be sheathed on his left leg. You also get his katana that fits nicely into its sheath on his back.Iâ€™m really excited to see the rest of the figures slated to come out this year. Iâ€™ve seen in-hand pics of Floyd Lawton (Deadshot) floating around and for sale on ebay and he looks great. Later this year weâ€™ll get Felicity Smoak, Arsenal, John Diggle, and a Dark Archer. If youâ€™re a fan of the show and action figures, or a fan of Deathstroke, get this figure. I really liked the DC Arkham Origins Deathstroke figure but this version is even better, itâ€™s phenomenal. FULLY APPROVED.

I am listening to this right now, and it's bad ass. A quick wikipedia search tells me rappers Vast Aire and Vordula Mega joined talents under the name Cannibal Ox. I know nothing about hip hop, my music tastes are broad and diverse, but I love old school rap and this album reminds me of that. I grew up listening to west coast rap from the mid 1990's, like Keak Da Sneak and Mr. Doctor and E-40, Brotha Lynch Hung, and then others like Tribe Called Quest and the Beastie Boys. I don't listen to Kanye West or most new hip hop or rap, so I'm not sure how most people who listen to newer rap will feel about this, it is old school in the best way. There are just beat tracks with no lyrics, Bill Cosmiq killed it producing this. Great samples and synth and string work, awesome beats and great sound. Listening to this on headphones is the way to go, there are lots of back and forth from ear to ear sounds, Blade of the Ronin is just really well put together and mastered. I wish I could come across more random albums like this, it plays like a soundtrack to a film. If you like awesome music, rappers with good voices who don't yell or repeat the same s@ over and over again, I think you should take a chance on this. FULLY APPROVED.

Golden is the first book in a young adult magical realism series, with each of the books also being loose retellings of fairy tales. Author Melinda Michaels describes the story that way, but what is really happening is that the world she has created takes place after the fairy tale stories have all played out. This world deals with the descendants of the fairy tale characters. And that is really all I am going to tell you about the plot of the book, because I think so much of the magic in Golden lies in the suspense and intrigue that Melinda Michaels is so great at weaving into her story. There are wonderfully complex characters that while they themselves divide each other into good and bad guys, they are each so much more complicated and faceted than that. The characters were a joy to read about. Some you will be able to predict and others throw everything on their head.The book starts out with the main character Hanna reeling from a blackout she just had in school. This was scary for her because after her last blackout when she was eight, she lost all of her previous memories. Heck, I would be terrified of blackouts too! I really enjoyed Hanna. I liked that even though she knew her family was holding back on information, she didn't stop questioning them. I hate when characters in books know there are secrets being kept from them, and they ask a couple of times and then just let it go. Umm, no way would I let something important like that go. And Hanna didn't. My only hold up with Hannah was her tendency towards really reckless behavior. Like standing in front of a train (at all!) but then waiting there until the last possible second. That is something that I just cannot get on board with. But other than that, I thought Hanna was a great character. I loved watching her interact with everyone else in the story because all of the characters in Golden were so different! From Owen to that Vann guy, to Hanna's own grandparents. Everyone had their own personality and role and secrets. But some of them might not be what you think!Melinda Michaels does an excellent job weaving in surprises, and some not so surprises. She gives you enough foreshadowing so that you can figure out some things on your own, so you are not completely lost in the woods, but I promise that is not all she has in story for the readers. Not to mention the great romance as well. Mmm, I would love a side of William. I really enjoyed Golden and I cannot wait to see what is next from this author. I will certainly be reading it.*Disclaimer- I got a copy of this book for free in exchange for my honest review. I was not compensated for my thoughts.

Alive is one of those young adult books that has such a cool concept, that you can't not read it. Alive is about a teenage girl that gets a heart transplant, and then some strange and dare-I-say-it... creepy, things begin to happen. You cannot tell me that story doesn't sounds, original and flat out awesome, can you? Nope, I didn't think so. Alive is a great read. One that will leave you more than a little spooked.Stella is a character that I think could be very polarizing in the young adult book world. I can certainly see people getting frustrated with her, but it was really easy for me to put myself in her shoes and imagine how hard her recovery and every day life must be. I haven't gone through anything as traumatic as having a bad heart or needing a transplant, but Stella is a very easily relate-able character.Sure, she gets a bit of first boyfriend tunnel- vision, and sure she takes a couple craps on her friends, but put in context of everything that was going on, I got it. Now, don't get me wrong. I didn't give her a free pass for being a crappy friend more than once during Alive. In fact, I wanted to shake her every single time I imagined Henry's hurt feelings. Stella kind of went on a path of teenage destruction in parts of Alive. She is lucky that her friends are so awesome, because I know a lot of people that wouldn't not put up with half of her decisions. I know it seems like I am hating on Stella. but I'm not. Because even through everything I just mentioned, I was still on Team Stella. Why? Because of Chandler's writing. Chandler Baker made me care for Stella, because I understood Stella's motivations.I love Henry. I shipped hard for him in this book. Levi totally creeped me out.
