Cook, and has written over 20 books.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Destiny Defining Moments â€“ Be Ready to RespondNew York Times, bestselling author, T. D. Jakes opens the way for the reader to step up to a new level and potential for blessing in his book â€œUnlocked â€“ Step into Your Next-Level Moment.â€ Bishop Jakes draws from the lives of Old Testament prophets Elijah and Elisha to illustrate how to recognize your lifeâ€™s defining, next-level moment.Elisha allowed his encounter with Elijah to transform his life, give him vision, and the power and tenacity, to pursue, Godâ€™s plan for his life. Reflective questions at the end of each chapter encourage the reader to respond to the challenge of finding, releasing, and fulfilling Godâ€™s destiny for their life.A full chapter from Cora Jakes Colemanâ€™s book â€œFaith Itâ€ provides an opportunity to examine practical and parallel challenges for moving beyond spiritual paralysis to free you from feelings of failure to step into life on a new level. Selections from Bishop Jakes inspirational book â€œStrength for Every Momentâ€ are also included as a bonus to introduce new readers to his insightful devotional writings.â€œUnlocked - Step into Your Next-Level Momentâ€ redefines everyday living and empowers the reader for new levels of influence, ministry, and blessing.A complimentary review copy of this book was provided for review purposes. â€œClaiming Your Inheritanceâ€ is a field guide to life; a spiritual pilgrimage, a holy quest. Kaylor writes with clarity and passion. Her writing is more than just interesting; she writes with excitement transforming the truths of the scripture while giving encouragement, edification, and comfort.Kaylor introduces the concept of creating a Scripture book of your own. She carefully explains the value, the purpose, and the process.  I discovered some key action steps Iâ€™d like to develop as I start my â€œScripture Book,â€ these include: read the scripture intent on understanding for illumination, insight, and revelation, leading to  personal transformation, life change and intimacy with God. The suggested categories provide a road-map for finding topics that are specific for my journey.The book is filled with practical tools, tips, and â€œtake away principlesâ€ for personal application. I was reminded of the importance of drawing from the synergy of group dynamics, of relying on the Word as a weapon of intercession, as a counseling tool, and for receiving and giving prophetic direction.â€œClaiming Your Inheritanceâ€ is a book for every Christian yearning for spiritual growth while longing for the reality of a deeper connection with God.  The reader will be empowered to access God more intimately and to experience a richer more personal relational life with God and an understanding of what it means to walk with Him.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes, the opinions expressed are my own.

In his book â€œIn Pursuit of Purposeâ€ best-selling author Myles Munroe writes to encourage his readers to discover their purpose and develop their full potential. The book is written for those who desire a purposeful life characterized by effectiveness, efficiency, and fulfillment.Dr. Munroe encourages the reader to ask probing questions about themselves that will challenge and unleash purpose. These questions stimulate discussion and reflection that lead to motivation for taking action steps toward application the key principles covered in the chapter. I especially appreciate that the basis for every principle or key to personal fulfillment presented throughout the book is Biblically based.  The chapter summaries become resource tools for assimilation of the material.Of the many lessons I learned, three stand out: the chapter titled â€œPrinciples of Purposeâ€ helped me identify five people or influencers in finding  my lifeâ€™s purpose, to find out who I am, to be myself, recognize my special niche and work toward fulfilling my dreams.The principles regarding time and purpose helped me recognize the danger of mistaking busyness and distracting activity as productive purpose; this becomes an important reminder of the importance of prioritizing.I was challenged and inspired by the keys introduced in the chapter on â€œPurpose and Visonâ€ and the need to unify my decisions, companions, choices, and priorities in a quantitative and qualitative standard of measure. I was impressed with the importance of saturating each area of my life with prayer and to make it my goal to be â€œA Man after Godâ€™s Own Heart.â€

Features I like include:â€¢ Sturdy Attractive Storage Box with Velcro Closingâ€¢ Quality Construction, Light Weight for Ease in Transporting and Set Upâ€¢ Evenly Weighted Bean Bagsâ€¢ Smooth  Attractive Finishâ€¢ Ideal for Backyard Family Entertainment, Picnics, or Group Competitionâ€¢ Entertaining for All Ages, Children through Adultsâ€¢ Easy to Follow Instruction for Playing IncludedOne caution: You will not want to leave the game outside where it will be exposed to the dampness of dew, or an unexpected rain, as the board may be subject to warping.A great family entertainment investment!

In â€œReleasing the Divine Healer Withinâ€ Dennis and Dr. Jen Clark present a fresh new approach to understanding how Biblical truth and medical science interact in physical and emotional healing.Chapters one through four become the foundation for grasping the concept of the biology of belief and healing. Chapter five introduces actual stories of healing experiences that illustrate the principles presented. Other testimonies also appear throughout the book. The final chapters deal with insight into how Godâ€™s creative power is integrated with the heart, the bodyâ€™s cells, our emotions, genetics, and stress in the process toward health and Biblical healing.The Clarkâ€™s write with clarity; the bookâ€™s format is reader friendly.  There is a natural progression of instruction for understanding, followed with examples for assimilation, with suggestions for action steps to personal application. The features â€œPracticeâ€ and â€œTroubleshootingâ€ provide step by step ideas for entering into prayer, receiving results, and recognizing barriers. I appreciated the well documented chapter endnotes which provide the reader with a rich resource for future reading and study.â€œReleasing the Divine Healer Within - The Biology of Belief and Healingâ€ is an important reminder to every believer of the indwelling power the divine healer within each of us.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. Gene Edwards features selections on experiencing the deeper Christian life from three highly respected classical writers of the 1600s: Francois de Fenelon a godly French Archbishop in the Catholic Church, Michael Molines, Spanish born, influential throughout Europe through his â€œSpiritual Guide,â€ and Jeanne Guyon, the most read woman in Christian history.All three authors help the reader better understand elements important in a personal quest for embracing the cross, walking in Godâ€™s presence, and drawing into the inner chamber of fellowship with Him.I especially liked Fenelonâ€™s practical instructions in the devotional â€œCultivating Silence.â€ Molineâ€™s understands the reality of manâ€™s nature. This comes through in the thoughts expressed in his writing on â€œThree Kinds of Silence.â€ In the final section â€œStepping into His Presenceâ€ Guyon talks about how Godliness flows from within and of living in the abundance the spirit.The rich look and texture of the quality binding, add a touch of worship and reverence giving a sense of anticipation of the spiritual experience ahead for the reader. â€œ100 Days in the Secret Placeâ€ is an important addition to every Christianâ€™s classic devotional library and as an ideal gift for every occasion. Highly motivational, practical instruction, and spiritual insight,A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own. Add to Markus Wolfâ€™s creative imagination the visual craziness of Bob Crumâ€™s illustrations and your teens will be â€œlaughing out loudâ€ as they join in the antics of Superhero, Captain Crouton to put an end to the super villain â€œGluttonâ€ terrorizing the city of Decapolis.Readers will be entertained while learning important core values for application in their lives as they root for teenager, Carl Clayton, in his unique role as superhero Captain Crouton.â€œ3 Degrees Below Zeroâ€ is fun reading for all ages preteen â€“ through adults. I Had to Flex but Am Otherwise Quite SatisfiedOver the years I have had been monitoring my blood pressure at home between regular visits to my doctor. The Santa medical Wrist Digital Blood pressure is a replacement for one had had "given up the ghost on me" and quit working. I was sure I could get a better price on Amazon then with my local pharmacy. I like the Gurin product display and chose this unit based on price and the sleek efficient appearance of the unit.I was especially happy to note that I was consistently showing better results on the Upper reading...that is until I took my unit to the doctor's office to compare with their reading at my next visit. After several re-checks, I was told that my unit's calibration was out of sync with their more "sophisticated" instrument. The nurse suggested that I add 20 to my upper reading and I would be on target.I had to flex but am otherwise quite satisfied..I must confess that I have not tried to get a replacement unit from the company nor complained to Amazon. I do like the product and it is functioning well for my purposes( with my slight "flex" each morning). I suggest that users may want to check with their health care provider on any wrist BP product they may purchase....

I love the softness and fullness of the â€œHead & Shoulders, Refresh Shampoo for Men.â€ The clean natural fragrance adds to resultant feeling of freshness after each shampoo. I also like the shine and feeling of softness it gives my hair.The concentrated texture insures a small amount will do the job and there is no wasted product globs ending up on the shower floor.Over the years I have tried a lot of shampoos.  Head and Shoulders came in handy as I experience a seasonal dry scalp. The ingredients of Refresh for Men fight dandruff and dryness.I am pleased with the product and add my recommendation to the other excellent reviews already posted.

The Avery UltraDuty GHS Chemical Labels labels are durable:  water proof, chemical, and abrasion, and tear resistant. The high-performance adhesive meets the BS5609 Certification. In â€œClandestineâ€ Stella Francis Faulkes carefully introduces background material to establish a complex plot of international politics, government duplicity, maneuvers to counter attach terrorists, the Muslim brotherhood, and other extremists in an effort to gain dominance in the leadership of a one world government, in the guise of embassy business.Andy Wayne, protagonist, an outstanding agent for Center for Labor Unity (CLU) is on assignment in Venezuela to bait and incite a revolution against their new president; who has overtaken oil operations belonging to U. S. companies, Joyia Gabreille, a stunning representative of Brazil's national union, and Dane Sinclair, a seasoned operative, willing to resort to violence to get desired results, are assigned to aide Any in the effort.Behind the scenes Ezekiel Jones and Koshka Whitehall, the CIA/ CLU, and Peter Abercrombie, President Barnard Christopheâ€™s chief of staff, in an effort to divert adverse attention on the Venezuelan uprising before it starts;  contract Denise Menon, a former CIA agent, and freelance assassin, to  eliminate Andy Wayne, permanently.Faulkes is careful to provide a balance of background information in an effort to set the scene for the story line.Her multifaceted characters are believable. Her plot is complex with fast moving action and cutting edge themes of political intrigue, international economy and trade agreements, civil unrest, and revolutionary movements. â€œClandestine,â€ has potential to become a trilogy, with movie possibilities, or as a TV series and is destined to establish Stella Francis Faulkes as an award winning author bestselling author.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Daily Musings for Contemplation which Inspire Hope and Encouragement with Practical Strategies for Living Each Day with the Challenge of Autismâ€œLiving Autism Day by Dayâ€ is a resource for parents and caregivers of a child living with autism. As a mother of a child with autism Pamela Bryson-Weaver understands what it means to be a caregiver of an autistic child.  As with any debilitating disease, loved ones and caregivers face each new day with the uncertainty of the unfamiliar, often mysterious twists and turns the day will take.The book is made up of a reading for each day of the year. The daily readings include, a thought provoking quote offering inspiration, motivation, or affirmation with a message of hope and encouragement.The author follows the reflection with a fresh thought to approach the new day. This may be in the form of a practical tip, an inspiring story, a humorous antidote, a community, national, or educational resource, or a strategy for the care of an autistic child. Space is provided for the reader to record an action to take in areas of: Autism awareness, self-awareness, or an insight into one of lifeâ€™s blessings. Colorful photos of children accompanying the true stories and anecdotes add a dimension of reality and warmth to their story. Pamela Bryson-Weaver is a parent of an autistic child, and an advocate and activist for children with special needs.â€œLiving Autism Day by Dayâ€ is an important resource for parents, family and professional caregivers. Highly endorsed by readers who are living with the daily challenge of raising a special needs child.A complimentary Review copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

â€œPass It On â€“ Building a Legacy of Faith for Your Children through Practical and Memorable Experiencesâ€ is divided into three parts and provides guidelines and suggestions for:1. setting up a program for â€œbuilding a legacy of faith for your children through practical and memorable experiences.2. Providing rites of passages for individual sons and daughters for each of their thirteen years in school, kindergarten through their senior year of high school.3. Encouraging finishing strong and crossing the finish line.Each chapter parallels the childâ€™s age or year in school and incudes suggested rite of passage projects or themes for laying a foundation of faith. Age appropriate topics from generosity, friendship, preparing for adolescence, and intimacy are included. These suggestions are creative and doable; the authors also encourage the reader to add to the list or to improvise the details.I found the suggestions dealing specifically with what you need to know about your child at each age: physically, emotionally, relationally, and spiritually, especially helpful and practical.â€œPass it Onâ€ is written for parents. It is an important resource and can be of benefit to family counselors, student leaders, (professional and lay). The book is highly endorsed by youth educators, pastors, and student ministry leaders.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

â€œGod Made All of Meâ€ is an excellent resource guide for parents who want to safeguard and instruct their children against the repercussion and heartbreak of sexual abuse.The reader is guided through exemplary discussions for encouraging communication with the child, while helping them understand, and identify, the private parts of their anatomy. They offer guidelines for opening conversation about:  appropriate touches, maintaining emotions, playing doctor, and identifying people they can trust.A letter to parents or caregivers intrudes the book and explains the goal opens the book. Each of these helpful conversations are summarized for the parent in final nine final summary statements with explanations as to why each of these areas are important to protect you child from sexual abuse.Trish Mahoneyâ€™s colorful illustrations re-enforce the goal of the authors: â€œto empower and train Christian communities to recognize, prevent, and respond to child abuse.â€Highly recommended.

â€œJust So You Knowâ€ is written for parents and caregivers of children with serious chronic medical needs. Brigitte D. Crist tells the story of their daughter's first five years. Audrey was diagnosed, with â€œgastroschisis,â€ a rare suppressed immune system, a condition that required a process of transplantation of her small bowel, liver, and pancreas.Brigitte draws from her personal journals, medical records, and therapy notes to provide the reader with encouragement tips on managing the trials felt when facing a devastating medical diagnosis, extended hospital confinement, and the ongoing care and treatment of your child along with the normal family challenges at home.A memorable collection of photos taken over the first five years of Audreyâ€™s journey are included.  These photos are confirmation of her sweet spirit, and will encourage, and give hope to the reader facing similar hardships. Brigitteâ€™s writing style is straight forward, informative, and heartwarming.â€œJust So You Knowâ€ is for any parent facing the trials that go with the physical difficulties that often accompany birth defects and other childhood diseases. It can also be an excellent resource for pediatric healthcare professionals, special education teachers, and daycare administrators. Highly Recommended

Beyond EngagementBy: Brady G. WilsonBPS Books Bastian Publishing Service42 Donald Crescent, Toronto, ON M1S 1N7, Canada978-1772360172, $ 18.99, 2015,172 pagesReviewed by Richard R. Blake, richard330@yahoo.comThe subtitle highlighted on the front cover â€œA Brain-Based Approach That Blends the Engagement Managers Want with the Energy Employees Needâ€ and the strong endorsements by influential industry leaders highlighted on the back cover immediately piqued my attention and interestThe reader books user friendly format, independent and clearly defined chapter themes, and the forceful approach of the author allow the reader the option of reading the book sequentially or by choosing chapters of interest that meet a specific immediate need or personal interest.Each of the ten chapters opens with three questions:â€¢ Whatâ€™s the brain science?â€¢ How does this show up at work?â€¢ Why does it matter?My interest was piqued by many of Wilsonâ€™s observations and expressions. The concepts focused creative energy and the power of conversation as an innovative tool for improving employee performance and business results.Chapters include a case study and an energy management question designed to open a dialog between you and your leaders.â€œBeyond Engagementâ€ is a book you will want to put into the hands of every member of your management team. The book is an excellent equipping tool. The ten leadership principles are innovative, practical, and infused with ideas for humanizing the workplace.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Howard Partridge, exclusive small business coach for Zig Ziglar, Inc. working with hundreds of business owners as trainer and consultant is highly recognized, by his peers and top business leaders, as an expert in small business marketing.In his book â€œPhenomenal Marketing Systemsâ€ Partridge defines marketing as â€œeverything you do to attract prospects to your business.â€ He provides the reader with guidelines and proven strategies for implementation of a proven marketing system that works.Partridge titled the first chapter of the book with â€œThe Only Three Ways to Increase Sales. This information is foundational in establishing a successful marketing system. Many of these principles will cross over into important sales strategies as well and will insure the small business owner increased sales, help them determine their perfect target market, and build an incredible reputation.His concept of experiential marketing includes methods for building business relationships, maximizing referrals, and tracking repeat business. In his â€œFive-point Marketing-Messageâ€ Partridge stresses the importance of promoting your companyâ€™s reputation, your personal education, your knowledge or special training, and your experience. He also advocates putting an emphasis on your systems: technical and customer service as well as your guarantee. Illustrations from highly successful companies who have applied these principles give credence to their effectiveness.â€œPhenomenal Marketing Systemsâ€ is packed with surefire ways of increasing cash flow, moving from a marketing system to a phenomenal marketing plan, while maintaining your target client base, increase your sales, and generate new record profit levels.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Road to Siran, Erinâ€™s Storyrinâ€™s Search â€“ Sensitive Story of Heritage, Culture, and Uncertainties of the PastErin Ozcomert is convinced there is something sinister about her fatherâ€™s apparent suicide during a mysterious visit to his to Siran in northeastern Turkey, ancestral home of the Ozcomert family. Upon her graduation from UCLA in Los Angeles his daughter Erin determines, against the families will, to make a trip to Siran in an effort to learn more about her fatherâ€™s life, her family roots, and Turkish culture and traditions; and to learn the secrets behind the family feuds and what had transpired to cause her father to be forced into a life of exile and guilt after his family in Turkey were killed in a hateful murder rampage.Through a number of sub plots Kaya introduces the brutal, vengeful nature of Turkish culture as well as the incredible beauty and opulence of the architect, museums, and exhibits. Erin could not resist the exciting drama, romantic nature, and excitement of the night life in Istanbul. She was soon caught up in an addiction to its cutting edge adventure.Kaya draws on his training,  and experience as an actor, as well as his early passion for reading the works of Kurdish writers of his native country, Turkey. Hi characters are multidimensional, sensitive, naïve, deceptive, vindictive, and romantic.I appreciated the inclusion of a dictionary or glossary of Turkish terms introduced throughout the book. These termscombined with the use of Turkish dialog add a unique dimension to the authenticity of the culture, the old world charm of ancient Turkey, the opulence, grandeur, and wealth in contrast to its modern ambiance.Already and award winning author, Behcet Kaya is quickly building up a fan base of loyal readers. His works just keep getting better. I am looking forward to reading a sequel to Erinâ€™s story.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Henri J. M. Nouwen draws from the teachings of Jesus taken from the Gospels for the three meditations on the Christian Life in his book â€œOut of Solitude.â€ He helps the reader recognize the relationship between solitude, community, and expectation.Nouwen describes the importance of finding a quiet center, a lonely place where we can enter into feeling a closeness for others â€“ straight from the heart; a place where care becomes the basis for community.I especially appreciated his reference to how real care is the opposite of apathy, to grieve with and share the pain of â€œthe wounds of othersâ€ with a gentle touch, a tender hand, in a silent moment of compassion and empathy. I was struck with the simplicity of his teaching style. An example:  look on interruptions as opportunities for mending our hearts in preparation of Jesusâ€™ return.â€œThree Meditations on Solitudeâ€ is packed with important reflections for peace, and inner healing which provide hope and joy to a troubled community of lonely people.

Fatal Traumaâ€ combines all the elements of good story telling: multidimensional characters, a well-developed plot, which includes suspense, nonstop action, and romance. When Dr. Mark Baker and Nurse Kelly Atkinson innocently become the target of a notorious drug cartel; Mark becomes a not only a potential victim of assassination but a suspect of murder himself.Dr. Richard Mabry combines his knowledge of medicine, hospital policy, and creative imagination in this action medical suspense drama.  A message of conflict, faith, and hope is carefully woven throughout the novel.

Larry Sparks skillfully teams up with authors Dr. Michael L. Brown and apostolic leader John Kilpatrick to adapt and apply the stories, insights and principles gleaned from their writings to produce â€œThe Fire That Never Stops: Keys for Sustaining Personal Revival.â€After reading the forward by Jack Hayford and the endorsements of a number of international Christian leaders I knew I was in for a rich reading experience. I was not disappointed.This is a remarkable work on the history of revival over the last 100 years and its impact on the American Church. The authors have captured the passion of personal renewal by applying spiritual lessons learned from the insights of revivalists and visionaries, including: Charles Wesley, Charles Finney, William Booth, George Whitfield Leonard Ravenhill, Vance Havner, A. W. Tozer, and D. L. Moody.Although much of the book is uniquely Pentecostal and Charismatic in appeal Christians from mainline denominations, and evangelicals will benefit from these examples of the spiritual awakenings led by these men.A unique feature embraced by the authors of this book is a respect for the dramatic conversions, conviction of sin, tears of repentance, and uncontrolled emotion manifest by people smitten by the Holy Spirit as they received, deliverance, healing, and salvation during these services. The resultant agonies and commotions were accepted as a natural part of the â€œoutpouring of the Holy Spiritâ€ in the revival setting.The authors are genuine and passionate in their writing; they are expressive, and inspiring. The work is carefully researched and well documented.â€œThe Fire That Never Stops: Keys for Sustaining Personal Revivalâ€ is a book for anyone hungering for more of Jesus, His power, His strength, and desirous of living a Spirit filled life.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

This anthoogy of Vihang A. Kaik's poetry features his poem City Times.  Naik translates poetry from the Guajarati language into English. His writing is rich in poetic express. He uses an abstract form often creating a unique form of modern poetry and free verse. He uses pauses, nuances with give the reader the liberty for personal interpretation which encourages reflection and quiet contemplation.Many of his poems remind the reader of Walt Whitman's free verse using metaphors which parallel the process of change in man's values..

â€œWhere Do You Get Your Ideas?â€ is made up of two parts: Strategies and applications. In part one, author, Fred White, develops a natural progression using the idea of free association and a number of underlying questions to help the writer recognize an idea with story potential. He goes on to stage two and discusses: mapping, listing, profiling and illustrating your ideas. In stage three he reviews steps to preparing an outline and synopsis of a project. Stage four looks at the process of developing your idea through research. Stage five takes the reader through the preparation of the first draft and in stage six he looks at the art of revising your draft.In part two White provides the writer with key principles or applications for building a modern story â€“ from an ancient myth, creating a short story from a newspaper report, and creating a memoir using family memorabilia. He also talks about structuring your novel around a symbol or event.White than introduces seventy-five pivotal ideas in twelve popular categories to prime your imagination to get  you started on your novel; he concludes with reflections on working your resultant ideas into your creative processes.I especially benefited from the exercises suggested in the writerâ€™s notebook; the ideas for structuring a memoir, and the pointers on a plot synopsis. The templates, worksheets, practical observations from well-known writers, and the complete index are additional helpful tools; especially for beginning writers.Fred Whiteâ€™s â€œWhere Do You Get Your Ideas?â€ is an important addition to my reference library.

â€œA Story Worth Telling â€“ Your Field Guide to Living an Authentic Lifeâ€ is intended to help the reader to step out of their comfort zone into the reality of an adventure story worth telling. This requires a conscious choice to intentional living in pursuit of a higher purpose.These guidelines include three specific features of particular note:â€¢ Check Your Coordinates â€“ This step asks hard questions to establish where you are on your journeyâ€¢ Preparing Your Gear â€“ Provides specific questions to help you identify if your life has started to driftâ€¢ Explore the Trail Ahead â€“ Introduces exercises for embarking on the journey of fulfilling lifeâ€™s dreamsThese questions and exercises helped me examine the focus of my faith to recognize Godâ€™s authority, to be intentional about making choices based on that trust, and to revisit or write my personal mission statement for authentic living.Blankschaen includes stories and practical suggestions on nearly all the areas important to the Christian walk of faith. I especially liked his reminder about filtering the myriads of propaganda we are flooded with through the truth of the Scriptures.  I also appreciated the keys on engaging Godâ€™s Word for understanding, empowerment, and for enjoyment. He also provided some important pointers on prayer:â€¢ In times of insurmountable barriersâ€¢ The need for genuine humilityâ€¢ An openness to learnâ€¢ And putting God to the testâ€œA Story Worth Tellingâ€ is a guidebook that should be read, reread, and assimilated by every Christian moving forward in an authentic walk of faith.

Laurie Coombsâ€™ â€˜memoir â€œLetters from My Fatherâ€™s Murderer â€“ A Journey in Forgivenessâ€ opens with the  details leading up to  and the aftershock of the tragic death of her father, a murder victim.Devastated, but determined. Laurie went on with her life; finished her college education, married her fiancÃ©, Travis, and began a family. On the surface things looked well, however, Laurie was experiencing a paralyzing anxiety and depression.  Laurie walked away from her familyâ€™s church as a teenager, her skepticism left her broken and angry. As the hatred of her fatherâ€™s murderer heightened she became obsessed with questions of justice and a spirit of bitterness.Responding to a friendâ€™s invitation, Laurie, Travis, and her girls visited a nearby church. Although still skeptical, Laurie returned to the church week after week.  She experienced a deepened awareness of the possibility of healing from her emotional and mental symptoms through faith.  Jesus offered peace and forgiveness. Her hunger for truth led to her redemption, personal peace and a heartfelt passion to share her story.Laurieâ€™s journey of forgiveness led to a definite step of obedience to connect with the murderer of her father.  Her process of forgiveness and healing led to corresponding with Anthony, her fatherâ€™s murderer. These letters are recounted in the story of Godâ€™s working in their lives through the process of forgiveness, redemption, and reconciliation.Coombsâ€™ writing is articulate, well organized, and authentic. I came away with a deeper awareness of the emotions felt by the survivors and the bitterness evidenced in victims who have lost loved ones due to tragic circumstances. â€œLetters from My Fatherâ€™s Murdererâ€ is timely and relevant with an important message for the families who are grieving in response to the tragedy of crime, accidents brought about by others, and those losing loved ones while in the service of our country.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

â€œNo Greater Love â€“ An Afghan Memoirâ€ has a great beginning. Tim Moynihan had my attention within the first two paragraphs. By the end of chapter one I was hooked. I had to keep readingSpecial Forces soldier Colonel Mike Sanchez served in the battlefields of Iraq and Afghanistan. As he began sharing experiences from his military experiences he soon entered into a new career as an "inspirational" motivational speaker. He was deeply moved by a painful memory of two brothers â€“ who lost their lives in a bloody battle on a ridge in Afghanistan, when challenged by a college student in his audience.Sanchez records the story of these brothers, Zachery and Daniel Taylor, in a book detailing events that led up to the dramatic circumstances surrounding the battle that took their lives. It is a dramatic story of how brotherly love overcame fear in a final act of sacrificial love.The common denominator between the Taylor brothers and Sanchez is the fact they were all pastorâ€™s sons, who understood the message of the gospel; having a personal relationship as followers of Jesus. The message is seeker friendly, not pushy or preachy, but heartfelt.I was so moved by the story I lost sight of the fact that I was reading Tim Moynihanâ€™s novella, not his memoirs. His characters are believable; the fast moving action is cutting edge. The reader is confronted with hard questions regarding war, fighting for the cause of freedom, and with the impact of faith on the battlefield.Moynihanâ€™s writing is tight with a lot of action, drama, and descriptive word pictures. â€œNo Greater Love â€“ An Afghan Memoirâ€ is an inspiring story of hope packaged in a three chapter novella.A complimentary copy of this novella was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

A Man, His Purpose, and His Missionâ€œHis Faithfulness Reaches to the Skies â€“ The Story of a Missionary Pilotâ€ is made up of stories within the life story of the ministry of Forest and Margaret Zander, who served together as Wycliffe missionaries for over 22 years in South America.The story is presented in six stages: beginning with Forestâ€™s childhood desire to become a pilot, Godâ€™s plan and call on his life, his passion for adventure, early ministry in Ecuador, flying in Colombia, lessons in diplomacy, and experiences as Associate Director of Advancement & Minister-at-Large for Wycliffe Bible Translators.Many of the chapters are standalone missionary adventure stories with titles including: Met at Gunpoint, Engine Stops at 7,000 Feet, Gator Hunting, No Oil Pressure and No Brakes. The story of the Zanderâ€™s experiences in missionary work in South American parallels the history of the Colombia Branch of Wycliffe (SIL) during this period.Forest Zander is a gifted story teller, skilled communicator, and an inspiring example of faith, hope, humility, and commitment; an inspiration for reader of all ages. â€œHis Faithfulness Reaches to the Skies â€“ The Story of a Missionary Pilotâ€ demonstrates Godâ€™s faithful provision, grace, and intervention in the lives of His followers. A powerful story.

In his book â€œThriving in Babylon,â€ bestselling author, Larry Osborne introduces a new perspective on the character, writing, and the incredible spiritual influence of the prophet Daniel in the midst of the godless culture and society of ancient Babylon, known for its wickedness, evil, and debauchery. â€œLoveâ€™s Abiding Joyâ€ is the fourth in the â€œLove Comes Softlyâ€ series of films based on the bestselling novels of Janette Oke. Dr. Michelle Anthony and Megan Marshman introduce guidelines for Family Ministry Leaders in the church in an assessment of their current educational programs in light of lifetime faith transformation, a Biblical foundation in an environment of authentic culture change, through exemplary discipleship. They challenge the reader to consider the essentials presented in their book â€œ7 Family Ministry Essentials â€“ A Strategy for Culture Change in Childrenâ€™s and Student Ministries.â€The scripture based principles or â€œministry essentialsâ€ are presented in a logical progression with important ministry assessment exercises provided to help the reader implement theory into live action. â€œGod Gave Us Twoâ€ provides Little Cub answers to her questions and concerns when she learns she will soon be sharing her parents, Mama and Papa Polar Bear, with a new brother or sister..Little Cub asks, â€œWhy do we need a new baby? Can we send it back if we donâ€™t like it?  If the baby cries too much, can I move next door? Will the new baby look like me?â€ Will you forget me when the baby comes? These questions are addressed with tender concern, convincing Little Cub of her importance to the family.The tenderness in the expressions of security and affirmation are assuring to Little Cub and be transferred to boys and girls everywhere as they learn to accept and love the anticipated new sibling. Laura J. Bryantâ€™s creative, colorful illustrations will delight toddlers and early readers as they learn how every child is a unique gift from God.â€œGod Gave Us Twoâ€ is a beautiful story that will capture the attention of the young child seeking security and assurance during those last few weeks and months of they waiting the arrival of a new baby in the family. A beautiful story written with sensitivity, anticipation, and suspense, right up to a BIG surprise ending.

Dr. Randy Clark, president and founder of Global Awakening has a passion for equipping Christians to pray for the sick and see them miraculously restored to health. â€œPower to Heal â€“ Keys to Activating Godâ€™s Healing Power in Your Lifeâ€ is designed to help the reader recognize the Holy Spiritâ€™s healing power in and through their life. His teaching is instructive, convincing, and convicting.â€œPower to Heal â€“ Keys to Activating Godâ€™s Healing Power in Your Lifeâ€ is a reminder to every Christian, â€œWe are the vehicles and vessels God wants to use to release His divine healing power.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. Rev. Bob Larson, internationally recognized for his books on Spiritual Warfare, Angelology, and Demonology alerts the reader to the evidence Christians must face; the reality that spiritual warfare is happening throughout the world today.In his book â€œJezebel â€“ Defeating Your #1 Spiritual Enemyâ€ Larson presents Jezebel as a fallen angel taking on the identity and spirit of the despicable Queen, wife of King Ahaz, in the days of the Old Testament prophet Elijah. Carmel, Nabothâ€™s stolen vineyard and ruthless murder, Jezebelâ€™s arrogance and tyranny, the death of Ahaz, and Jezebelâ€™s dramatic demise.Larson has a unique approach of using dialog with demon personalities as a process for determining the spiritual strategy to bring about resolution in the exorcism and deliverance process. Tim Timberlakeâ€™s â€œAbandonâ€ embraces an affirmative message for finding Godâ€™s purpose which will resonate with todayâ€™s contemporary generation and culture. It is written for anyone struggling to find Godâ€™s intended destiny for their life.Lessons are drawn from the circumstances, family, and culture that surrounded and impacted the life of well-known Old Testament patriarch Jacob. Timberlake carefully details the birth of twins Esau and Jacob, their natural inclinations, personalities, and their interaction with parents, Isaac, and Rebecca. He provides new insights into the formation of Jacobsâ€™s early deceitfulness, shrewdness, fears, and his emerging sensitivity for fulfilling Godâ€™s purpose for his life.Timberline translates examples from Jacobâ€™s struggles into guidelines and principles to help the reader make personal application for facing life and forming values that will powerfully impact and transform their life to find a deeper awareness of closeness to God while discovering his purpose,Some unique features of the book include innovative keys for making a difference in a changing digital age:â€¢ Perceptive â€œAbandonâ€ statements designed to move the reader to make choices which include denying self to consistency in obedience to Godâ€¢ Thought Provoking Questions that encourage looking within to deepen your relationship with Jesus and create a hunger for Godâ€™s wordâ€¢ Relevant, timely applications for molding the reader into deeply committed followers of ChristTim Timberlake is a pastor, Bible teacher, and author, with a gift for cross cultural and inter-generational ministry. â€œAbandon, Laying Aside Your Plan for Godâ€™s Purposeâ€ offers the reader heartfelt guidelines for turning lifeâ€™s circumstances and barriers into blessings and fulfillment.A complimentary review copy of this book was provided for review purposes. â€œThings I Wish Iâ€™D Known â€“ Cancer and Kidsâ€ is made up of tips from experts and heart felt stories gleaned from interviews with people who have experienced surviving the emotional highs and lows of helping children deal with Cancer. The book is divided into five chapters which focus on helping the reader better understanding how to better deal with children facing the complexities of coping with cancer.Topics considered in these chapters include communicating the basic information of cancer as a disease, what the child can expect as they move through the process, and the impact it will have on routine family activities. Cornwall also speaks specifically to issues when the child is the patient, and when a child loses a parent or a sibling to the disease. She also introduces the prospect of death and dying, and the process of grief in the case of the loss of a family member.The format of the book is reader friendly concise, yet compressive, filled with suggestions for resources available for further reference, reading or study. She includes website suggestions, and information available from the American Cancer Society. Cornwall long association with the Cancer Action Network and the Cancer Support Community validate and affirm her creditability and sensibility to the issues covered in the book.â€œThings I Wish Iâ€™D Known â€“ Cancer and Kidsâ€ is an important resource took for parents, pediatric professionals, family counselors, and social workers.A complimentary review copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

By the end of the first chapter I knew I was hooked. Ace Collins had my attention. I knew â€œThe Color of Justiceâ€ would be a reading experience I would long remember.A cloud of despair hung over Cooper Lindseyâ€™s head; one he could not quite pinpoint. Although, as he compared the 100 year history of family in his hometown, Justice, Mississippi with progress being made in 1964; he was faced with the reality of the townâ€™s acceptance of racial division.As a lawyer and the son of a minister he recognized the double standard of justice was yet to be faced. Ironically in a town named Justice, the townâ€™s culture did not value a personâ€™s worth by the same standard. Collins was faced with the question â€“ what will wake up the community?â€œThe Color of Justiceâ€ is a dramatic story of bigotry. It is a haunting reminder of the reality how hate, anger and hostility can become so deeply imbedded in an individualâ€™s character, a communityâ€™s core values, that a whole society is tainted.When Coop Lindseyâ€™s took the challenge to be true to his values and made the decision to represent Calvin Ross, a young black man, accused of murdering the teenage daughter of an upstanding white family he is ostracized by the citizenry of the community.Part one covers the trial, the verdict and the consequences Coop faced. Part two takes place 50 years later, when in 2014 when Coopâ€™s grandson returns to Justice to determine the circumstances that polluted the Lindsey familyâ€™s character and legacy. While there the younger Coop Lindsey he is challenged by a new case and a new generation with deeply rooted prejudice, hostility and bitterness.Collinâ€™s intricate word phrases and descriptions make his characters come alive on the page. Often their actions and attitudes are so intense my emotions were moved in a way that made me ponder the question if my own bias and true values. I found the questions in the Discussion Guide probing and personal. They validate the impact of the authorâ€™s ability to use a fictional story to deliver a message of social significance.The haunting story and theme of Ace Collinâ€™s â€œThe Color of Justiceâ€ continue to have an impact on the reader long after reading the final chapter and vivid conclusion.

The highlight of my reading this month is the Book â€œNo More Excusesâ€ by Sam Silverstein. Silverstein is dedicated to helping company leadership create organizations that prioritize and inspire accountability. The bookâ€™s subtitle â€œThe Five Accountabilities for Personal and Organizational Growthâ€ describes this premise and is the primary theme.Silverstein draws on his person experience, from case studies and interviews with 50 internationally known CEOs, and other highly accountable individuals in fields of business, sports, government, and medicine. These leaders are known for their productive and proactive accountability. Their true stories illustrate a standard of holding themselves and others in their organizations accountable for making accountable choices.I benefited from the insights I gained on: Improving my communication skills; developing the skill of personal accountability, the importance of being openly transparent, the need to establish high targets, the art of empowering others, and the need for clarity in building relationships. â€œReese's Peanut Butter Cupsâ€ combine the richness of Chocolate with just a touch of salt and the creamy texture of peanut butter in this gluten free all-time favorite candy.The new party wrapped miniature comes in a large 66.7 ounce packaging  insures that you will always have treats available for all those special occasions: party favors for snacking and sharing at birthdays, for entertaining, or for gifts. The Logitech Mouse MX Master Wireless Mouse includes: The Complete with Unifying Receiver, the Micro-USB Cable for Recharging. a Comfortable Thumb Rest and Unique Thumb Wheel,I appreciate the adaptive scroll wheel and the duration of extended duration between battery charges and the fast charging features. A Valuable Guidebook for Cancer Victims and Their FamiliesDr. Jack C. Westman M.D, M.S Professor Emeritus of Psychiatry at the University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health open his book â€œThe Cancer Solution â€“ Taking Charge of Your Life with Cancerâ€ with his wifeâ€™s 34 year journey of living with cancer.The book goes on to describe current prevalent cancer treatment, surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy, its methods and results. He helps the reader understand how to take an active part in managing their own health and medical problems.I found the review of the history and development of cancer care practical and helpful. Dr. Westmanâ€™s explanation of the multiplication of cancer cells, and neoplasia are especially informative.  Full chapters are devoted to cancer research, clinical trials and treatments, new approaches, immunotherapy, and nutritional therapy. Chapter eleven deals with complementing your treatment and is significant in that it relates to a holistic approach to cancer and personal responsibility.Dr. Westmanâ€™s conclusions are, logically presented, authoritative and convincing. His extensive research is well documented and provides the reader with excellent suggestions for further reading, â€œThe Cancer Solution â€“ Taking Charge of Your Life with Cancerâ€ is a practical guidebook for anyone diagnosed with cancer, and their family, as well as for hospice caregivers, and professionals in the field of oncology, and healthcare.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

In his book â€œJesus Culture: Calling a Generation to Revivalâ€ Banning Liebscher begins by describing what a new breed of revivalists looks like and how we are living in the greatest hour of history. He draws lessons from the relationship of Mosesâ€™ authority and Joshuaâ€™s courage to illustrate the importance of spiritual covering and the power of alignment in ministry. He goes on to introduce the reader to Godâ€™s extravagant love and how we can ignite revival fires across the world. He challenges the reader to see the connection of a life of prayer and a life of power. In the final chapters he calls the reader to accept responsibility, and the role of â€œrisk takingâ€ in the realm of the supernatural.He tells the story of Godâ€™s call on his life, of his childhood salvation experience, of a teenage encounter with Jesus, and of being overwhelmed with a sense of gratefulness for Godâ€™s presence, of his anointing, and of being captivated with Jesus.Banning describes a wholehearted consecration to prayer and revival, and of the strong desire to join others for the purpose uniting together on the â€œbrink of a new wave of global revival; fanning the flames of revivalâ€ He tells how God used prophetic words, revelation, and dreams to call him to raise up and guide a new breed of revivalists: a generation of anointed revivalists, a remnant raised up to change the course of history.I was deeply moved by Banningâ€™s articulate/word patterns and fervor as he describes the new revivalist, as burning ones (igniting fires) abiding in the love of Jesus and burning with passion for Him.The book is filled with wisdom for life, insights into scripture, and keys for successful and victorious living. Banning discusses cultivating God ordained relationships, unity and discernment. Banning brings a message of life changing principles written with authority and passion. Each chapter includes profound questions which stimulate (awaken) self-examination, commitment, and a challenge to wholehearted livingPage after page Banning conveys a sense of urgency for a new focus to individual destiny, and to pursing holiness with a new passion. Banningâ€™s writing draws the reader in with an irresistible power and contagious sense of expectancy. He has convinced me that we are living in â€œthe greatest hour of history.â€â€œJesus Culture: Calling a Generation to Revivalâ€ is a book for anyone passionately desirous of seeing supernatural power released through their life.A copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

â€œGrit in Your Craw â€“ The 8 Strengths You Need to Succeed in Business and in Your Lifeâ€ is solid advice based on developing eight essential strengths for success in your personal and business life. This fast moving narrative reads like fiction.I became totally engrossed in the reading experience; the book provided me with a positive sense of optimism, and made me feel good about my day, my opportunities past and future.I found some personal â€œtake a-waysâ€ from Luckadooâ€™s writing. These include:â€¢ The importance of strategic planningâ€¢ Having long and short term goalsâ€¢ A plan for embracing the 8 qualities of the book in accomplishing my aspirations and goalsâ€¢ The rewards of discipline resulting from the productive use of timeRobert Luckadoo, coach, entrepreneur, pilot, race car driver, insurance professional, and family man uses life stories to illustrate each of the eight essential strengths needed to succeed. His writing is highly creative conveying a positive outlook which produces contagious optimism, important to creating client acceptance and confidence.A unique feature of the book that sets it apart from similar self-improvement books is his Gospel centered Worldview. The book is designed for performance based professionals and anyone looking for life strategies and direction for finding their purpose in life. Highly readable, highly recommended. A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Ben and Bekka Cooperâ€™s fifth grade class have been selected to participate in a reenactment of the three day Civil War battle that took place in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania in 1863.  Classes from five states in addition to the Coopers class from Lansing, Michigan were also selected to participate in the reenactment; two other states from the North and three from the South.The story is filled with mystery, suspense, and excitement as Ben, Bekka, and their friends expose a criminal plot during their stay at the park. Other highlights include lessons on good sportsmanship, team work, and the importance of building character. There are also opportunities to learn practical lessons about family camping, cooking in trenches, and practicing the golden rule.Mary Morgan understands what preteens like to read. â€œSpies in Disguise at Gettysburgâ€ is the third book in the â€œNational Park Mystery Series.â€ Dawn McVay Baumerâ€™s clever illustrations add a visual impact that will add to the entertainment appeal of the reader and also capture their imagination and interaction with the story. The dialog moves the plot forward and helps develop the believable, memorable characters. â€œSpies in Disguise at Gettysburgâ€ is an ideal story for family night read â€œaloudsâ€ and as well as for many, many, discussion starters. The book is also an important addition to your church or home school library.

Avery Products Corporation are known for their wide range of creative products for organizing your office files, developing high impact presentation folders, and providing free online helps, tips, templates, and software suggestions.Avery Ready Index Table of Contents Dividers (Avery # 13156) is a valuable resource for Organizing and Collating Multiple copies for your making a high impact impression on your on your next presentation to that valued potential customer.The 5 tabs are punched with copper reinforced holes for tear resistance and are designed to be used with any Classification Folder. Printing tips a landscape option and versatility, and availability of free online helps, templates, and software add value to stimulate your creativity.Ideal for Business or Home Office use.

While working on a personal project over the last few months I have taken the opportunity to revisit books on my library shelf dealing with the subject of world missions. Many of these are biographies and memoirs of Christians who have dedicated their lives to the cause of Christ in providing people groups without the scriptures in their native mother tongue.Sent to â€œThe River God Forgotâ€ is one of those stories. Jim and Janice Walton tell of their life-changing experiences as a young American family living in the Amazon jungle of Colombia, South America.Their stories of conquering fear and overcoming obstacles tell of lessons they gleaned in trusting the Lord while earning the trust and learning to adapt to the societal differences, the cultural values, traditions, customs, and foods of the Muinane Indians.Their stories provided me enlightening insight into another culture, equipping me to better face the challenge and vision of expanding my own world view in light of todayâ€™s horizons of new opportunity of sharing the Gospel cross-culturally.The technique of using frequent backstory to illustrate lessons may cause the reader a sense of fragmentation or confusion. Some of these stand-alone stories are powerful examples of how God can turn disappointment to blessing.â€œThe River God Forgotâ€ has an important message for Cross-Cultural cooperation, understanding, today. A good read, entertaining, informative, and inspiring.

Bob Creson captures the passion of Bible translators through stories of peoples around the world who are discovering the powerful message of the Gospel for the first time in their native tongue or â€œheart language.â€I have been an avid reader of missionary biographies and stories since a teenager. These included Cameron Townsend and Kenneth Pike early visionaries in the Bible Translation movement. The lives and stories of Nate Saint, Jim Elliott, and Chuck Bitterman have made an impact on my commitment to the cause of missions.More recently I have been a regular reader of â€œIn Focusâ€ a Wycliffe Bible Translation publication with stories and updates on Bible Translation taking place around the world today. Bob Creson is a regular contributor to this publication, so I was pleased to receive a gift copy of his book â€œThe Finish Line â€“ Stories of Hope Through Bible Translations.â€Creson describes a spreading hunger for the Word of God, a growing momentum of the explosive growth in a movement to reach the more than eighteen hundred people groups without the Scripture in their language.Each chapter is filled with stories of answered prayer, sacrificial giving, dedicated disciples, miracles of conversions, churches started, and hope for the future. The number of people groups, dialects, and the number of difficult names to pronounce is difficult to assimilate but add to the authenticity, reality, impact, and urgency of the stories.The dreams, visions, and solid foundation of the Wycliffe Bible Translators begun by early pioneers are being accomplished on a broader scope at a much faster rate as a result of new developments in technology, and the teamwork of thousands of committed men and women in the task of getting to the finish line, a Bible for every people group by the year 2025.Cresonâ€™s passion comes through in his writing. He is meticulous in detail, acquainted with every facet of the Wycliffe organization, principles of translation, and sound in his theology.â€œThe Finish Lineâ€ is an important book for Church Missions Committees, Pastors, Christian educators, and anyone considering missions as a life commitment.

Award winning news correspondent Barry Petersen tells â€œJanâ€™s Storyâ€ and of their journey together in a story of excitement, passion, and of love lost to the long goodbye of Alzheimerâ€™s. Step by step and chapter by chapter he takes the reader through Janâ€™s journey into each of the â€œSeven Stages of Alzheimerâ€™s Disease.â€Petersen is open and candid in talking about his feelings of devastation, anger and grief as the brain altering disease Early Onset Alzheimerâ€™s takes control and dominates every area of life in a downward spiral unpredictable and all consuming. He tells of the private agony of loneliness, overwhelming feelings of depression, and the ongoing battle with exhaustion.The pages are filled with personal experiences, correspondence with family and friends, advice from medical professionals, fellow travelers, and well-meaning acquaintances. In this dramatic story Peterson provides the reader valuable information and helpful hints for fellow travelers on their journey with Alzheimerâ€™s.I personally gained:â€¢ New perspectives on the reality of day to day life and the growing sense of loss, a sense of discovery into the little windows of the Disease and the realization of being increasingly alone.â€¢ Help to cope with the sense of isolation, loneliness, denial and the delusion of normalcy or improvement.â€¢ The dangers of ignoring a growing awareness of the results of Caregiver stress.â€¢ How to deal with times when it seems that all dreams are ending.â€¢ The relief of distraction.â€¢ And the realization that I am not alone in this journey.There were times in my reading when my tears blurred the print or when I just stopped reading to reflect on our own journey with Alzheimerâ€™s. Reflective moments recalling cherished memories of those days that pre-date the realization that building memories for â€œusâ€ was in reality building memories for me.Resource suggestions and discussion questions are provided for further reading, personal contemplation or for group discussion, ideal for use in a readerâ€™s or support group.A beautiful story, of love, trauma, renewal, and hope.

Get Your Joy Back â€“ Banishing Resentment and Reclaiming Confidence in Your Special Needs FamilyBy: Laurie WallinKregel Publications2450 Oak Industrial Drive, NE,Grand Rapids, MI 49505978-0825443398, 2015, 175 PagesReviewed by Richard R. Blake, richard330@yahoo.comHelp for Parents of Special Needs ChildrenLaurie Wallin knows from personal experience the challenges faced by families with special need kids. â€œGet Your Joy Backâ€ is her story.Wallin is candid and transparent; willing to be honest and expose her own vulnerabilities when she talks of the reality of parenting special needs children. She discusses the issues of resentment, the intensity of multi-tasking and the impact of this on siblings and other family members.The subtitle â€œâ€“ Banishing Resentment and Reclaiming Confidence in Your Special Needs Familyâ€ is a commitment to the reader to offer helpful guidelines and encouragement.Wallin delivers on this promise through the use of:â€¢ Probing Introspective Suggestions for self-examination with guidelines and exercises for taking steps to optimize your strengthsâ€¢ A concept for allowing yourself to make room for God sized dreamsâ€¢ A reader friendly format with helpful subtitles for quick review, and assimilationâ€¢ Chapter Notes and Resource Listsâ€¢ Next Step Ideas for ApplicationPractical themes covered in the fifteen chapters of the book include: Forgiveness of yourself, your child, your spouse, your extended family, the professionals, the church and community, and forgiving God.Wallin is a gifted communicator, a professional life coach with a passionate heart, is empathetic with her readership and knowledgeable in the area of special needs parenting.A complimentary copy of the book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.Get Your Joy Back â€“ Banishing Resentment and Reclaiming Confidence in Your Special Needs FamilyBy: Laurie WallinKregel Publications2450 Oak Industrial Drive, NE,Grand Rapids, MI 49505978-0825443398, 2015, 175 PagesReviewed by Richard R. â€œWill â€“ Godâ€™s Mighty Warriorâ€ is clever and imaginative; an enjoyable reading experience. Meredith Johnsonâ€™s illustrations add a wonderful dimension to the story line, perfectly melding page by page.Will and his friend Josh are self-proclaimed super heroes; warriors with capes, swords, and shields. I was disappointed that the lengthy mythical imaginary â€œfunâ€ core of the book overshadowed the Scriptural message the author was featuring â€“ the Biblical lesson of the Sword of the Spirit.Entertaining, with a message; short on potential spiritual impact.

Pastor Mike Slaughter challenges the reader to reexamine the Gospel of Jesus.In his book â€œRenegade Gospel â€“ the Rebel Jesusâ€ he is passionate in his enthusiasm, articulate in his delivery, and contagious in his impact. He leads the reader in a profound checkup regarding their perception of the Gospel of Jesus by reading through the â€œlensâ€ of a Kingdom of God worldview. A worldview with a rally cry, â€œJesus is Lord.â€I found the suggested activities, prayers, spiritual exercises, interactive questions, and personal improvement journal approach, especially helpful. Slaughter those Christians, the called out ones, who make up the Church, to hear, heed, and practice the word of Jesusâ€™ recognizing themselves as the rebellious fringe in contrast to the status quo. He further calls the reader to recognize the inconsistency of the pursuit of the comfort of wealth with Jesus teaching on the command to â€˜bring good news to the poor, to bind up the broken, and to proclaim release to the captives.â€  He shares from experiences along his personal spiritual journey  and â€œlife callingâ€ to become a disciple of Jesus.Slaughterâ€™s writing is practical in approach, relevant to todayâ€™s culture, cutting edge in application. â€œRenegade Gospelâ€ ia highly endorsed by recognized church as inspiring and challenging for fervent believers or questioning skeptics alike.

The Four Intelligences of the Business Mind: How to Rewrite Your Brain and Your Business for SuccessBy: Valeh NazemoffCA Press978-1430261643, 2014, 118 pagesReviewed by Richard R. Blake, richard330@yahoo.comIn her book â€œThe Four Intelligences of the Business Mind" Valeh Nazemoff introduces Keys to increasing focus, resulting in clarity of thought, enhancing decision making skills, and setting priorities, through transnational Intelligence impacting complex organizations: people, processes, technology, information, and performance.Nazemoff goes on to combine a balance of analytic, intuitive, social, and brain/mind consciousness in the individualâ€™s recognition of both personal and shared strengths and weaknesses within an organization. She describes how the brain and mind function. I found this discussion extremely interesting and especially helpful in understanding the area of the frontal lobe of the brain in decision making, problem solving and planning. This is also the area that enables cognitive thinking and controls judgment, speech, and reasoning.I was personally drawn to the chapters that highlighted pattern recognition and what can be done to sharpen and transform our entire business mind and strategy mapping for integrating the four intelligences for success.Among other things I found helpful include:â€¢ A highly important discussion of determining a mission statement, vision, and values.â€¢ The inclusion of intentional deliberate exercises for raising the level of consciousness resulting in a heightened state of alertness.â€¢ Her conclusions regarding the inter-link of collaborating: Financial, Customer, Data, and Mastermind with Money, Manpower, and Resources.The author demonstrates â€œa keen understandingâ€ of business operation, organization, and principles; brilliantly linking them to organization psychology, neuroscience, and technology.The book is highly endorsed by leaders in the fields of business, education, management.I received a complimentary copy of this book for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

Claire was sad as she finished her Easter project; a gift intended for her friend Mr. Washington, the school custodian. He always had a smile on his face and a song on his lips as he greeted the children in the halls of the school throughout his working day. Just when spring was bringing the promise new life â€“ Mr. Washington died. Claire would not be able to deliver her gift to him.The lifelike drawings and careful attention to detail of Susan Stoehr Morikisâ€™ illustrations convey the emotions of disappointment, curiosity, playfulness, pensiveness and pure joy, bringing out full impact James Nelesenâ€™s adaptation of the Easter message and discover the meaning behind the resurrection of Jesus and the traveling song of Mr. Washington.Children five through nine will identify with Claire and her little brother Ben as they color Easter eggs and prepare baskets for the traditional family celebration.The story-line of the narrative, the accompanying illustrations, and the dialog will stimulate questions, conversation and discussion, and provide those opportune unexpected teaching moments.â€œ. Washingtonâ€™s Traveling Music â€“ A Joyous Story of Eastertimeâ€ is an important resource for family night reading, as well as in the Christian Education resource library, and church school classroom.

Award Winning Judy Loveâ€™s cover art and the title â€œSpider Sistersâ€ attracted my attention in the childrenâ€™s section of our church library. I recognized the name of bestselling author John Trent and his choice of a rhyming metered verse to relate the story of the unique bonding of sister.Although the rhythm of the narrative is consistent in its pattern, I found it took a concentrated reading to deliver the chosen meter. Reading aloud is a definite must for the fullest family enjoyment of this reading adventure.  Judy Loveâ€™s colorful, clever, and charming illustrations make the story jump off the page.Spider Sisters is an enjoyable story with a message. Fun family entertainment for all ages.

This highly imaginative story of Sidney and Norman showcase the highly imaginative gift of master storyteller Phil Vischer, creator of the Veggie Tales series and the artistic brilliance of illustrator Justin Gerard. This parable like tale helps juvenile readers get a glimpse of Godâ€™s love through the eyes of Sidney, and a lesson in humility and sensitivity to others through Normanâ€™s awakening to his pride and self-centered attitudes.â€œSidney and Norman a Tale of Two Pigsâ€ is good family read aloud entertainment or for developing the reading skills for middle elementary and preteen readers. Justin Gerardâ€™s artwork closely reflect the narrative and add a lifelike dimension to the story igniting a personal identify with the characters and an empathy with the feeling of Sidney and Norman and an application for responding to Godâ€™s love.

Jacob a young carpenterâ€™s apprentice is in completion with three other young apprenticeâ€™s for the honor of participating with Rabbi Simeon in the building of the new synagogue.Max Lucado is an author who always comes through with good spiritual applications, interesting background situations, and leaves the reader wanting more. Illustrator Robert Hunt is an award winning illustrator. Maybe my expectations were too high. I was personally disappointed with the story line. With the exception of one or two of the color illustrations I was left with a feeling sadness or hopelessness.The book or the accompanying DVD provides excellent discussion starters for family night reading and viewing, especially when the children vary in age. I was unable to determine the intended target audience as the narrative is too advanced for young readers and somewhat juvenile for preteen and youth readers. The dramatic closing scenes are touching and rich in life application.

In â€œThe Sunflower Parableâ€ Logan works with his farther in planning, preparing the soil and planting his very own garden. He wants to grow something that will be bigger than his brothers cornstalks and his sisters hollyhocks.I enjoyed Nancy Mungerâ€™s delightful and colorful illustrations which directly correlate to the narrative and  provide a visual perception that adds an important dynamic to the story.Well chosen scripture verses teach the progression of the planting season and provide a logical spiritual application which emphasizes character building principles and Biblical truth.The vocabulary and story line is appropriate for children ageâ€™s three to seven. Highly recommend for read aloud family times. Young readers will also enjoy the challenge of learning new words and concepts.

Usborne has established a repetition for excellent entertaining education publications. I was disappointed with the Magic Toyshop. The concept of recognition of differences in the pictures is great, however, the book became quite complicated. i wish that an age level would have  been including. The attractive color pictures with multiple bright colored illustrations is a plus, however the pages are so full of choices that it became difficult not to lose the number found during the difficult searches. The answer pages are small and also a bit hard to follow. Visual learners will be challenged but will be entertained and rewarded for their perseverance with a real sense of accomplishment at their achievement.

Tony Morrisâ€™s illustrations add another touch of charm to Mig Holderâ€™s retelling of â€œPapa Panovâ€™s Special Day.â€ As Papa Panov opened his book to the story of Jesus birth on Christmas Eve his thoughts turned to Jesusâ€¦as he nodded a he received a visitor and a promise he would see Jesus pass through on his street on the next day.Papa Panov watched for Jesus throughout Christmas Day, a parade of people passed by, on the street outside his window. At the end of the day Papa Panov realized the significance of his visitors.â€œPapa Panovâ€™s Special Dayâ€ has a classic message for children of every generation. Highly recommended as a book for read aloud family seasonal reading. A delightful find in our church library.

Jeremey, Barnabas, and the Wonderful DreamBy Joni Eareckson TadaIllustrated by Ann NeilsonWhile on a vacation of his Uncle Daveâ€™s farm Jeremy was eager to impress his uncle by rushing through his chores. Inadvertently he left the feed bin door open; the result was pandemonium.Through a Bible lesson from Aunt Jeanie and a dream of a talking cat, Barnabas, Jeremeyâ€™s misadventure becomes a lesson for young readers to learn that God is in control and we can learn from our mistakes.Ann Neilsenâ€™s attention to detail in her illustrations brings the story to life, and enriches the enjoyment of the story for children ages 4 â€“ 7.I was fortunate to find a copy of this book in our church library. The book is ideal for reading aloud or for young readers at various levels of reading.

In her book â€œBecoming A Spiritually Healthy Familyâ€ Michelle Anthony compares our life journey to that of families working together to â€œlive on script each day,â€ pressing on toward the goal. She identifies six dysfunctional parenting styles and shows how by shifting our goals we can live abundant lives resulting in spiritually healthy families.Anthony helps the reader identify their parenting style, assess family relationships, determine responses, and consider fresh perspectives.  She uses personal experiences; illustrative stories, Biblical examples, and practical â€œReflect and Respondâ€ questions and exercises to form practical affirmation statements, and action plans, for formulating authentic environments for becoming a spiritually healthy family.â€œBecoming a Spiritually Healthy Familyâ€ is packed with workable Biblical principles and practical life changing guideline, inspiring a new generation of parents to model Christ and to train their children to know Godâ€™s Word and respond to His love through a commitment to follow Him.A complimentary copy of this book was provided for review purposes. The opinions expressed are my own.

This is BY FAR the best Argan Oil Conditioner I've tried so far!  I love the way it makes my hair soft, manageable and tangle-free.  It smells nice also.  I've tried both Agadir Argan Oil Daily Moisturizing Conditioner and HSI Professional Argan Oil Smoothing Conditioner.  The Agadir is much lighter and the HSI is about the same as the Amir (as far as being a heavier conditioner).  I just liked the results from the Amir Conditioner better.  It is very rich and moisturizing.  All 3 brands smell really nice.  I also tried the Amir Shampoo, but prefer the Agadir Argan Oil Daily Moisturizing Shampoo better because it was more moisturizing (and easier to lather up).  I do plan to continue using the Amir Shampoo though.  The HSI shampoo tangles my hair terribly, so I don't use it.

I just replaced my windshield wipers a few weeks ago when I had to get a new windshield.  The company that did installed the new windshield put on these exact same Bosch wipers (which they said were one of the best).  These wipers work great in torrential downpours and little sprinkle drizzles.  These are quality wipers that last.

Unfortunately, this $70 product didn't do much more than similar $20 products.  I have to be extra careful using this type of product during the summer when I am outside a lot.  I used only a very small amount over a week period and it dried my skin too much, so I immediately stopped using it.  The skin on my face has been very sensitive lately.  I have dry skin that gets that T-zone shine very quickly.  I don't think this product was meant for skin like mine.

We normally play with the Killerspin JET500 Table Tennis Paddle and the STIGA Pro Carbon Table Tennis Racket paddles on the STIGA STS 420 Table Tennis Table with STIGA 3-Star Table Tennis Balls, (6-Pack) (white and orange) or JOOLA iPong Seamless Poly Pro 40+ Table Tennis Training Balls.  The paddles we currently use are slightly higher than this Joola Spinforce 300.  We like this Joola paddle, although my son says that his Killerspin JET500 is better because of the spin that it can put on the ball.  What surprised me is that ALL 3 brands of the paddles look almost exactly alike.  In fact, in very poor lighting, it would be difficult to tell the three paddles apart.

These are not fancy-looking or elegant lace curtains, so I would not hang them in a "main," front room.  However, they are nice enough for back rooms and open-spaced storage/closet areas (that need to be blocked off).  They are also good for the double layer look (as the back curtain).  Of all of the lace curtains, the lattice design is my favorite.

These are not what I was expecting at all.  I was expecting something similar to the dishcloths I have now.  Instead, they are like washable/reusable paper towels.  Generally, I prefer to throw my paper towels away after I clean up a mess.  For that reason, I use these to wipe the table down, clean off dishes ... and not for anything messier.  For my purposes, these are perfect.

We normally play with the STIGA 3-Star Table Tennis Balls, (6-Pack) (white and orange).  We've tried the Stiga 1-Star and 2-Star also, but definitely like the Stiga 3-Star better.  The immediate and main difference we noticed between these JOOLA iPong 3-star balls and the Stiga 3-star balls are that these iPong balls spin significantly more, and it's significantly easier to put the spin on them.  As far as bounce, the iPong balls had the same bounce as the Stiga 3-star balls.  For reference, we play with the Killerspin JET500 Table Tennis Paddle and the STIGA Pro Carbon Table Tennis Racket paddles on the STIGA STS 420 Table Tennis Table.

I usually use the Schick Hydro Silk for Women Razor, which I love.  This Bic Soleil does not get as close and smooth of a shave as the Schick Hydro Silk (which has 5 blades, versus Bic Soleil's 4 blades).  I would say that this Bic Soleil is comparable to the Gillette Embrace Women's Razor 1 Razor Handle and 2 Razor Refills (which has 5 blades) though.  I generally don't use/like disposable razors, but I like to keep them on hand in our guest bathroom and in my travel case (for use while I'm on vacation).  I have used BIC razors before and this Soleil is much improved over the older BIC versions.  The four and five blades make all of the difference in getting a smooth shave.  Next time I need a disposable razor, will definitely be buying more of these.

These bags are the perfect strength and size for yard work, carrying donations to our local charities and disposing household items/junk collected during the big spring clean-up.  These are heavier and stronger than the standard kitchen bags, but they are not invincible.  They can/will rip if sharp objects catch them the right way.

We used this mouth wash after my son had his tonsils removed.  It worked wonders in getting rid of the horrid smell!  We've found this mouthwash works best after it's used regularly over time.  He still uses it because he is a mouth-breather (which results in dry mouth).  I even have him brush his tongue with it.  This is by far the most effective mouthwash.  We see/smell way better results than we ever saw with Scope or Colgate.
