Old El Paso is my "go-to" for packaged taco shells.  They are always fresh and rarely broken.  I personally prefer the original flavor.  My kids, however, really like this nacho cheese flavor (which is very similar in taste to Nacho Cheese Doritos).  These particular shells are extra wide and stand on their own, which is great for kids.

We have a few patches in our backyard that have erosion from runoff.  Since the weathermen were predicting a lot of rain during April/May, I decided to add soil and till it into the ground, then added this seed.  I can't believe it ... we are actually growing grass in the one patch I added seed to.  I'm planning on buying some more soil and a couple more bags to add to the other patches (while we are still getting rain, and before it gets too hot).

Smells bad!  It smells like I washed dirty, stinky clothes in hot water and forgot to add any detergent.  The closest I can think of describing the smell is stinky pollen.  It is definitely nothing like the other Downy Unstopables, which I love, or any other in-wash scent booster I have used.  And I have used all of the Downy Unstopables, Bounce Bursts, Gain Fireworks, and Dreft Blissfuls.  All of those left my clothes smelling nice.  I will not be using this Downy Fresh Protect again.  This bottle is going in trash.

Our family has been eating Old El Paso taco shells for years.  It is definitely our favorite pre-packaged brand.  This stand and stuff soft tortilla is great as an edible salad bowl.  My kids like to fill theirs with cheese, or melt butter and fold in over.  The tortillas are fresh, soft and tastey.  Glad we tried these.

I no longer use Pantene shampoos, but I still use some of their other hair styling products.  I really like this deep conditioner.  It leaves my hair feeling soft and less frizzy right out of the shower.  I have to change my conditioners at least once a month, so will definitely be using this as part of my hair care regimen.  Yes, it is a very small tube, but (with the coupon) it is a small amount of money to spend to try it out to see if it works.  It can get costly if using alot over a long period of time.  I personally don't mind spending the money if it works to remove the frizz from my hair ... and this weekly rehab creme does exactly that!

This is a very pretty, yet simple necklace.  The chain is thin, and slightly delicate.  The diamonds don't really have any value (per se), but they look nice on the necklace.  The chain is the perfect length and goes without about anything.  This is a great piece for someone who doesn't really wear jewelry (except on those special occasions) and for someone is likes to wear a different piece each day.  It can easily be dressed up, or down.

I generally buy the Fiskars brand scissors, but have also purchased Scotch (as well as some of the generic brands).  These Scotch pointed tip scissors are great for 2nd grade through 5th grade students.  They are easy to grip and sharp enough to cut without being dangerous.  One thing I have noticed about kids scissors is that the quality between the SAME, EXACT scissors can vary wildly.  This set is no exception.  Some scissors did open/close and cut more easily than others, but I've noticed this will all of the brands I've used.  I do like these scissors last us for years, and they can be washed in the dishwasher.  I put a pair in my child's lunchbox so that he can cut open gogurts, cheese (and other items that might not always tear open easily).  Great value!

I got this to replace my previous tote that I used when I traveled.  I really like this one because it has many smaller pockets (plus a big center section).  I use it when I travel and stay in hotels.  I put my shampoo, conditioner, hair care products, hair brush, toothpaste, toothbrush, etc and then put the entire tote in an oversized ziploc bag, which I carry in my luggage.  Once I get to the hotel, I just have to take ONE tote out and I have literally everything I need.  It's great!  Highly recommend for frequent travelers, or just occasional vacationers.

We used these GoodNites PAPER pull-up "underwear" to protect against the occasional nighttime accidents for some time now.  Unfortunately, these are not (and do not look like) real underwear.  Huggies recently introduced REAL COTTON, washable Tru-Fit underwear (Huggies Goodnites Trufit Underwear for Boys, Starter Pack Size S-m.  My son prefers the new Tru-Fit cotton underwear over these paper pull-ups (which look like diapers).

I love in-wash scent boosters.  I use them all the time now.  It's been many years since I have used Dreft detergent, but the Dreft Blissful in-wash scent booster smells exactly like the Dreft I remember.  It reminds me of Johnson's baby oil.  I like it, but for some reason it is much more expensive than Downy's scent boosters.I have tried several different brands and scents over the last 2 years.  Downy Unstopables Spring In-Wash Scent Booster Spring 26.5 Oz/Downy Unstopables In Wash Spring Scent Booster Laundry Fabric Softener, 13.2 Ounce is my favorite.  (It is the famous April Fresh Scent (just like the Downy Fabric Softener Sheets, April Fresh, 120 Count)).  I have also tried Bounce Bursts In-Wash Scent Booster Outdoor Fresh 26.5 Oz (which is now my 2nd favorite), Downy Unstopables In Wash Booster, Fresh Scent, 19.5 Oz and Downy Unstopables Dreams Scent Beads 31 loads, 19.5 Fluid Ounce, and Gain Fireworks In-Wash Original Scent Booster 26.5 Oz (which I don't really like).All of the in-wash scent boosters smell much stronger in the container than they do after the clothes have gone through a wash cycle.  I primarily use less a half a cup to help neutralize smelly clothing odors and about a fourth of a cup on my regular loads.  I use to only use the in-wash scent boosters on my smelly clothes, but I liked it so much that I now add it to all of my loads.  It even makes the house smell nice and fresh.  The only difference between Dreft, Downy, Bounce and Gain ... the scents, that's all.As far as cost, $5.99 for a 13.2oz bottle and $11.99 for a 26.5oz bottle is a good price for in-wash scent boosters.  Like Dreft, the Dreft Blissful scent boosters are more expensive.A word of caution ... keep these (as with all cleaners) well out of the reach of small children.  The in-wash scent boosters all look like small pieces of candy or Dippin' Dots ice cream.  And, the containers are really easy for small children to open.

I purchased this for my son, who plays competitive baseball.  He owns about 4 or 5 different brands of compression arm sleeves, and this one is his favorite because of the fit (and grippy material on the inside bicep).  He says this one feels comfortable and stays in place on his arm during baseball practices and games.  Our only issue with the arm sleeve is the white contrast stitching on the black sleeve.  At many baseball tournaments, they are very strict with what pitchers can wear.  Sometimes contrast stitching (especially white or gray colored stitching) is considered a "distraction" and not allowed.  I actually colored the white stitching on ours with a black Sharpie laundry pen, so that is was no longer an issue.  I do wish that more colors (like red and blue) were offered.As far as sizing, the manufacturer shows the following sizing chart on the images/pictures.YS:  wrist 4.75"  bicep 6.75"  length 12"YM: wrist 5.50"  bicep 7.25"  length 14"YL:  wrist 6.00"  bicep 8.00"  length 15"My son's wrist measures 5.5" and his bicep measures 8.5".  I purchased the YM and the fit was perfect.  Highly recommend!

This toaster replaced my 15 year old Westinghouse toaster, which did not have wide slots or anything fancy at all ... just a dial and a handle.  I really like the wider slots and the regular and frozen modes ... since I use all of these features.  My bagels, toast, waffles and muffin tops all heat up much faster in this toaster.  This is only the second toaster I've owned.  Who would have ever imagined that my cheapy toaster would last 15 years?!  Hopefully, this toaster lasts just as long.

This is a lotion, not a cream, so it is not as thick or moisturizing as a thought it might be. That being said, for a lotion, it does a fairly good job of moisturizing. For someone with eczema or other serious dry skin condition, a cream version would definitely provide better moisture relief. This lotion does not really have any scent. Also, while it is not completely non-greasy, that feeling does not linger. Our family has very dry, allergy skin, so we will definitely be adding this to our rotation.  Does a good job of stopping the itch, which not all creams/lotions do.

This game, which is easier than the original game, is perfect for the younger, Spongebob crowd.  This game is targeted to younger kids because it does not have those "difficult to remove" parts, like the original Operation game.  We've owned several versions of Operation over the years, including the original, classic and Spiderman versions.  This game is great for younger kids just getting into doing "operations."

I really like the slide lock bags.  I use ZipLoc, Hefty and Great Value brands.  I actually prefer Hefty of the three brands, especially for the really large bags.  The plastic seems stronger/thicker and the plastic sliders don't seem to pop-off (or stop working) as frequently as they do on the other brands.  I use these to keep and store food.  I also use the larger (gallon and larger) to store and protect important documents/photos in my "emergency bag."

The "red" Jolly Ranchers are our favorite.  And our favorite "reds" are strawberry and cherry.  Unfortunately, ALL (yes, ALL 12 bags) had over 50% watermelon flavors in each of the 12 bags.  About 25% of each bag was fruit punch.  The remaining almost 25% of each bag was cherry and strawberry.  In fact, there were no more than 5 strawberry flavors in any one bag. :(  They really should rename this mostly WATERMELON and FRUIT PUNCH with only a FEW CHERRY and VERY FEW STRAWBERRY.

This is a great sunscreen that is easy to apply.  I like that it rubs in easily and doesn't leave that "white" sunscreen look.  I, however, am not a fan of the scent.  It is the perfect size for carrying around in your purse or baseball bag.

I liked this mat for everything except the sit ups.  I just couldn't get it where it felt comfortable.  It, however, worked perfect for ab exercises laying on my stomach and on my side.  The mat is very well made and seems like it will last.  My husband even started using it as a lumbar support in his recliner.

This is definitely a lightweight jump rope.  The handles and the fact that the rope's length can be adjusted is great.  However, the rope itself is not so great.  It easily tangles and gets kinks, which are not really easy to undo/get out.  The longer the rope, a greater issue this becomes.  When my son uses it with a much shorter length, it is less of an issue.

This is a lotion, not a cream, so it is not as thick or moisturizing as a thought it might be.  That being said, for a lotion, it does a fairly good job of moisturizing.  For someone with eczema or other serious dry skin condition, a cream version would definitely provide better moisture relief.  This lotion does not really have any scent.  Also, while it is not completely non-greasy, that feeling does not linger.  Our family has very dry, allergy skin, so we will definitely be adding this to our rotation.

I am in the process of starting to get organized for the new year ... taxes, healthcare flex spending, bills, etc.  I decided these plastic dividers were perfect.  I decided to put them in one of those over-sized zipper school binders.  By putting it in the zipper binder, the tabs do not protrude beyond the binder and are enclosed.  I used a Sharpie marker to write on the tabs (because I don't plan on erasing).  I have all of my important papers for the year in ONE place, but neatly organized.  Highly recommend these tabs for those looking to get organized.  Just keep in mind that the tabs do extend beyond the standard binder.

The big tabs protrude outside standard binders, but are PERFECT for the oversized ZIPPER BINDERS.  These are great big tabs and are ideal for the oversized ZIPPER BINDERS.  The tabs are not only larger, but are also colored, making organizing a binder even easier.  My son uses these in his zipper binder to help separate his different classes.  The pockets on front of the dividers he uses to store work he is working on, as well as papers that have not been 3-hole punched.  He just started using these, but they look pretty durable.  Will definitely buy more for next school year.

I really like the Mink Brown.  I prefer earthy (but not overwhelmingly dark colors).  This fit the bill.  This eye shadow lasted about 8 hours for me (because my lids tend to get oily ... and I'm bad about touching my eyes during the day).  The container is compact and stays closed, so it's easy to carry in your purse (and re-apply as needed).  I found the best color results by mixing the darker color with the lighter color.  I also used this to color my lips when I had run out of my favorite lipstick.

These are meant for heavy-flow days.  Unfortunately, OB does not have an applicator.  I know this means less waste, but I just don't like not having an applicator, which can make insertion a little more difficult (especially on a heavy-flow day).  I'm sticking with the Playtex brand.

This is a true light pink ... nice color for those looking for light pinks (which are sometimes hard to find).  Because of the light pink color, it is probably better worn in the summer (or when you have a tan).  It does not make your lips pop, or stand out.My one complaint about this lipstick is that it a dry lipstick.  It does not go on moist, therefore you see all the lines in your lips (if they are dry at all).  Also, it's hard to rub your lips together to kind of smooth the color.  One workaround is to apply a gloss or moisturizing lip balm prior to applying the lipstick.  The color doesn't last long, so it will need to be applied throughout the day.This color would probably work best when applied over a slightly darker pink (that might be a little too dark for your taste), which is what I ended up doing.

My son has used the Five Star brand spiral notebooks (wide rule) for several years now.  He uses these and does NOT tear out any pages, because they are used as journals (where everything stays in one place).  These spiral notebooks generally last him the entire school year (or semester).  The one-subject is the perfect size.  In addition, because of the 3-hole punch, they can easily be stored inside larger binder folders.Now, my son is moving up to the college-rule, and these are perfect.  We will continue to use Five Star spiral notebooks for years to come.

This game says that it retails for $69.99, but it is currently priced at $17.23.  At under $20, this is a good value for the game.  My son said that it is similar to Angle Ball, which he plays during gym class.  This game is best played (and more fun) with a larger group of kids/people.  It is easy to carry, set-up and play.

I have to be honest and say that I am not much of a "yard" person.  However, there are some small bushes trees by our front door and windows that needed a desperate trimming.  These were perfect for pruning those small bushes and trees.  I like the small size and the lock.  I also used these for cutting some artificial flowers and plants down to a smaller size..

At a $29.95, this scale does it all!  It measures weight, body fat, water, muscle and bone mass.  I own 5 other scales (all priced on Amazon between $29.95 and $49.95).  None of my other scales measures all that this scale can measure.  This is by far my favorite scale for that reason.  As a word of caution, because it passes a low electric current through the feet, it should NOT be used by pregnant women.  Great tool for conquering one of my New Year's resolutions!

As with all leather cleaning/conditioning products, you should test on a small, hidden area first.  I cleaned an old black, faux leather office chair first.  It did a good job of cleaning, but the chair was a little slippery afterwards.  I used another towel, and was able to wipe most of the slippery residue off.  I also cleaned the beige, leather interior of my car.  It also did a relatively decent job on cleaning the dirt off the leather portions of the doors.  Again, it left a slippery residue, but I was able to wipe most of that off with a clean rag.As a word of caution -- You do have to be careful that the spray mist doesn't get on other items like the floor, carpet or glass.  I do wish they had made these in a squirt bottle, instead of a spray bottle for that reason.

I've used several tension rods.  They can be pretty picky ... finding that exact spot and tension to get it to stay.  I used the 19"-30" rod in a spare bedroom doorway.  I didn't want the door closed, but wanted a curtain to provide some privacy (and room darkening) to the room.  This rod worked perfectly for that.  Now, as with my other rods, I had to fool with it for a little while to get that perfect fit.  A little pit of a pain, but work it in the end.  I'm not sure that a longer tension bar would be able to hold the weight of a thicker curtain.

These bags are almost tissue-paper thin.  They are certainly too thin to hold small gifts or heavier goodies without ripping.  Fortunately, I found some nice gift sacks at Hobby Lobby (currently on sale at 12bags for $1.50).  The Brothers & Sisters (Hobby Lobby brand) is the same size as these, but MUCH thicker.  Lots of designs to chose from too.

These tiles have SO much potential.  I was expecting something similar to the "Find a Phone" app on the iPhone.  Unfortunately, these tiles (as they are now) have very limited use.  What I wanted to use these tiles for, is for my child to keep in his pocket (at school, on field trips, etc.) so that I could track him in case of an emergency (similar to the "Find a Phone" app).  It seems like this *should* be possible.  Instead, these tiles work similar to how pinging the iPhone works, except the sound is WAY quieter and the distance very limited.  I've wondered if keeping the tile in "lost" mode might yield more use, but I don't think so.

I used this on a 4 year old car.  The trim had numerous scuffs and marks, and looked dull.  After I was done, I have to admit, I was impressed.  Even my husband (who never notices improvement on items) noticed this.  It was fairly easy to apply.  Although, I recommend wearing old clothes while doing it.  It's almost like polishing shoes, just slightly messier.  I'm going to look to see what other color options they have.

I'm always having to cut things, and it's usually thick/hard cardboard or plastic.  I have these Fiskars scissors that are really only meant to cut paper and I force them to cut plastic.  Not good for my hands, and not really safe.  I love these Stanley scissors.  Cutting through plastic is almost effortless.  The measurement ticking along the blade is also a nice bonus.  I am SO glad I found these!

I currently own 2 Eatsmart and 1 Bowflex scale, and now this Taylor scale.  I like all of the scales, which range in price from roughly $30-$50 here on Amazon.  This Taylor scale is the cheapest of the three brands.  This is a great basic plus scale.  What all of these scales lack is an interactive APP that could tie in the calorie intake app, with the calories burned app.  Now that would make one useful scale ... where a person could see when they burned more calories than they took in, that they actually do lose pounds.  Seems obvious, but images are powerful ... especially in weight loss.  This is a really good scale.  One thing I did notice is that I occasionally get error messages, that I didn't get with any of my other scales.  Not a biggie ... just jump off and get back on.

I owned a similar one (different brand and way less functions) of these back in the 90s.  In fact, I still have it, and it still shrieks.  I like the First Alert brand.  I have owned many of their smoke and carbon dioxide detectors over the years.  Let me start off by saying that this device is not going to deter anyone intent on doing harm, especially with all the cray crays out there.  Only a firearm is going to stop them in their tracks.What this alarm is good for, though, is to hang on a hotel, dorm or apartment door to alert you (and bystanders/neighbors) of possible trouble and to give you advanced warning to take action (i.e., hide, run, grab your firearm).  This alarm is also good to carry while hiking or when seeking shelter in a storm shelter.  The alarm serves as a continuous loud "scream/yell/whistle" so that rescuers can hear and find you.  When using for this purpose, you will also want to have some disposable ear plugs for yourself.  This is also a good alarm to attach to your handbag or carry-on bag while you are traveling.  I, personally, use my alarm for all three of these only.

The previous weather stripping on the the bottom of our back door was coming apart and needed to be replaced.  This was the perfect solution.  First, I like that it is clear.  Second, it is relatively easy to and install.  And, third, it blocks that colder winter draft that seems to whip into our back door.  I definitely like it much better than the previous stripping.  It seems pretty durable and like it's going to last.

I am a big fans of wipes.  I think I own about 5 different kinds of wipes for wiping various things.  These wipes work really well on cleaning up golf clubs, especially red dirt.  These wipes also work well on cleaning bats (the non-wood type), which is what I used most of them for.  I was actually pleasantly surprised at how well they cleaned them.  A must-have for those with sports equipment.

Prior to getting this StriVectinLABS Extreme Cream, I had been using the following Olay face creams: Olay Regenerist Daily Regenerating Serum Fragrance Free Moisturizer 1.7 fl. Oz., Olay Regenerist Micro-Sculpting Serum Fragrance Free, 1.7 fl. Oz., Olay Age Defying 2-In-1 Anti-Wrinkle Day Cream + Serum 1.7 Fl Oz, and Olay Total Effects Anti-Aging Night Firming Treatment, 1.7 fl. Oz..  All of the Olay creams moisturized and gave my face a smoother texture.  I usually only wore the Olay Regenerist Daily Regenerating Serum Fragrance Free Moisturizer 1.7 fl. Oz. under my make-up because it has absolutely no greasy feel or look to it.  All of the Olay creams COMBINED cost way less than this StriVectinLABS Extreme Cream.So, I have to admit that I was skeptical of this StriVectinLABS Extreme cream.  Whenever I try a new cream, I first only put in on a small portion of my face (in case there are any negative side effects).  I put the StriVectinLABS on and had absolutely no problems.  It is a very thick cream and goes on a little greasy.  But after about 10-15 minutes, the greasy look and feeling are both gone.  I do have to say that this cream really moisturizes.  In fact, I re-applied it about 5 times yesterday to see if I could speed-up the results/effects.  My face definitely is softer and smoother.  No, the wrinkles are not gone (yet! :) ).  I've only used it 2 days, but definitely plan to keep using it because I like how it makes my face feel.  It has a subtle lemony scent, which is nice.  I have several other face and hair care products that have that similar lemony scent, which does eventually fade away.  Personally, because I need to get ready quickly in the morning (and don't have 10-15 extra minutes to wait for the greasy look to fade), I will only apply this in the evening.  However, I will re-apply it at least 3 times in the evening.I will come back and update this review when my wrinkles dramatically fade or the jar is empty, whichever comes first.  BTW, this cream is made in the USA.

These are quite impressive looking chilling stones.  They chill fast in the freezer.  Because they are so large, they are more appropriate for wider-mouth glasses.  Also (as with most all faux ice cubes), they chill drinks, they do not make drinks ice cold.  This is what makes them more suitable for alcoholic beverages than juice, soft drinks or ice tea.  These stones/cubes chill drinks.  They do not make them ice cold (like ice will).

My husband has had this book in his Amazon cart for a little while now, so I decided to grab it for him.  This is a good book of youth baseball drills for the right target audience.  Unfortunately, my husband is not that right target audience.  First, my husband was looking for more of a reference-type book (i.e., looking to do a specific drill for a specific skill).  He didn't want to sit down and read the entire book, instead he wanted to read on a specific skill he was trying to drill that day.  He said that the book was not organized so that he could do that.  Also, he said that the book did not break the drills down by level of play.In fairness, my husband has been coaching/assistant coaching kids aged 7-12 years old for several years now, where he runs/helps run drills at the practices.  Also, he takes our boys to training sessions/camps and lessons that are taught by former professional major and minor league players.  At these sessions/lessons they run various drills for various skills.  In all honesty, this book was not written for someone like him.  Instead it was written for someone trying to familiarize with the various baseball drills.  Again, good book for the right target audience.  I recommend this book to someone looking to learn baseball drills to help coach kids age 6-15 years old (depending on their skill level).

I was so excited to get these Yamaha earphones ... and they did not disappoint.  The sound quality for this price range (~$150) is great.  They also fit comfortably in my ears (which is very important to me).  They come with four different tips, for a perfect fit.  For comparison, my husband purchased a pair of Bose SoundSport In-Ear Headphones for iOS Models, Blue from BestBuy almost two months ago for $149.95.  I would say the these Yamaha and the Bose earphones are very comparable in sound and fit.  I, personally, like these Yamaha earphones better and my husband prefers his Bose earphones.I use these earphones primarily for listening to music while running and working out.  I have used much cheaper earphones in the past, but there is a definite difference.  These earphones are built much better than the cheaper ones, but more importantly is the comfort and sound quality that these Yamaha's deliver.  My workouts are definitely more enjoyable!

I have been looking for an alcohol-free antibacterial lotion that definitely also kills germs, and lasts (since I work up at the school quite a bit).  This fit the bill.  My mom and dad have also been having to go to the hospital much more frequently, so I actually plan to purchase them a bottle so that they can have and and use it to help keep the germs at bay (as much as possible).  The lotion (because of the dimethicone) has a feeling/texture similar to that after you apply face (make-up) primer, or gel-like lotion to your skin.  It feels like it doesn't absorb, but instead sits on top of the skin.  I prefer my lotions with dimethicone, so I like it.

Great little NCV detector.  As a note, you must press and hold the button to turn in on/activate it.  The vibration (no sound) alert can be felt even through the thicker, workman's gloves.  My husband said his favorite thing is that it works well even on tamper-proof outlets.  He said the flashlight was a nice added feature too.

My son frequently has problems with his cup (which is inside his baseball sliding shorts) rubbing.  We hadn't been able to find a good solution until now.  This stuff is great!  No rubbing, no chafing.  Does what it says (without greasiness).

This is a really cute, throwback-look apron.  The fabric is thin, but still ok (and slightly thicker than the Now Designs brand).  The designs are nice and there are even matching oven mitts (Flirty Aprons Oven Mitt, Scarlet Blossom).  Flirty brands also makes these exact aprons in youth/girls size (age 6-13 years).  Overall, cute-looking apron but I'm not sure how well it's going to stand up to repeated use and washings.  (FYI...it says "hand wash only," but I put mine in my HE washer on hand wash cycle and it washed up fine.)  I have noticed that apron's designated as "mens" are made of better/thicker fabric (Flirty Aprons Men's Apron "Kiss The Cook", Red).  So if you are looking for a less feminine apron (no ruffles, ribbons, bows, etc), then the men's Flirty brand aprons seem to be better made.  The men's aprons are still cute (and can be worn by women).

OXO is one of my favorite brands for kitchen utensils.  In fact, most of my kitchen utensils are OXO.  This poultry baster is much better than my current, older baster.  I like several things about this baster.  First, it is dishwasher safe.  Second, the little "stand" on the side and the angled tip make it more cook-friendly.  The measurements along the side are in black print, and easy to read.  The bulb is not ball-shaped, which makes it easier to grip and squeeze.  Finally, the bonus brush can be used to clean this baster, as well as other kitchen utensils.  I've never been disappointed with the OXO brand.

My doctor told me during my last visit that I needed to increase my daily calcium intake.  I thought these pills would be perfect, since they are a combo-type pill.  I don't know why calcium pills are so large, but they are.  This pill is no exception.  It was advertised as "easy to swallow," so I mistakenly thought that meant small in size.  No, they are are HUGE ... just gel coated.  I guess I could accept that IF I only had to swallow one a day.  I just cannot swallow 3 a day.  One, there is no way that I am go to remember to take 3x/day, everyday.  And, two, they are large.  I plan to use this bottle at 1x/day (so, lower dosage) until I can find something that truly is 1x/day.

This is a really cute, throwback-look apron.  Unfortunately, the fabric is thin ... but still ok.  The designs are nice and there are even matching oven mitts with a similar design by another manufacturer (Jessie Steele Kitchen Cherry Oven-Mitt with Bow).  Now Designs also makes these in youth/girls size (Now Designs Sally Kid's Apron, Cherries).  Overall, cute-looking apron but I'm not sure how well it's going to stand up to repeated use and washings.  For some reason, I've found that apron's designated as "mens" are made of better/thicker fabric (Flirty Aprons Men's Apron "Kiss The Cook", Red).  So if you are looking for a less feminine apron (no ruffles, ribbons, bows, etc), then the men's aprons seem to be better made.  The men's aprons are still cute (and can be worn by women).

This has a good flavor for a pre-workout drink, decent price, and I have noticed a difference in energy levels while working out. For the money, you can't go wrong with a mix like this. I also like the Fit-Aid cans, but those are really expensive compared to the same amount of doses for the mix it yourself C4 variety. Try it, I bet you will like it.

Cobb captures the heart of a small town in his latest book, Darkness the Color of Snow. The novel opens with a tragic scene where a young man dies, and the line between accident and murder is blurred at the start. Rather than resolve this tension, Cobb draws the reader deeper into the ambiguity of good and evil, fate and chance.What I liked:* Dark book that is extremely realistic and believable* No easy answers given* Explores the evil underlying normal people* Beautifully written. Plays out like a movie while you are reading it* Surprising twists, but never cheap twists* Having grown up and lived in small towns, this captures them perfectlyWhat I didn't like:* Still thinking through the ending . . . can't decide if I like it or not. Only part of the book that feels a little forced, but I think it is growing on me.All in all, a great read and highly recommended if you like dark novels that explore human nature. I wouldn't say its a crime drama, but it is a great read and one that you will really enjoy. Highly Recommended.
Great product, works well. If you just need a short connection, this is a good cord at a good price. Recommended.

This is a hard one to review. Yes it works, and it works well. Your bacon will be cooked well and have less grease (although you could argue less grease is a bad thing . . . ).As good as it is though, its hard to recommend this over a cast iron skillet or a sheet pan to cook bacon in the oven. If you love kitchen gadgets, this does what it promises. Otherwise, get a pan.

Great printer, does everything it should and does it well. Only complaint is that it seems to use ink a little fast, but that's true of almost all printers these days. Good price, great product - you won't be disappointed.

My wife was excited to get this to help train her little sisters. All in all, works great and is a very good price. There are only a few basic stitches, so you will run out of 'learning room' quickly, but it works for what it is.The price is good, it works well, but you might be better served paying a little more for a model that can grow as you do. If you are buying for someone very young or someone who just wants to learn the very basics and won't advance quickly, get this one.Recommended.

Great, helpful read. I can't remember where I saw it, but I remember reading somewhere that the best indicator of a child's future success is how many books their parents had in their house. Not necessarily how many they read, just how much they had access to.This book is filled with practical tips that you can use for any age kids. If you are a reader already and want to pass on your love of reading to your kids, this is a great place to start. If you wish you read more yourself, I would still pick this up and read it first. It will inspire you to read more and remind you of the importance of it for your children.Highly Recommended

Great design, very well made. The only real issue I have with it is that they do not seem to clean as well as other microfiber towels I have, probably because they are not holding as much water. Great price, hard to go wrong here. If you are looking for microfiber towels, get these.

Great deal on very good ping pong balls. Get the 80 pack and these will keep your game room stocked for a long time. Very well made, truly seamless, and fast shipping. If you are looking for ping pong balls, get these. Recommended.
Great fish oil pills, no aftertaste or 'fishy' burps. For the price, these work as a supplement and are very good for you. Highly Recommended.

This is a great little scooter that your kid will absolutely love. Easy to use, safe, and rides very well. Seriously, your kids will love this - my four year old can't stop wheeling it around and we have to take it with us now when we go somewhere. For the price, you can't go wrong here for your own family or for a gift. Highly Recommended.
Great set of copper mugs. These are big mugs, very thick, and they look great. Exactly what my wife was looking for - if you want copper mugs, get these.

Sometimes the simplest ideas are the best ones . . .This is a great product for just about anyone, whether you have back pain right now or not. As a real estate agent, I spend a fair amount of time on the computer, where a lot of back issues start. If you don't spend the time to correct your posture, then you will experience pain down the road. This back strengthener does exactly what it promises and will help you gain strength quickly.Of course, you could buy a brace and use it the rest of your life. Or you can try this - for about the same price if not cheaper - and actually strengthen your back and leave the brace behind. Order it, try it, use it and you will see a difference. Highly Recommended.

Great trick, great presentation.DVD quality is top notch, spells out everything you will need quickly and easily.I don't think you will find a better product at this price if you are looking for one good trick. Highly Recommended.

This is a great read for Ariely fans. I wasn't aware he wrote an advice column, and this is a quick compilation of some favorites. It's an excellent read and very well done, but I can't give it five stars for a couple of reasons.First, there is some really good advice here. For instance, pretending to tell your best friend what to do is one of the best decision making tools I have found, and Ariely points it out in just a few paragraphs. That's great . . . but its interspersed with so-so advice and comedic relief. I think that works well for a column, but its an easy book to read quickly and pass over the good stuff.Second, I would recommend at least three of his other books before this. In my opinion, this is for Ariely fans but not for very many other people. I would recommend Predictably Irrational before this one to almost anyone.It's good, it's priced right, it's a quick read in a short paperback - recommended for Ariely fans.

My least favorite of the series so far. The only ones I liked were the Coronation Kings and the coins in a strange land variation. The other tricks involve a little too much setup or seem too obvious to be much more than puzzles.Also, this one is strangely missing a table of contents at the beginning. Not sure if that's just my copy or not, but annoying. I would recommend Ensuing Impuzzibilities and Impuzzibilities first, only get this if you love everything in those and just want more.

Best of the bunch, if you get just Impuzzibilities book, get this one.Of the first four, this is the best. The variations on his nine card trick are excellent - you name the specific card here instead of the card's location. The Automatic Ace Triumph is probably my favorite 'long distance' trick of the series. Surprising and easy to do. Three equivoque 'think-of-a-card' tricks, all have good ideas. My favorite is the Cardless Cantico. Moraskill is a great variation on Miraskill, the Tuzot Sensu mystery is excellent for a group, and Dining Out is also very good.If you want to try the series, start with this one and maybe the very first one as well, which has the best trick of the series in the Ten Boys Deal and the interesting Bermuda Triangle Trick.

Nice, short collection of quick bets useful for getting a drink. There are some fun things in here, and some unique ideas. If you are looking for something along these lines, this is the dvd to get. At this price, it won't take long to pay for itself.I wish that it had some live performances, even if not all of them. The presentations all come across as 'canned', even though the info is good. Nice collection, can't go wrong with the price.

This is good, has some good ideas, but too many similarities to the first book in the series, Impuzzibilities. Admittedly, there are some better presentations here - I think the Universal Password is a great presentation of the 'nine card trick', probably the only one I'll use. But, there are not really any new principles here compared to the first book, just new presentations. If you loved the Nine Card Principle, Clock Principle, and the Automatic Poker principle from the first book, then get this for some new angles. Otherwise, stick with the first book and you won't miss out on too much.

Great, short book of self-working tricks. This has some real gems in it and if you build on the author's ideas, you can create many more tricks using the principles that he reveals in the book. Most of these should probably be classified as 'puzzles' more than tricks, but with the right presentation a few of them are definite keepers.My favorite is a 3 phase ten card poker deal, shuffled between each hand, and ending with a royal flush. Very clean, undetectable, and as easy as it gets. If you are looking for a ten card deal or want something to add to it, this is worth getting the book by itself.Other highlights include the Five Card Trick, 3 Card Monte, Nine Card Trick and Full Deck Version - all of these can also be performed long distance, whether over the phone or on video. Work through these as they are described and you will fool yourself with many of them.Highly Recommended.

Great deck of cards, very well made and the four extra gaffs were nice, but unexpected. Each card is different, however the faces are all standard Bicycle deck faces. This is exactly what I wanted, but if you are looking for something different this probably is not the right deck for you. High quality deck, great price, and some cool bonus cards - highly recommended.

Functional, works great, and a very good price. If you don't have a lemon squeezer, get this one. Makes squeezing lemons and limes for lemonade or margaritas much faster, and you get more out of them then using your hands.

I'm torn on this one, here's why.Things I like:* Case looks great. Not too 'rubbery', slips in and out fine, and rugged enough to provide protection.* Really works - phone will last much longer with this* Comes with everything you need, very easy to useThings I hate:* Having to extend the headphones with this case on* The different charger port* Makes an already big phone ginormousBottom line: this works, and works very well. But I don't have much need for it everyday. It will be in use when I travel, camp, etc. and need longer battery life when I am out and about, but too many disadvantages to be my everyday case.

Can't beat this one for the price. Easy set-up, fast computer, Windows, works great. There is some 'junk' that comes pre-installed, but that was easily taken care of. If you are looking for a functional desktop that is affordable, get this one.

This is a hard one to review, mainly because I have a lot of pop culture/theology books and they all share many similarities. This book is well-written, but I wouldn't say it is any better or any worse than the other ones of the genre. One unique chapter on video games, but other than that not much new here. If you are really interested in how pop culture and theology can intersect and point to Christ, I would suggest picking up a book that focuses on one movie and many allusions and symbols, rather than a book that covers one or two symbols in many movies. Almost any show or movie that you really like will have something available, and it may help you 'see' the symbols in other areas better than the scattershot approach.Again, well-written, nothing I disagree with, but would be hard to recommend over any other book. It is the most recent and has newer references, so if you don't have any books on this subject yet give this one a try.

Easy to use, great idea. Yes, the price is expensive, but if you grill more than once a month this is worth it. It will save you time and make sure you cook better food for family and friends. I have had no problems with it, works very well. Highly Recommended

This is another book in a long line of books on habits and behavior change available now. There are some good things here, but not much that is new or that will change your mind. In fact, one of the best parts of this book is that he points out more than once that change is hard and you need help, ideally a coach. Speaking from personal experience, having a business coach is one of the best things you can do to affect change.Some points I really liked, unique or not:Triggers cause behavior, and our environment has an enormous influence on us.You are not exceptional.Change is ridiculously hard for adults.Mindfulness as an integral part of breaking/changing the habit loop for behaviors is a great addition. Implied in other works, but I thought this was one area where the author really added something new. (The six questions to kick-start change were also new and helpful, but in some ways a let down and too generic.)Unfortunately, I'm not sure you need this book. It will help if you are coaching others, and its a pretty good overview of habits and habit change, though I found Better Than Before to be a more engaging read and with more helpful insights. That coupled with the shorter length of this book and higher price make this one hard to recommend, at least when compared with what else is out there. If you like Goldsmith's other books already, probably worth getting - otherwise get a copy of Better Than Before.

This is the first book I have read by Brooks, and I am very impressed. This is a great read, one of the best I have come across this year, and it will change the way you think. Brooks pulls from many different disciplines, redefines classic character traits with a modern viewpoint, and shows the way for lasting character change.The content is excellent, the writing is top-notch, and almost anyone I know can benefit from it. Highly recommended for all.

Not great . . . but ok. For what it is, its well written, but its too broad and shallow to appeal to most. The most interesting tidbits are on the con games you can do yourself. The casino advice is useless - would have been nice to recommend a few specifically for blackjack and craps. I like Harry Anderson, but this book is not one that I would recommend.If you are looking for a similar type of book, check out Lovell's How To Cheat At Everything. Much larger and more comprehensive, get a little of everything still.
Fits truck well, comfortable, safe, and a great price - has everything you should be looking for in a car seat. Recommended.

Good vitamins, pretty good taste, and my kids really like it. But . . . the only thing really 'Star Wars' is the label on the bottle. The vitamins themselves are indistinguishable shapes. My kids like them, but if I could answer the question "who is this" it would better. You could switch the label to Ninja Turtle vitamins or Smurfs or Lord of the Rings and no one would know the difference.

I received this book as a gift, did not know anything about it before picking it up. I am an avid reader, but science fiction is one of the areas I have read the least in. This collection convinced me to change that . . .Some things I really like about this collection:Before each story, there are two quotes talking about science fiction and genre. These were really great insights into the writers. In many collections, these quotes are worthless throwaways. Not so here, much of it was thought provoking and new to me.Out of the 19 stories, I've read works by only one of the authors before - so a true newcomer. This is a great introduction to works of authors. Here are my two favorites, by far:The Ones Who Walk Away From Omelas, Le Guin: By far, my favorite. Worth the price of the book, the shortest story of the bunch. Can't wait to put this in front of more people, just a great take on life, storytelling, and layers of truth. Stands out as one of my favorite short stories ever now and one that I will return to.The Ziggurat, Wolfe: This is an odd story involving a custody dispute and . . . some science fiction. I'm not sure if I can point to exactly what it is, but its awesome. Some of the best writing and storytelling I have come across. Many Gene Wolfe books are now on their way to my house . . .One more of honorable mention: Angouleme, Disch: Bizarre, interesting, mysterious. I didn't love this story, the first in the collection, but I think might eventually. It's stuck with me and there is definitely more beneath the surface.All in all, a great collection, a great intro to some modern science fiction authors. Highly Recommended.

Very good collection of essays, extremely personal. This collection is deceptively short - some essays are only a couple of pages - but the essays themselves are weighty. If you don't like thinking about the darker side of humanity, don't get this collection. It is often a harsh, unflinching look at the worst in humanity and death and sadness and abuse.Gifted writers sharing some of their most personal stories . . . only reason I don't think its a five star is that there were a couple of essays that didn't seem to fit as well and it's also a hard one to recommend to others because of the subject matter.Recommended if you aren't offended easily and love short essays.

This short primer on marketing is a must read for any entrepreneur. The author has distilled a ton of marketing wisdom into an easy to read book that will pay for itself many, many times over. Good books are always inexpensive when the content is valuable, and this content is very good.Two things that stand out to me for this book as a great recommendation for others. First, it's an easy read. As an avid reader, I read books all the time and have no problem reading 500 page business books. Most people aren't like this, and of the hundreds of book recommendations I have made almost none of them have really been picked up and read. A big part of what makes this book valuable is that its readable in a couple of hours, and even non-readers will be hooked and actually read the whole thing.Second, it really applies to anything. The model of marketing here encompasses start-ups, product launches, books, and basically any business, non-profit, or product you want to launch. One of my other favorite business recommendations for others that is extremely actionable is The $100 Startup: Reinvent the Way You Make a Living, Do What You Love, and Create a New Future, but you have to read between the lines to apply much of the content to businesses other than information products.Highly Recommended and Highly Recommendable.

This is a great little touchscreen laptop, very impressed for the price. With the included Office subscription, its really, ridiculously cheap.I've got big hands, and one of my pet peeves is a keyboard that is too small. This one is small, but its actually not that bad. They maximized the space and you should not have a problem returning emails on it and browsing sites.First time I've used the new Windows Operating System since switching to a Mac years ago. Works surprisingly well, very intuitive, love the the options here.One thing I don't like that has started happening recently: The mousepad gets 'off track'. No idea why this happens or how to fix it, but you have to line up the arrow a few millimeters away from where you actually want to click. Annoying, but I'm sure there is a fix for this or its a fluke and I haven't figured it out yet.This has become by go-to laptop for working on the go. It's very easy to carry, like the keyboard better than my iPad keyboard, and its cheap . . . if I lose it, you can get another one quickly.

I use a Phillips Sonicare normally, and this compares well.Advantages:* Cheap and replaceable* Like the bristles, brush head a little better than the PhillipsDisadvantages:* Louder - sounds like you are using a power tool to clean your teeth* Not rechargeableGood buy for the money, cheap enough to be a travel brush, works very well.

Came across this book through a random post online, decided to give it a try - glad I did. It reads a little dryly at points, but it is a fascinating look at the current prison system and how it is on the inside. From an economist's perspective, there is a lot of information to sift through. I like how the author included an anecdote with each facet of the system he examined as well.Some of the things you will learn:* How governance systems are created - this was an unexpected look at political and social science, very interesting to see what groups of people will do when they are not provided governance, as many prisoners are not* How gangs were created in the system* Why gangs on the outside pay tribute to those inside* 13,000+ cell phones confiscated in California Prison system in one year . . . estimated 10% of what there is* How gangs can serve to lower violence in prison* How broken the system is right now - too many prisoners, not enough protection. There is almost no choice but to join a gang for your own protection* How gangs are created to provide the goods others wantThis is well worth the read, one of the most interesting and thought-provoking books I have read this year. The author did an excellent job of giving an inside look at prisons, governance systems, and possible solutions moving forward.

This is a fun product, but limited replay value. My kids had a lot of fun with it (watching, too young to really use it), but they haven't gone back to it since the one time. It's fun at the right price, but don't expect it to hold their attention for more than one or two sessions. Good gift idea . . . pretty unique.

This is a great, quick read on how to change from a Biblical perspective. The authors succeed in writing a gospel-saturated God-help book with none of the modern psychology usually worked into Christian books like this. Again and again, the authors point out that if you are relying on anything except Jesus (yourself, others, the world, or religion) then you will fail.Great advice and, more importantly, a moving book. The personal anecdotes are short and to the point, the love of Christ is clear, and the book is very well written. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who is 'trapped in sin' or looking for a way to really change.

The pencils are great - very high quality, they do exactly what they are supposed to. The tin is a nice carrying case as well. The problem is that they are priced at over $1 a pencil . . too much. Look around and you can find better options for less money. Works great, but too high of price.

I just set this up yesterday for my kids who started playing basketball.  I picked this up at a local Target for a lot less than what seleers are charging here on Amazon at the time of writing.I was worried about the install as I was going to be doing most of this by myself.  I have all the tools but was still worried based on other reviews here.  The one I bought had a scan thing on it that I used with my ophone to dowload an app on my Iphone which had detailed video of the entire install.  Overall, the install took me about 4 hours of working time.  Here are my recommendations and thoughts1.  Download the app on your phone.  it is super helpful during install.  Much better than printed instructions2.  Saw horses, hammer, block of wood and a good set of wrenches and socket sets are needed.  1/2", 9/16" and 3/4".  have 2 of each.  I used both sockets and wrenches.3.  The base was easily assembled by myself.  The hardest part was atatching the pole to the base but was able to do it by having the base on its side and lining up everything that way.  One note to add, I followed the instructions about marking the poles and banging them into place.  I did everything correctly but i actually had the poles come apart when the entire thing was completed when I was trying to move it.  The middle piece came out of the bottom pole.  I was furious but was able to get it back in and bang it down to the 3 1/2" mark.  I will just have to be careful to not pull it out again when moving.4.  Connecting the backboard to the arms on the pole....that was awful.  Needed two people for this and thankfully my neighbor was out walking and gave me a hand.  It only took 10 minutes but there was no way I was going to be able to do it myself.  When you lean the pole to hook up the board, it has too much weight so it jams the long bolt and you need a second person to move the board around.  And a hammer.  A hammer made it much easier.  But the lower arms still were tough to get enough spacing for the rubber spacer and spring.  But we made it work.5.  Assembled...this thing is HEAVY.  I have a bad shoulder that I had surgery on 8 weeks ago.  It was awful trying to push this up by myself once I had everything installed.  For safety reasons, I would suggest having a second person to help move it even when the base is not full.6.  The backboard is thin and is loud but my kids love the sound.  it held up well our first night shooting in the driveway.  I haven't decided what to fill the base with yet so we were using some makeshift weight to hold it sturdy.  Even with only 75 pounds or so, it held up fine.  I need to find the permanent location for it before deciding on the fill for the base.7. I have this adjusted to 8' as that is what my oldest sons basketball league uses.  IT WAS SO HARD to get the height adjusted to this point.  the springs are so tight that I had issues.  I actually got it to adjust easier by doing it while on its side.  Used it's own weight as leverage.  I did seem to notice it got eaier once I passed the 9' area.  Almsot like there is a real tight area betweem 10 and 9 feet and then it finally got easier.  Whatever it is, it is staying at 8 feet for a long time!  LOL.8.  the installed size is huge.  The pole has a lean in it (which is so much better than the straight ones) and the base is pretty big so it takes up a lot of real estate.  My original plan of putting it between garage doors is not going to happen.Compared to other ones I've seen, this Spalding seems to be of higher quality than the others.  Hoping this lasts because getting rid of it will not be fun based on how big it is!

I've had several Otterboxes in the past for my various Iphones.  This is another great product for the 6S.  Fits well, tons of protection and doesn't make the phone bulky at all.  Very minimal addition to overall weight and size.  Nothing bad to say about it since it is doing its job.

Got this game yesterday and it was an instant hit with both my kids (boys age 8 and 5).  Setup was easy and luckily I had 2 AA batteries available so we were playing within minutes.  The game is made for up to 3 people.  Playing with any less puts one person at an advantage since you can hit the falcon precisely to knock a players chip off.  It doesn't happen all the time but if only 2 players are playing, the person that does not have someone hitting the ship before it reaches their area definitely has the advantage.  This game does not teach you math, reading, or any other educational item I can think of that most games offer.  However, it does help with hand eye coordination and, if I might stretch it a bit, some aspects of geometry and physics since you can figure out proper amount of pressure and angle of attack that you need to knock a players chip off their area.  OK...maybe a stretch but both my kids were quick to catch on so it made it possible for anyone to win.  Fun game and wish I had this when I was a kid!

I like this clock but I find the lack of betteries included with the product a major mistake from the manufacturer.  I could let it go if it was just the AAA batteries but to not include the watch style/round battery is just ridiculous.  Most people have regular batteries around the house but don't usually stock up on other styles.Anyway, the clock is nice looking.  Easy to read and has a minimalistic look to it.  The main clock requires a power outlet to run whereas the outside temp controller only needs batteries.  When I tunred everything on, it took a long time for the clock to start looking for the receiver (indicated by a blicking wireless picture under the time).  It took several attempts to get this to find the receiver but it finally did.  My only other issue with the clock is trying to find a safe/secure place to keep the receiver outside.  I haven't found a permanent location yet where it won't blow away, get covered by snow and doesn't require me to screw it into my house or deck.  Overall, glad I got it but still a bit peeved about the lack of included batteries!

Very nice pans from Amazon.  These are replacing 10 year old pans that have been abused so much that they are no longer nonstick.  These are great cheap alternatives but I still prefer my cast iron ones.  But these are easier to maintain.  I may look to add a bigger pan to this set as this includes a small and medium sice one.

My two boys have played Just Dance 2015 and loved it.  I got this because they do watch Disney (mostly Disney VD) and knew some of the music.  The game works just like other Just Dance games but the rooms/environment that each song has are a bit more "fun" looking that the other just dance games.  My kids enjoy this and it is great exercise.  A lot of the songs are new to them but that doesn't matter becuase all of them are pretty upbeat and make them want to move.  It is definitely age appropriate for an 8 and 5 year old!

I own a lot of headphones.  I am somewhat of a headphone junkie.  I own several pairs of V-MODA headphones including the older wired pair of the over the ear Crossfades.  They are excellent headphones but they are not my first choice for everyday use.  I have been using my Audio technica ATM-M50's as my daily headphones for probably over a year now.  Sometimes I switch it up to get a different sound signature but the M50's are just so well balanced that I have a difficult time finding something that can compete in this proce range.But...enter wireless headphones.  I have a few sets including a nice pair of senheiser active noise cancelling ones but I haven't found a great set that was free of soem issue (the Senheisers volume is too low for me).  When I was offered as et of these I jumped at the chance because I have had good luck with V-MODA.Design and comfort -  Like the older Crossfades I have, these are some of the most comfortable headphones I own.  I can wear these for hours.  The design is beautiful and you don;t feel silly wearing them like I do with my M50's.  having no crod flying around makes these very easy to use while cutting the lawn, on a train or just lounging around the house.Pairing - I had no issues pairing this to my Iphone 5S.  Following the included instaruction, I was up and running within a minute or so.Battery life - This is one area that I am hoping I will see improvements.  The first 2 charges have not lasted very long.  I have gotten about 6 hours per charge so far and I believe these are supposed to last more like 12.  I know some batteries improve with a few uses so I am hoping that is the case here.  Or it is possible that the rated battery life is based on lower volumes or something.  I tend to listen loud so maybe that is killing my battery.Sound - These headphones were a bit disappointing at first.  Coming off the M50's and having my ears trained to hear those, I found these headphones a bit flat and a bit too bass heavy at first.  I tend to listen to music with no EQ with my M50's but I find I need to EQ these headphones a bit.  I have been playing around with various settings (on Spotify) and find that a treble boost seems to take away some of the "muddy" lowe end sound.  It is not perfect but it helps a lot.  I think these are just designed to push the bass a bit more since people think that equals quality.  As far as soundstage, I find these to be very up front with little soundstage.  Great for heavy rock music that I listen to.  However, I do get some separation at times wich makes them feel a bit more full.  But not a wide soundsatage by any means.  If you are listebing to orchestra type music, I would try these before you buy to make sure they work well for that environment.Cord vs Cordless - the great news so far is that I haven't heard any difference between the two with quality of the music.  Running cordless, these are LOUD headphones with my 5S.  I am running them at about 75% volume which is in line with my M50's.  I find they run the same with the cord.  I have had no dropped sound running wireless.  These just work well.Overall these are going to be with me for the near term.  I love the fact that I am no longer restricted by a cord to get great sound.  I can live with the need to EQ to deal with the low end issue (although this does not work with amazon music) . These are definitley worth considering if you are in the market for quality cordless headphones

I got this for my 2 boys to play with.  Neither plays football for real but they enjoy playing catch with footballs.  We had some smaller nerf ones so this is a little bigger than what they are used to.  My 8 year old can grip this but it is too big for my 5 year old.  Overall, this is somewhat like a nerf but maybe a bit harder so I wouldn't say it's OK to throw around the house too much.  The plays found on the ball are easy to follow so I think it is would be a good teaching tool for kids either playing real football or just having fun.
Very nice towels.  Soft, colorful and dry dishes well.  A great addition to our kitchen towel supply!

These are decent kitchen towels.  We go through towels like crazy and these are for everyday use.  No issues with them. I like that they can be washed in a regular washer compared to some of our other ones which require gentle wash.  I want my towels to be able to hold up to abuse!

This will not replace my regualr after shave balm that I use on a daily basis.  I find this formular to be a bit thick and it goes on like a sunscreen so it requires a lot more massaging into the skin.  If you have razor burn, it makes for an unpleasant experience while applying it.  The good news is that it doesn't cause my skin any adverse reactions after it is applied.  I usually use a sensitive skin balm made by nivea as it has no smell and never causes issues with me.  This seems to be in line with that as far as no reactions but it does have a smell.  Like any hand or face lotion.  I also find that my face seems to get a bit greasy feeling later in the day which is something that never happens with my regular balm.As for helping with signs of aging, I haven't seen any improvement over the first week of trying this so the jury is still out.  I am a 42 year old guy so I don;t think I have severe signs of aging just yet.I will continue to use this until the bottle runs out but not sure I will get this again.

I got this mainly for my Wii U since that does not have native ethernet built in.  Sadly, I cannot get this to work.  I will keep trying but all I get is a lit up device and a message to plug something in.  I am either missing a step or this s not compaitble with Wii U.I did try this on my laptop which has its own ethernet connection so I could compare speeds.  I plugged this in and it installed without much effort.  A ran speed tests with this and I was getting almsot identical speeds between this and the native ethernet.  I was averaging in the 75 to 90mbps download speeds.  So this works well for that purpose.I will be reearching my Wii U issus and will hopefully figure out how to get this to work.  Will post back if/when I do

I use this as a sprinkle on top of my dog's dry food (taste of the town).  They will not eat their dry food without Stella and Chewy's on top.  They are clearly spoiled!  And being beagles, something feels right about giving the, rabbitt!  I wish this was less expensive those as I would consider using this as their primary food.  But I would be living in a doghouse if I did that!

It worked.  That is the best thing I can say aboyt this.  My OEM one stopped working a while ago and was using a different charger that I had for logitech speakers.  That was not the same voltage so it didn't charge the battery when the squeezebox was on.  I finally decided to look for a real replacement and this one was priced right and works.  very happy with it.

I got this to replace an older mat that was in serious need of replacing.  I decdied to try the triangle deisgn vs the rectangle style I had before even though this is for my regular bathtub.  I was hoping for less overall coverage which will help keep the tub clean (i.e. less water trapped under the mat), but enough coverage for those in the shower so they don't slip.  The size is just atad bit too small for my needs but I was able to angle it a certain way so it is usable for now.  This one is not as soft as my other one (a brand I got at Target),  This one allows you to feel the knobs a bit more which I suppose means better non-slip ability.  It was just a bit more rough than what I was used to.  But I think I prefer this more than the other style I had.The suction cups held OK but I could still move this around a bit with my foot.  Something I could always do with my other one as well. It didn;t move as easy so I got no bunching up or slippage.  The material is a bit thicker so I think the added weight helps.I like this brand enough to try their rectangle ones so I will probably move this to my shower stall since the overall size will be more in line with that.  Overall, it is a nice mat.

This is a very heavy canvas cover that I am using to cover my redwood furniture during the winter.  It is large enough to cover two chairs and a table in between them.  I also have a second table stacked on top of the other one and leg rests sitting on the chairs.  This covers all of it and has straps built in so you can tighten them around the bottom to prevent the cover from blowing off in the wind.  Overall, very sturdy and I think it will last many years.

I always keep a bunch of these meals in mu house for emergency purposes.  I usually buy in the large bucket sizes which are brokwn down between breakfast and lunch/dinner meals.  This pack is nice because it contains both together in the pack.  I have eaten every one of the variety that is included in this apck and most are very good for dehydrated food like this.  Much better than others I have tried.  I have used these while camping since they pack well and only require hot water to cook.  I use a Jetboil to quickly heat the required amount of water.  And I keep some readily available at home in case we lose power for a few days like we normally do during snowy winter periods.Not much else to say other than everybody should have emergency food stored somewhere in their house.  And from a taste perspective, it is hard to beat Mountain House.

I am hoping I can rate this a 5 star sometime soon but right now I can't.  There is a major issue I am having with the 2.4ghz spectrum where the signal is horribly unstable.  When it works, I can get awesome Dl speeds around 30mbps.  But when it doesn't work, the speeds seem to be cutting out around 1 to 2 mbps.  So there seems to be something interfering badly from the extender.  As soon as I turn it off, my speeds return to normal.  And rebooting it works for a while then the interference comes back again.As far as the signal strength, I give it 5 stars.  The range is awesome and I maintain full bars even in places where I had no signal without the extender.  However, on the 2.4ghz spectrum, I can have full bars but horrible DL speeds.  My guess is that this issue can be fixed by a firmware update but as of today, the only firmware available is version 1.0.For my troubleshooting so far, the only thing I had done is to reload the firmware.  That has not fixed the issue.Install was easy when I used the auto setup by pushing the buttons on my router and the extender.  I could not get the Ethernet method to work.  The website it tells you to log into kept coming up with an error that something went wrong and try these 4 steps.  None worked ntil I went into my router settings to find the IP address for the extender and logged in that way.  But the other method worked flawlessly.So right now I am running my devices on the 5ghz band whenever I can to avoid the severe drop offs in speed.  I will be contacting TP Link customer service to see if there are settings I can try to fix the issue or if they have new firmware coming out soon.  Do not buy this extender right now.  If TP link fixes it, it will be great.  If they treat this as final with no updates, run away!!

I did not read this book.  My 8 year old third grader read it.  He is a fan of robots after growing up watching movies like Robots and kids shows like Anabots here on Amazon.  He has requested me to purchase the first two books in this series as he had not read them yet.  So from that standpoint, I have to give it 5 stars since it was enjoyable enough to get him to finish it and request the other books in the series.

I think something like this is going to take some time to get a real idea if it works or not. I have been taking this for about 2 weeks now and the jury is still out right now.  From a positive standpoint, I am not getting any joint pain in my knees when climbing stairs.  However, that pain comes and goes so I will see if it lasts.  Another postitive about this is that I love the taste of it.  I could drink the whole bottle in one sitting.  LOL.  The ingredients are quite off-putting when you read them with various fish oils and such but it tastes just like a fruit smoothie.  Very good.Nothing negative yet.  No side effects and no recurring joint pain flaming up.  But, as I mentioned, the true test is still in progress to see if long term benefits exist.

This is my first basketball game in about 10 years so I can't compare how this year's version looks vs. last years.  I have started both a GM mode and a Mycareer mode in this game so far.  I wanted to get the feel for both modes since I am used to playing sports game where you control every player but have never played a game where I am only one person.  The mycareer story is interesting.  I actually like it but it is very linear so even if you don;t win the game, offers come in and you keep progressing.  The GM mode is what I am used to so I am enjoying that.  My only issue is I am terrible at the game right now.  Even on rookie, I am losing games.  I figure I will get better with more time but it is a very complicated gane with all the moves you can do.Graphics are great.  Gameplay is smooth.  It is hard getting used to players not having split second timing on going back and forth.  You actually see delays when someone is turning.  Definitely realistic.As for other customizations, I tried the scan your face which took some time and the end result was something that looked like a blob.  I ended up going with a pre-installed face and customized from there.  My player looks rather frankenstein"ish" fo the name Frek (freak) seems to fit!Was this version worth the extra money?  Hmm...tough one.  the Poster is OK.  It is the picture on the box and my kids are fighting over it so that is goof.  the fathead sticker is an absolute joke.  I was expecting a wall sticker but it is about the size of an Iphone 6 plus.  Not exactly what i was hoping for.  The 30K in currency helped me with my player as I could quickly boost his stats.  It would take me many games to earn that much so that was very helpful.  I haven't found the Jordan gear in the game yet that I supposedly unlocked.  That isn't why I bough this version though.  I wanted the poster and fathead.....so I got one of those!I think this version is overpriced and not worth it unless you are a HUGE Jordan fan and already own every poster of him.  If not, skip this and get the regular edition.  But overall, this game is awesome and will occupy my time for a while.

No one in my family has a gluten allergy but we are always looking for more healthy ways of eating.  The pancakes are the first gluten free product they we have tried that we haven't immediately disliked.  We have tried a million different bread recipes but they always come out tasting flat and stiff.  The good thing about this mix is that the pancakes come up pretty fluffy.  I made these for my kids with some chocolate chips in them (yes, not exactly healthy) and they seemed to like them except they said they were really dry.  I also made some standard ones using the recipe on the package.  It's hard to compare these to other brands as this is my first gluten free pancake mix so I can only compare them to regular pancakes.  What I can say is that these don't taste like panacakes I normally eat.  They have a different initial flavor, almost sweeter, and are a bit stiff even though they come out fluffy.  They are diefinitely dry like my kids said.  But I wasn't immediately turned off by the taste like I have been in the past.Overall, I don't think these will replace my morning pancake breakfast (not something I have often anyway).  As I said, we are not allergic to gluten so we don;t have to be as careful as others.  I think if we were, these would be a great option.  We plan on trying some other recipes with the remaining mix as we have read some other reviewers who have tried a few other ingriedients with it.

These are very durable latex gloves.  I have a medium/large size hand but I got these in large and they fit well.  I would go one size up when ordering these.  I used them this weekend while fixing my tractor deck and one pair held up the entire time without ripping.  The one thing I would do differently though is not get the powder free ones.  It was a bit humid yesterday so getting them on took a bit of effort.  I also found that the gloves were somewaht stuck together in the box so when you go an pull one out, you end up getting a big chunk of them.  Not a huge deal and didn't affect peformance but it is something to think about if you live in humid areas or you sweat a lot.
Dogs love them.  We use these as treats to get our beagles into their crates at bed time.  Works every time.  And with no useless additives in these, I feel good about giving them to my dogs.

I have last year's version of this toothbrush as well as this one.  The one I bought last was this model "Philips Sonicare HX9110/02 Flexcare Platinum Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush"The overall brushing exeprience is pretty much the same.  This is a good thing.  It is probably the best toothbrush I have even used even when compared to Oral B.  I prefer Sonicare.There are a couple of differences with this new model.  The cleaning types are slight different.  Last year's model has a gum care setting which produces a slower clean but with greater virbations (kind of hard to explain but feels like a massage).  This new model adds a deep clean type and I don;t see a specific gum care setting.  The other difference is with the head design.  The new model uses a different shape and bristled head that suppsoedly gives you a deeper clean.  My old heads fit is so it seems to be interchanegable with a lot of the prior designs which is good since I have a bunch of them.Overall this is a great toothbrush and would highly recommend it.  If last year's model is still available, I'd say that is equally as good so if it costs less, grab that instead,

I woke up this morning and immediately purchased this album.  Normally I will check out new stuff on Spotify first but Riverside is one of my favorite bands and I've been gearing teasers on their Facebook page for weeks now.  One thing that jumps out when the first song comes on is the overall production is top notch.  I am listening to it through my home Sonos system which is very good quality for my ears (I am not an audiophile).  Unlike Shrine of a New Generation which had to grow on me (and has now become one of my favorite albums from them, Love, fear and the Time Machine was instantly gratifying.  The mood, like all riverside, has a dark tone to it but somehow still makes me feel good.  Guitars are a bit more prominent in the backing tracks which I am finding as a nice touch.  The guitar solos are classic Riverside which I love.  Vocals are solid and sound great.The album does not continue where Shrine left off.  In my opinion it brings back some of the older sound but with better production.  More complex, more sounds (the range of guitar sounds is much larger than anything they have done in the past).  It has a much more full sound but the way it was mixed still aloows you to hear separation of instruments.
