Nevertheless, for this review, I first tasted Vegan One straight up -- not with water, but with unsweetened almond milk, my go-to base for shakes and smoothies.Did it taste bad? Only if you don't like a strong hint of pureed peas. Sent me back to the feeding-the-kids-baby-food days, it did, and probably ahead to what I'll be eating when I'm in a nursing home and toothless as GUMby (oh happy day). Bad taste? No. Yummy taste? Also no. A draw, then.The deal is, you mix in tastes you like. For my second batch, I put in a cup of frozen organic raspberries and a tablespoon of unsweetened cacao powder for a chocolate raspberry kick. Goodbye peas, hello signature shake. And, as the powder features whole-food ingredients with 20 grams of protein and less than 1 gram of sugar per scoop, who am I to complain? This stuff is good for you, is non-GMO project verified, and is gluten-free -- all things I check for. No dairy. No soy. Check and check.So, no, I cannot join the chorus of negative reviews on taste alone. It's not wonderful tasting, but I don't expect that of any shake and sometimes think shakes known for their "taste" have either too high a sugar profile or too high a "fake" sugar profile, things I avoid like the plague. To me, a shake's job is to offer real food and nutrients for my body. Period. I can take care of the rest with the add-ins.

A good road book is 2% starting point, 3% destination, and 95% road. In MOSQUITOLAND, David Arnold pretty much sticks to these numbers. Good thing. As Bilbo Baggins would be happy to tell you, it's all in the journey (you were expecting "wrist"?). And what a journey! This book is 342 pages, yet I downed it in two days. Maybe that's no big deal, but when you consider this is more a character book than a plot book, it becomes one.So, the protagonist. She's 16-year-old Mary Iris Malone, a.k.a. Mim, and she's different. Unique. Precocious. True, naysayers might rightfully complain, "No 16-year-old girl talks and thinks like this -- like her 40-something-year-old author, I mean," but you need to get over that ipso fasto (Latin for "in a mosquito moment") or else. OK. Done. And then there are some other bits that stretch the old suspension bridge of disbelief a bit. For instance, when Mim runs away in search of real mom (leaving behind Dad and unreal stepmom), she's considered a missing child -- one who will eventually see fliers of herself. But wait. She's also carrying her cellphone. Do the letters G, P, and S mean nothing these days?All that said, it's hard to put the book down (literally or figuratively). Mim is funny, witty, full of allusions, quirky as all get-out, and, thanks be, prone to running into all sorts of characters (savory and un-) on the road from Mississippi to Cleveland. Yes, these characters give her quirkiness a run for its money, but what do you expect for a Greyhound full of strange strangers? By the final 3%, Arnold has offered up a little of everything -- happy, sad, pathos, bathos, love interest, scary moment, mishaps, perhaps, etc. Not bad for a day's work, in other words, and one of the better YAs I've read in the past few years. Is that a recommendation? Do the letters Y, E, and S mean nothing these days?

Sentry's Fiproguard wants you to compare it to the #1-selling Frontline because it hopes to put a dent in those sales. A look at the ingredients comes up a match: each has 9.8% Fipronil and 8.8% (S)-methoprene. These are the pesticides. Beyond that, the comparisons cannot be made, as both are made up of a whopping 81.4% "inert ingredients" (undefined). Given that they are ostensibly the same product, it might boil down to price for most consumers, and that has much to do with WHERE you buy. While available at the vet's, Frontline is not so much a bargain as a convenience when purchased there. As for effectiveness, I find that neither product is 100% effective on ticks, especially after 3 weeks or so, but it certainly cuts down on their presence, which can be robust, given the proliferation of wood ticks in recent years.

I compared these folders to an equivalent product made by an office supply box store -- one I had leftover from an earlier purchase -- and they didn't measure up. The other product is a heavier stock, has a smoother finish, and comes with more distinct scoring for expansion purposes should the file grow larger. The cutting on the Mead folders is fine, and they were well-packaged. The tabs come in three positions -- left, right, and middle.

We have the black stripe small size. Not a dark stripe as you can see some white interwoven, giving it more of a dark navy look. Speaking of, quite nautical in appearance, both due to the stripes and the coil rope handles which look the part. It's woven paper, an odd texture. You feel it and think some kind of plastic, almost like a tarp, but no. Fine for storing lightweight stuff and nice in appearance. I wouldn't weigh it down or tempt its ability to stay super clean and stain-free, though.

Once we wander into "sports recovery drink" territory, we are in the land of asterisks. As no recovery claim on this product is vouched for by the FDA (not that it means much, coming from those three letters), I pour my Vega Sport mix as an act of faith in its producer and in the notion that it probably won't hurt (given the ingredients) and very well might help.So what are these asterisked claims? In order, they are 1.) Replenishes energy and electrolytes, 2.) Reduces inflammation, muscles and joint pain, 3.) Supports immune system function and protein synthesis, and 4.) Reduces recovery time between training.The electrolytes I can vouch for, but it's words like "energy" that get Claim #1 in trouble. The others, you can see, are tougher to prove. Heck, even I can't say. I ask myself: Do I feel more energetic, have less muscle ache than normal, and feel as though my immune system now wears a super hero cape? Subjectively, I can say yes, but the truth is, my "aches" and "recovery time" between workouts has always been variable. Sometimes I have quick rebounds and sometimes not. And that's BEFORE I ever sipped a Vega Sport.Why the mostly positive review, then? It doesn't taste bad (I quaffed a box of the tropical flavor). It doesn't taste great, mind you, but it tastes better than most sports drinks. For one, it has far less sugar and that means a lot to me. For each 12 fl. oz. glass, we're talking 14 grams. That's not insignificant, but it sure as heckfire isn't Red Bull or Gatorade, either.Another plus is the plant-based derivation of the drink. A look down the list of ingredients sends up no alarms. And so, for 90 calories and the possibility that drinking my vegetables, spices, roots, and vitamins might asterisk me to good health sooner, I'm willing to go along with things. Time will tell, though. In the long run, I'll get a better sense. Subjectivity, over months (as opposed to days), becomes a little less subjective.In the meantime, if you're drinking a lot of "energy" drinks that are really caffeine-sugar drinks, some even with artificial coloring added, you can do better. You can drink this.

Jo Knowles "novel" is more like a series of connected short stories, each overlapping, some sharing common characters from a typical high school with typical high school "types." The trouble with such a strategy lies in the characterization. None of the characters get a chance to gather traction with the reader. What's more, you will often meet a character never to meet him or her again, except perhaps in passing or by mention of another character much later in the book.So if you take a shining to a particular character and his or her background (the exposition of which must be covered in each new section), tough luck. You will be disappointed when Knowles moves on. And move on she does. There are many stories here. The boy whose dad does not love him. The overweight cheerleader. The popular girl looking for something more. The regular guy looking for something more as well. The high school drop-out working at a fast food restaurant. The star quarterback who has a fake girlfriend and a secret love for another boy. The new teacher who gets eaten alive by unruly students every day.Some of these scenarios offer YA staples -- characters with predictable woes and behaviors. Others appear a bit more successful. And the conceit holding them all together? You guessed it, oh cover-glancer. The middle finger. Every episode features either our star of the moment giving the finger or getting it. There are more flipped birds here than Tippi Hendren could imagine in Alfred Hitchcock's masterpiece, THE BIRDS. Alas, the bird-flipping doesn't do much for the book and in many cases looks forced. No need to read between any lines, in that case. Trying too hard becomes obvious.Bottom line? There are some nice stretches of writing, but the center does not hold. I'm tempted to say the design itself is at fault, but then I recall the classic WINESBURG, OHIO, which also stitches stories with common characters together -- and succeeds. Perhaps it is a design that requires refined skills. Or perhaps Sherwood Anderson's "grotesques" (as his lovable loser characters are called) are too difficult to emulate, especially with the well-worn stock characters of YA lit set in high schools. Some students may take to these characters, I'm sure, but many others may lose patience without the forward momentum of any true plot.

In French, this means "Precious Serum." Like a lot of cookbooks, it comes from Provence -- fans of Ponce de Leon will be saddened to note that he was WAY off, fishing around the swamps of Florida. Anyway, it's made from a flower called "Immortelle" which is French for "Mediterranean flower with no wrinkles to speak of." These flowers are grown organically by the manufacturer in Corsica. Can you say "exotic"?So anyway, the parts are related. You have Immortelle essential oils, Immortelle floral water, and Immortelle cell extracts (don't ask). The promise? Nothing big. Just smoother skin, firmer skin, and younger skin. The reason? It stimulates collagen production. I asked my wife what this means. She says "wrinkle-filler." Such a scientist.According to L'Occitane, this stuff is "proven effectiveness on both the length and the depth of wrinkles." It's too soon to say because my wife still looks like my wife. She likes that it's not greasy, though, and it has a slight perfumey smell. Like Corsica on a summer morning, maybe.Pricey? I'll say! But if the petals that make up my wife's face never fade (like Immortelles blowing in the Corsican wind), you can bet that investments will be made here!

A bit of a lightweight (both literally and figuratively), but good for very small spaces in need of a bit of warm (as opposed to hot) air. So, if it's just your feet you need to warm, this may answer your needs. It's made in China, and the type of plastic is not marked by a recyclable symbol, so there's that mystery. Also, the small knobs on top do not turn easily and simply consist of a fan and two heat settings (warm, a little warmer). Most exacerbating is the indentation in back. It's only around 1/2 inch deep, so when you try to lift the heater you have to use two hands because your fingers do not go in enough to get a firm grip. I've dropped it the first time for that reason, so learn from my mistake.

The key here is *wireless* subwoofer. The old get-up that I just took down had about a gazillion wires making snake love behind the television set. In this case, there's only one wire between the sound bar and the cable box. The directions said to hook it into the television set, but the TV did not have a connection for this type of wire, so I looked behind the cable box and EUREKA, there it was, so don't trust the directions on this count. Beyond this single connection, all you do is plug in the sound bar and plug in the subwoofer.Hold on. One more step. You have to get your TV's remote, go to the menu, find the speaker settings and turn the TV speakers OFF. Next, you battery up your Yamaha YAS-203 remote (batteries provided, thank you), and you're ready for prime time. The little remote controls surround sound, stereo, subwoofer level and volume level. Much nicer sound.I'm no audiophile and I'm not the handyman, either, yet I managed -- easily. This is good news. This is better sound. Is it sublime? No. Sublime sound is the realm of people who have all manner of speakers and speak in another language ("audio-talk," maybe). But for the layman who just wants to experience the "up" in "upgrade" when he's watching TV, this certainly does the trick. What's more, the device transmits wireless sound from other devices like iPods. I won't use it much in this way, but that doesn't mean you won't.

Most people love chocolate and excuses, in that order. So they find a study that says dark chocolate is good for your heart, accidentally on purpose skip the part about HOW MUCH (or shall I say little) daily, then take it as carte blanche to eat as many Dove chocolates as they want (and, once they get started, they WANT). Sound healthy? Not so much. Sound fun? Sure, but...With Viva Labs organic cacao powder you can have your chocolate and eat it, too. Vitamins, minerals, fiber, antioxidants are all in attendance at this "good for you" party, but sugar is a no-show. That's right. One serving (2.5 Tbsp or 14 g.) of cacao powder has 0 grams of sugar. Sugar is the new fat, as the saying goes.Better still, this product is organic and made from unroasted cacao beans -- a safe, nutritious, and delicious way to get your fix of magnesium and potassium, all with a chocolatey taste. Me, I put a serving in every smoothie I make. Why trust "chocolate flavor" on the label of some can of powder in the "health" aisle? God (and a few business executives bent on profits) knows what THAT means. This cacao powder is also a great ingredient in your cooking. Raw. Gluten free. Vegan. Organic. Yummy. The usual suspects, in other words...

Big. Bigger than expected. If you lay it out, the "puff" part of a Milan Bella Puff Chair looks like a big dog bed. But comfy. In fact, you could curl up like Fido and enjoy a Dog Day Afternoon. (Do as the dogs do: Nap early and often.) The cushion is around 4 inches thick, so plenty of "meat" to it, so to speak. It slides onto the base like a slipcover.Unlike the USA-made puff, the stand is made in good-old China. It fits together like Legos and takes about a dozen screws or so. No need to be a rocket scientist to figure this out -- just a screw driver scientist (come on, you know you have a degree). If there's one thing that gives me pause, it's the little plastic disk on the bottom of each chair leg. Just waiting to come off, I figure. At least if you plan on putting this chair on a hard floor. If it's on a rug, I suppose it will be less of an issue, but one never knows.The color -- sand -- is nice and conservative but more likely to show stains. It blends into most any oatmeal-style decor. Rather informal, I'd say. Good for a rec room, family room, TV man-cave type set-up, I suppose. Don't put it in the "living room" (or "dead room," as they're called in most houses, because no one much uses them). Overpriced? I'd say shop around. That's what your Internet is for. But overall, an easy to assemble, comfortable sitter.

What's this?" my son asked."A blue light.""Feeling blue or something?" he asked.More prescient than he knows, considering this is a blue light designed to drive away the blues. Whether it does  -- scientific proof in the form of "independent research" or not -- will never be substantiated by an amazon reviewer, in my opinion. As is the case with many things of this ilk, those who believe or are willing to believe will experience better results, and those who don't or are extremely skeptical will experience less optimal results. Let's just say I place these sort of things in the "doesn't hurt and can only help" department because they are safe and *might* boost one's energy/mood level, especially with Old Man Winter at the door, 5-bags of luggage in his arms.Speaking of winters, it might be best to read reviews from customers who live further north, where the nights are shortest and the winters bleakest. New England might not quite rate in that case, but I can assure you that it's a sleek looking little number about the size of a hand. The directions are so simple even a young punster's father can figure it out -- hit the plus to up the light intensity, the minus to diminish it. And though it's a blue color, directions state you should still not stare at it. Rather, let the indirect, arm's-length brightness wash over you for 20-30 mins a couple of times daily to feel the good times.Mine is near the computer plugged in. Its battery is rechargeable, however, so I can operate the device cord-free too, should I take a book somewhere remote and want to shine the goLITE blue in my obscure corner seat by the heat vent. Philips also claims this uses 85% less energy consumption than comparable "therapy devices." Don't call it a therapy light, though. Folks will wonder about you. "Energy Light," maybe. Easy to operate, small enough to pop anywhere, and effective if you believe or at least have an open mind about it.

This Epson replaces an older Hewlett-Packard we had and the upsides are evident. Like many other technological items, the Epson is smaller -- more compact than our other printer. There's also less shake, rattle, and roll. By that I mean the old one used to shimmy a bit while printing, making the somewhat flimsy table it sat on juke and jive a bit. This one holds firm.The noise element is better, though you still know printing is going on. At least no one senses imminent take-off as with the other. (Whisper quiet printers must be a ways away.) Simple insertion of toner and the color is good. Walk-through set-up on printer window was a breeze. Although you get the CD with the new printer, it's not necessary as your computer downloads drivers. At first I thought they forgot to pack a wire to connect printer to computer as back up, but then I realized there is no backup. This is wireless, and one less wire from the old tangle of same on the floor is a good thing.All in one: printer, scanner, fax. A no-nonsense, rather straight-forward piece of equipment, this should meet the needs of any home office with working parents and schooling kids.

Most people don't think of twine dispensers. They just grab a ball of twine from the junk drawer, untangle it from the scissors and screwdrivers and elastic bands and Cracker Jacks surprise-inside toys (leftover from 1966). No. This is the way to go. Take that bee's nest of twine and stick in on a spool inside a plastic container. Let a little mouse tail of string out. Pull what you need. Snap cleanly. You won't go back to the junk drawer again, trust me. The only complaint some might have is the size. You can buy more compact rolls of twine (and containers for them) that fit in kitchen pull-out drawers nicely. This bulky number would have to be placed on its side if you want it in a pull-out drawer. Otherwise, high marks and no knots-sense.

The Ritz drying mat is a practical addition to the kitchen for many reasons. It's two colors -- one if by cactus and two if by ocean. (Don't you just love creative color-naming? Who GETS all these jobs?)It's soft and cushy, so you can set your dishes on it to dry. Or, if you have some other type of drying rack, you can use the Ritz drying mat as an absorbent base for your existing rack. It does not complain. It will play second fiddle or first.The mat is easily washed (as long as you do cold water washes). As it is 100% polyester, you don't want to use fabric softener, bleach, or your iron.If you need something to put hot pots and pans on, this is not your item. Wrong purpose. Look elsewhere. This is to dry wet dishes, period. The only drawback, that I can see, is that it's made in China. Maybe that bothers you, maybe it doesn't. Some people want to know, is all. Overall, a practical, 14 x 21 inch help in the kitchen -- especially if you have stone counters.

First, a brief story. Once upon a Christmas, I thought it would be cool to buy my wife some fancy anti-aging cream and drop it in her stocking. We were, after all, suffering the slings and arrows of middle age. Wasn't this thoughtful and creative on my part? Apparently not. My wife was mortified and not a little insulted. In the French Foreign Legiion there's an officer called Major Faux Pas, and I had just met him in a most unceremonious way!Flash forward to today. Seeing this hilariously-named product called, in all self-seriousness, "Booty Parlor Love Thighself Toning Cellulite Cream," I called my wife over to the screen and said, "Get a load of this. Remember the infamous Goof of Christmas Past when I bought that anti-aging cream?"And so forth, as she asked me to scroll down so she could read more about this product. "Seriously?" I said. "Why not?" she shrugged. Next thing you know, it's being clicked on for the cart -- not at my behest, but at hers. It's a mysterious world we live in, friends.Anyway, the lowdown. She says it feels too greasy, but she likes the smell (coconut citrus). As an innocent bystander, I must warn you that the smell lingers in whatever room it is applied. A plus for those who worry about what's in this stuff is the claim that the product uses no parabens, sulfates, phthalates, or petrochemicals. The key ingredient, supposedly, is "isonari," a Japanese parsley extract "that inhibits fat production and improves the look of dimpled, sagging skin." (Is there an asterisk in the house?) Most hilariously, the directions for 30-second application to thigh include "Do 10 squats and 10 pliÃ©s in the mirror. Say Thigh Love You, blow yourself a kiss and take on the day, sexy. Apply twice daily for best results."Who cares whether it works or not? Three stars for a sense of humor (and another "live and learn" lesson for husbands everywhere... when it comes to sensitive matters like these, let your wives decide for thighselves!)....

Episodic. In fact, to the point where author David Nicholls numbers the episodes for readers (for you number wonks, it comes to 180). This domestic month-in-the-life is about a British family of three -- scientist hubby Douglas Petersen, his Bohemian wife Connie, and their typically-moody teen son, Albie. Connie has announced she's thinking about divorce, and Doug puts all his hopes in the Petersen family's upcoming "Grand Tour of Europe." Can you see disaster coming? Of course you can! Sooner rather than later, too.Let's start with the quibbles. The book reads like it was written with the movies in mind. Maybe that's not a negative in many readers' minds, but it always throws me a bit if I'm distracted from the words, the craftsmanship, and the moment by niggling notions like, "Oh, I could see THAT scene on the big screen" or, "I'll bet they'll cast so and so as Connie. She'd be perfect!" and so on.You see, many of the "episodes" are set pieces. And the writing can be, at times, self-consciously clever. Put it together and you get a novel crying for a director. They won't need a screenwriter because Nicholls already has experience -- he wrote the screenplay to his last book, ONE DAY. In 2010, it became a Jim Sturgess/Anne Hathaway vehicle (as they say).To be fair, though, there's a lot to like here. By making Douglas such a square, such a killjoy, and such an annoyed dad, Nicholls is able to mine quite a few funny situations, especially with the more worldly Connie as a foil. Visiting the big cities of Europe (chiefly for the museums) gives it all an "If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium" feel, too. Rushing for trains. Discovering disastrous lodgings. Arguing over petty things because... well, because everyone's hot and bothered and too close for comfort.As the plot thickens and the marriage teeters, Nicholls develops alternate narrative lines by mixing flashbacks detailing Connie and Doug's early relationship with the present-day melodrama. And while I found myself a tad impatient with the threads about the past, in the end they added some depth to the drama playing out in the present.Can it get cute at times, too clever for its own good, even over-the-top in a few scenes? Well, yeah. But it's enjoyable. And, dare I admit, heartwarming in its way. Meaning? I just KNOW that Hollywood audiences will love it and that the right actors will milk it for all its worth when the cows come home and the box office opens. Four hundred pages, but a quick read and a fun read. If you like that sort of breezy, family tragicomedy thing, it appears you've found your book.

These are SO thick and nice.  Not cheaply made at all.  The neutral colors go with any style kitchen.  I don't see how you can go wrong with these.  They work really well and are absorbent.  They are a nice size too, at 16 x 19 they are larger than a lot of other dishtowels you see.  They are solidly constructed and don't fray.I also tend to appreciate solid colors more than patterns.

We are traditionally a "slim Jim" family.  My son has loved those since he could first eat solid food.  My husband's favorite is "deer sticks" or rather what we get from the meat locker during deer season, it's rounded venison jerky that is shaped like a slim jim, about 8 inches long and fatter.  This is kind of in between the two flavor wise, but exactly the same size as a slim jim.  It's got a good meat flavor for sure.  My son who is very picky and won't eat the deer sticks, says he "loves" these.  Texture wise, it's less greasy than slim jims for sure, which I found a nice bonus.  We may switch it up with these now, because slim jims get oil and grease on your hands.It makes a great snack on the go, or anytime really.  We like having this kind of snack especially well on camping trips or long road trips.

This is really convenient, a solar powered string of LED lights - no outlet needed!  22 feet is enough to cover a small bush, perhaps a small window.  It even has different modes of flashing.  The only thing you need to keep in mind is that the solar panel needs to face the sun as directly as possible.  Also make sure the device is "on".  It will automatically come on at dark, and it stays on at least 6-8 hours before going off (or until it gets light out whichever comes first)... the time really depends on how much sun it gets during the day I think.Just an all around great idea that I am thrilled exists.  I only have one crappy outlet at the front of my house so now I don't even have to bother with it!  Simply great!  I got my lights at a discount for the purpose of this review.

This is really awesome, a solar powered string of LED lights, that is fairly long!  It even has different modes of flashing.  The only thing you need to keep in mind is that the solar panel needs to face the sun as directly as possible.  Also make sure the device is "on".  It will automatically come on at dark, and it stays on at least 6-8 hours before going off (or until it gets light out whichever comes first)... the time really depends on how much sun it gets during the day I think.Just an all around great idea that I am thrilled exists.  I only have one crappy outlet at the front of my house so now I don't even have to bother with it!  Simply great!  I got my lights at a discount for the purpose of this review.

1:56 Mins This is a cool little lamp.  Mine arrived with a bit of a charge so it turned on right away without being plugged in.  It has three settings, low - medium - high.  At the highest settings it is 950 lumens.It arrives completely folded down flat, just under 14" long.  But then you can unfold it and swivel back the end for a standing lamp, or hang it on the wall because it has a notch for hanging.This won't light a whole room but it's great for a desk or piano or something like that. The only flaw I can see is that it is a fairly skinny base and it could get knocked over pretty easily.  Because of that I'd say it needs to be in a place where animals or kids aren't going to be able to knock into it.I got my lamp at no charge for the purposes of this review.

1:19 Mins I got the red ribbon color.  The description says it is 2 CM wide, which translates to exactly 3/4 inches when I measured it.  I also took the time to unroll it since it did not specify a length and it is about 73-74 feet long.  Give or take depending on if you like using the yucky bits at the back and front.This says in the title it's silk ribbon, and the description says it is actually 100% polyester.  It feels a bit papery to me, but it's very durable.  This is a step below really fancy fabric ribbon that is soft, and about 3 steps above purely paper ribbon with a sheen that is made just for wrapping packages.  So when you cut this ribbon, because it is actually fabric, it will fray a little bit... but not nearly as much as a real satin ribbon would.I got my ribbon at no charge for the purposes of this review.

1:31 Mins This is a really cute charger. Like the little rubber nubby protector on it. It will charge up to 4 USB devices at one time.  It says "High speed" but when I plugged my Note 4 into it, it didn't give me the "fast charge" notification that I normally get when I am rapid charging.  So I think high speed is a subjective term here.  Normal speed is probably more accurate.  I've had slower chargers for sure so I can't complain.Charges cell phones and tablets equally well.It has a little light indicator on the front and the back can unplug from the wall cord as well.  I received my charger at no charge for the purposes of this review.

You get a large package of 800 (no I didn't count them all to make sure they were there!) gold colored twist ties.  They are shiny gold, not matte gold.  They are just under 5" long, coming in at 4.75" each.They arrive in a plastic bag ready to use, all broke apart, you don't have to separate them, which is nice.I received my twist ties at a discount for the purposes of this review.

These are cute little USB fans.  They need assembly, but it's really easy, just put the fan blade on and you are done.  These little USB powered fans have adjustable necks so you can point the fan anywhere you like and they offer a surprising amount of breeze.  I had these plugged into my wall USB in my kitchen and it occurred to me this would be great for cooling down cookies or other items right out of the oven.The blades are made of plastic and I did stick my finger in it just to see how much it would hurt.  It actually did kind of hurt a little bit, but no broken skin or anything horrible.  If you accidentally touched the blades while they were spinning you'd definitely feel it, but no lasting damage.I can see this being great for my menopausal acquaintances who are complaining of hot flashes.  Might make a funny gag gift!  I received my fans at no charge for the purposes of this review.

My son and I tried these Sentey gaming headsets out for a few days and overall for this price point around $30 we think this is a decent value.  We used them with a regular Dell PC and an ASUS Laptop and it worked the same with both.This set connects with USB only.  Hopefully this won't be a deal breaker for you,  they don't use the 3.5mm plug that some other headsets might, but in our experience it isn't unusual to have a USB powered headset - just something to note if you are short on USB ports.The sound quality was the same or maybe slightly better than some other headsets at this price point.  The bass sounds I thought were better.  My son didn't seem to notice that.  Microphone is just OK.  Nothing to write home about, but it is still en par with other headsets of this price point.  If you require stellar mic sound, maybe you might want to invest in a higher end set than this one.  I'd say this one is entry level, and that's ok.  Most people can get by with this I think.Cord is thick and sturdy.  Microphone swivels up and down.The lights on the side can be switched on or off.  I find it a bit gimmicky and superfluous to have lights on these but my son REALLY thinks it's cool.  So I guess it's a personal opinion.  I received my set at no charge for the purpose of this review.

Beautiful ring!  Looks way more expensive than it is.  The thing I like best about it is that the stones go around the entire circumference of the band.  The colored stones are an orange-brown color.  They look like the color of autumn leaves.  This isn't my normal color for gemstones, but it's quite stunning when on.It's not a heavy thick ring, it's quite delicate and feminine.  It's very attractive and shiny.  At this price point, my expectation is that it should last a 3-6 months and still be in decent condition with daily wear...  I will plan on wearing mine daily and I will report back if and when it begins to tarnish or look worn.  In some cases with less expensive jewelry, I have been very surprised how well it performs, especially the rhodium stuff.

In order to make this charger work with my husband's phone (Note 4) we had to purchase a QI Wireless Charging Receiver Film (for Samsung Galaxy Note 4).  It cost around $10.  If you have a newer phone that step will not be necessary.  Once that was installed using the Kollea Qi Wireless charger was a breeze.  Just plug it in and done.When we tried it without my husband's case on the phone it began charging instantaneously.  He put the case back on and it took a moment but then it began charging... and his case is fairly thick because it is a wallet case.  So we could not be more thrilled.The charger itself is very light weight, and is about the size of a drink coaster.  It does not seem to charge as fast as using our "rapid charge" plugs, but nothing seems to charge as fast as those do.  Presumably you are getting this for the convenience and for the added perk of not overusing/damaging your USB slot on your phone.I received my wireless charger at no charge for the purposes of this review.

My earrings have much lighter and slightly pinker amethysts than the product photos currently use.  They are delicate and pretty.  The color such as it is, is ok.  I think I would have preferred a darker stone to make the metal stand out more.The earrings have two tone gold/silver color to them.  This is a little strange to me, but doesn't look bad in practice.  The earrings are small and not too heavy.  Good for every day wear.The earring style with the lever closure (not sure what you call this) is a bit hard to get in the ears because the part that threads through your piercing is on a hinge and makes it less stable.  I found that putting them on using a mirror was a bit easier, but if I try without a mirror it takes a few tries before I get it.

These books are a phenomenal value at only $5.  Most store bought valentines cost the same amount - you get the same amount of cards, but these are truly unique.  No one else will have cards like these!Most of the cards will have some element of red felt like material on them.  Some cards you have to do a bit of assembly on.  They are just like the ones you may remember, or remember seeing in your grandparents scrap books.

I don't usually factor price into reviews, because everyone has a different idea of what is expensive or not - but I am making an exception here because I think this is a good value for as many beans as you get.These vanilla beans are the real deal, they add a lot more pop to your recipes than ordinary vanilla extract would... and you can get so much use out of them.  After you have opened the pod length wise you need to use a sharp knife to scrape out the yummy yummy insides.  This is the part you use in your recipes in place of the extract.  It's very flavorful!BUT WAIT!  Don't throw those pods away!  You can still use them,  by either throwing them in with a few cups of sugar (in two weeks you will have VANILLA sugar!)  you can also put the empty pods (or you can use the whole bean in this instance) in Vodka.  Using empty pods require more pods than you would need using the full bean.  What you get as the mixture sits is the best vanilla extract ever.  The best part?  You can use it then top off with more vodka.  It's like a never ending supply of Vanilla extract.I got my vanilla beans at a discount for the purposes of this review.

1:14 Mins This shower head is best used on a very smooth wall.  This will not work on textured ceramic tile, or on a painted wall - especially if your shower head is very heavy.  I received my shower head arm at no charge for the purposes of this review, but I went into it knowing my shower was not the ideal for this type of application.  I thought maybe it would hold on the wall above my tile but it didn't hold very long on either area.  I can't give it a bad review though, because I knew my application for this was going to be iffy.  But maybe you can glean the information you need to see if it will work for you based on my review.So in summary, It's a cool idea if you have the right application.  You need a smooth tile wall, absolutely smooth... and clean.  And it if your shower head is too heavy this also might not work as well as you'd hope.  But if you have a smooth tile wall, and a light weight shower head, this only costs $5.99 so you could give it a try, you won't be out much.

0:53 Mins This is a basic headlamp, it's a hands free flashlight in essence.  It's convenient for camping or any activity where you need both light and two hands.This headlamp does not come with batteries, it takes 3 triple A's.  That would be my only gripe, but at this low price point I don't think that one should always expect batteries either.  The LED has three functions, high beam, low beam and flashing.  Strap is adjustable and the light has a hinge so you can bend it up or down while wearing.I got my headlamp for a discount for the purposes of this review.

I got my laser level at a discount from the manufacturer for the purpose of this review.  When it came I was excited to try it out, I've never had a laser level of my own before, I've always had to borrow someones.It came with batteries installed, plus extra batteries (a nice touch).  The level has a ruler built in the bottom, one side is inches the other is metric.  It also has a tape measure on the opposite side of the laser that goes to 8 feet.  I've seen some levels that have magnets on them, but this particular one does not.

Wow!  Decent headphones for not a lot of money.  They arrived in their own black soft body case, which was a nice touch, not every set of headphones includes a case.  Thick braided cord, comfortable ear pieces.  The sound is decent.  Definitely not too tinny like some cheaper headphones can be.  I was very impressed by them.  I was going to give these to my 11 year old to use for school, but I think I'll give him a different cheap pair I have and keep this pair at home instead!  Has a pause feature on the cord and the ability to take incoming phone calls, which a handy feature to have as well.  I wore these around for the better part of an hour and they still felt comfortable on my ears.  I received my pair at no charge for the purposes of this review.

I was a bit nervous to use this, even though I knew exactly what I wanted to do with it.  I was worried I'd mess it up.  I should not have worried it was simple and hassle free.I used this on a small rectangular end table that was not currently being used for anything.  I cut out the piece first, then applied it to the table and it went on without even one bubble.  It was great.  Now my kids have a place to draw, and the table is just the right size for them.I have some left over so now I am debating whether to use this product on another table or maybe the side of a cabinet.  It can seemingly go anywhere

1:44 Mins These are your basic small trash bags, 4 gallon.  You get 120 per roll and they are perforated.  I use them in a 9 quart/8.5 Liter trash can and they seem OK for that size.  They could be used in a larger can than that though, I just like having a bit of overhang to work with so I can tie it off when the trash is full.Durability is about what you would expect.  Pretty much the same as a plastic bag at the store.  This is for light duty trash only.  It would puncture easily if you put sharp items in it.I got my trash bags for a discount for the purposes of this review.

1:53 Mins This is a really cute little bag!  I didn't believe that it would hold a full size water plus the accessories that are included with it, but it did and had a little bit of room to spare for some other items.This set comes with a hard plastic snap shut sandwich container, a small round container that nests on top of the sandwich container that would hold any number of items so long as it wasn't much more than a cup's worth.  It also comes with a fork and a spoon.  All these items are freezer and dishwasher safe, so that makes them really convenient as well.I got my items at no charge for the purpose of this review.  If you have any questions about this item that I can answer for you, please let me know in the comments section and I will get back with you asap.

2:33 Mins This is a very practical wedding band!  Tungsten I have learned  after doing some internet research, is a very hard metal, forged at around 1400 degrees.  Because it is so hard it is very scratch resistant and maintenance free.  You cannot have this kind of ring sized, which is a downside to it- but at the price point these are offered you could afford a new one if you ever needed to go up or down a size.There is a myth going around that these can't be cut off by a paramedic in an accident... but that is all it is, it's a myth.  Paramedics have special tools to remove rings, and tungsten isn't immune from their effect.This particular ring is brushed metal (looks almost like stainless steel)  The interior is a rose gold color and the two together look pretty good.  This ring is not too fancy, but it looks nice.  I think most men appreciate a ring that is understated and not too bling-y.I received my ring at no charge for the purpose of a review.  If you have any questions about this ring, please contact me via the comments and I will do my best to answer you quickly.

2:33 Mins Tungsten I have learned is a very hard metal, forged at around 1400 degrees.  Because it is so hard it is very scratch resistant and maintenance free.  But the down side of tungsten is that it can't be sized.  (Being as inexpensive as it is though, you could afford to buy a new one when you change sizes).  There is a myth going around that these can't be cut off by a paramedic in an accident... but that is all it is, it's a myth.  Paramedics have special tools to remove rings, and tungsten isn't immune from their effect.This particular ring is very cool looking, it has an almost 3D effect to it when you look at it.  It's quite stunning.  The inside is a lighter rose gold and the contrast between the two is really bold.I received my ring (and another in a different style) at no charge for the purpose of a review.  If you have any questions about this ring, please contact me via the comments and I will do my best to answer you quickly.

2:08 Mins The Trudeau glass water bottle with infuser is really awesome.  Here are all the reasons why:1. It's all glass and silicone.  No BPA's.2. It's really cute looking, and has a carry strap.3. All parts, the internal parts, the strap... even the grippy silicone base, come off for easy cleaning.4. Dishwasher safe.  (I'd probably put the silicone parts on the top shelf, that's a personal recommendation)5. Added benefit of the infusing sleeve, makes this extra special.6. It has a heavy feel to it, even when empty.  This makes it appear more substantial, and high end than it's plastic counterparts would.  That's why it would make a great gift too.There aren't many negatives to this.  If I had to try and nit pick one... it would be the decals on the outside.  If you wash this in your dishwasher, like I will... then over time these decals are going to fade and wear off... which looks tacky.  But this is really the only thing I can find wrong with it.  I will of course update this review if I notice any other flaws.  If you have any questions that I've not covered please feel free to ask and I will respond.  I received my bottle for free in exchange for this review.EDIT:  A few days in with this bottle, and I am still really loving it.  It's definitely a winner.

These washcloths before laundering, are actually around 10.5" x 10.5" square.  After washing they shrink up a little bit but not too bad, I think the listed size of 9.8" square is fairly accurate for after you wash them.  I appreciate the honesty of the description that the manufacturer gives.These are softer than regular wash cloths, and they are also a bit thinner construction.  I actually have a set of dishrags that are the same material as these wash cloths, and I love those- so these could also be used for that purpose too if you were so inclined.  I received my set of wash cloths for free for the purposes of this review.

I really love this shirt.  The cut is flattering no matter your size.  The material is very soft and I love that it's 5 button instead of three.  I like to leave them unbuttoned for a more V neck look.  It has seams down the front and back to form to your waist, rather than just a blocky shirt.  Fabric is mostly cotton and it's machine wash and dry as you'd expect.

I got these about 1pm, and I put them in the window to charge them, and pushed the lever to on.  Then about 6 when it was getting dark, sure enough they popped on all by themselves.  I checked on them at midnight and they were still going strong, but I don't know when they shut off again because it was morning when I next happened by them.  But even so, 6 hours isn't bad especially after not having the full day to charge, and most people turn off their Christmas lights when they go to bed anyway.These are very bright, every bit as bright as the plug in kind of LED Christmas lights.I love that now I am freed from using the one outlet on the front of my house.  I can put these anywhere I want!  I will update my review after the Christmas season if they ended up dying or something catastrophic happens.  I received my string of lights for free for the purposes of this review.

It's a very warm blanket/scarf.  You get a lot of fabric with this one.  Small plaid print on one side and a larger plaid print on the other, reversible.This is perfect to wear when you KNOW you will be going somewhere chilly and you just may need an extra bit of warmth.  It's really convenient that you can wear it as a scarf, as a shawl, or however.Material is a thicker weave, open end.  Hand wash cold, or as I do - throw in a mesh bag and wash on cold that way then lay flat to dry.  I received my scarf at no charge for the purposes of this review.

These are SOOOO comfortable.  And I didn't have to loosen the laces or belts for it to fit on my 16" to17" calves, even with jeans on.  But if your calves are bigger than that, you have the option of making the laces looser and belts looser.  So this might be a really good option for you!They look pretty awesome too.  I will update my review if something wears wrong on them or I notice anything else significant.

These are really handy in the garage, or even inside the house, for cleaning up messes.  The "cloths" are really durable and absorbent.  It's way better than paper towels where you'd have to use a lot, and it's better (in some cases) than actual cloth rags which would be tossed out after super messy jobs.  These disposable cloths really handle the messiest jobs.These are the right mix between a paper towel and a regular fabric rag.  The fact that they are disposable makes clean up easier.

This case easily fit a couple 7" tablets and cables for those tablets.  It also can fit 4 cables and wall plugs.  I felt though that a lot of the slots are kind of a waste.  There are numerous tiny tight spots, presumably for your collection of SD cards.... but I find that overkill.  Maybe you'd need one or two but the majority of people don't need rows of them.  Also I wouldn't feel comfortable storing both tablets and plugs in here because it is a soft case, so if anyone were to apply pressure there isn't much protection there.  There is a divider in there, but I don't think that offers the kind of protection I'd like if I'm housing tablets.The way this is configured, I find myself just throwing a bunch of cables in every which way and then using the elastic bands to hold 4 wall plugs.... not terribly organized but it is a case.  Previously I was using a pencil box when traveling to house our cords, so this is a slight step up.  We have a family of four, and we each have 1-2 devices... so when we travel on vacation we would need something larger than this to organize our electronics cords and plugs.There is also a bonus zipper pouch accessible from the outside of the case.  Big enough for a phone or some cords.I received my case at no charge for the purposes of this review.

This scarf when it arrived was not exactly sheer, but the fabric was a very feathery weight.  Not an infinity scarf, this is a traditional scarf and there are multiple ways to wear it.  You can google scarf knot tying to see all the options, there are many.This scarf was really pretty and being grey with dark grey print it will go with nearly any outfit except maybe some browns.  But I really liked the softness to it.  There is also a surprisingly large amount of material to this (Width) but because it is such a light weight fabric it scrunches up tightly.It will require hand washing, but I put my hand washables into mesh bags and put them in the washing machine on cold and I have no problems.  Hang dry.I received my scarf at no charge for the purposes of this review.

This is a very versatile light weight scarf that can be worn in multiple ways, whether you loop it twice or tie a knot in front or even over the head.  It comes in a mesh cloth bag and you can wear it right away, no ironing.  This scarf requires had washing in cold water, but I find that if I put them in a mesh wash bag I can throw them in the washing machine just fine.  Do not dry them though... lay flat.My scarf had a bit of a weird odor when I got it, which dissipates quickly once you remove it from the packaging (thankfully).  I don't know if that is because it was shipped to close to something else that smelled or if that is just how they naturally smell when new.Overall I really like this scarf, it goes with so many clothes I know I will have lots of occasions to wear it.  It's also light weight and sheer so I feel like I can keep wearing this in the warmer months as well.I received my scarf for a discount for the purposes of this review.

The usable surface on these, not including the groove or handles is as follows:Small Cutting Board, 5'' x 7''Medium Cutting Board, 6'' x 8''Large Cutting Board, 7'' x 10''You can flip these over and use the back in theory, but they really aren't meant for that because the side with the groove for juices is the side they mean you to use, but there is no real reason why you could not use the back.I found these to be quite attractive and small enough that they fit in my cabinet conveniently.  The surface is pretty hard plastic but over time like all cutting boards they are going to get grooved with knife cuts.  This is just the way of things, it happens with wood and it happens with Acrylic.  It's just easier to clean the acrylic because it can go in the dishwasher.  Also being somewhat inexpensive you can replace them easily enough.I got my set of cutting boards for free for the purposes of this review.

This is a very heavy duty, thicker style cord.  Not easily frayed or broken.  The plug is a Quick Charge, so your devices will power up in no time.  Charge time is equivalent with my factory rapid charge cord and plug that came with my phone.When just the cord or the cord and plug are plugged into my power strip my devices charged normal slow speed.  However, when used in conjunction with my fast charger plug that came with my phone or in conjunction with the CeeOne plug put directly into a wall outlet I was able to rapid charge my devices.  It all depends on where the power is coming from I guess.  But you can use this cord in place of your factory cords that came with your phone and will still get the fast charging that Android has put into it's newer phones.I received this product at no charge or at a discount for the purposes of this review.

These are very heavy duty, thicker style cords.  Not easily frayed or broken.  I liked the shortest cords the best because they really worked well with my USB power strip.When plugged into my power strip they charged normal slow speed.  However, when used in conjunction with my fast charger plug that came with my phone or in conjunction with a CeeOne plug put directly into a wall outlet I was able to rapid charge my devices.  It all depends on where the power is coming from I guess.  But you can use these cords in place of your factory cords that came with your phone and will still get the fast charging that Android has put into it's newer phones.I received this product at no charge or at a discount for the purposes of this review.

This is a very professional looking portfolio.  Everything you need for your next meeting or client visit.  The portfolio comes with a calculator and a pad of paper included.  There are slots for business cards/credit cards, a cell phone or post it notes, a pen or pencil and a large slot that will hold multiple papers, pads of paper or even a 10" tablet.Zippered closure all the way around so your stuff does not fall out.  Stitching is all pretty tight.  It looks like leather, the description says "PU Leather" which when I googled that term it says "Bicast leather (also known as bi-cast leather, bycast leather, or PU leather, sometimes described as split leather) is a material made with a split leather backing covered with a layer of polyurethane (hence the term "PU leather") that is applied to the surface and then embossed."  So it is leather but maybe not in the way you are used to.  It does not have that distinctive leather smell to it, though it is leather.  It doesn't have much of a smell.  I received my portfolio at no charge for the purposes of this review.

This is amazing as a moisturizer for the skin, but I'd advise NOT using it on your hair if you have fine hair or you are prone to oiliness.  This might be ok for dry or coarse hair.  This company makes other Argan Oil products that will work much better on hair than this one...  They make this different Argan Oil that works well on hair (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00MNK9R5Y), and a different Argan Oil hair mask (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00KD73PBQ) that is more a cream.  So if you are looking at this for hair, you might try those other ones first.But, if you are looking for a product for the skin, look no further.  Just a little bit and my skin was noticeably softer.  This will be great as winter is approaching.  I use it on my upper arms and my neck primarily.  Sometimes legs.  But this bottle should last awhile.  Does not have much of an odor to it which is also a big plus.I received this product free or at a discount for the purposes of this review.

My son is almost 12 and very thin (he weighs 65 pounds).  The size 10/12 shirts he wears are usually a little big for him but this particular shirt he described as feeling "tight".  It wasn't tight by my standards, but it was a little more form fitting than other t-shirts that say they are size 10-12.  If you have a huskier kid you might want to order up a size for this one.  The fabric is a polyester feel and has a cool sporty look to it.  I liked that the length was long on it.  I hate shirts that are too short.

This set of coconut milk shampoo and conditioner are really fabulous.  Right away you notice the glorious coconut-y smell which I really love.  I also should point out I love the dispensers with the pump.  I don't like having to turn my bottles upside down in the shower to get every last drop to the top.The shampoo does not lather up as much as others might.  There is still lather there, just not as much.  Rinses clean a lot easier and I felt my hair was pretty clean after using it.  The conditioner too, does not feel slick and slimy like other brands but after I get out of the shower my hair is comb-able so I know it worked well.  I think it's great that I don't have to have slimy hair to have conditioned hair!  It did take a little bit to get used to this, but I think if you give it a fair shot you'll notice how great it is.  After using this set I feel like my hair is coming out consistently clean and manageable.I received a complimentary sample for the purposes of this review.

I was not sure I would like this pattern as well as some of the other styles, but when it came I was happily surprised.  It's very light weight and long enough to wear in many different ways if you are in to knotting your scarves.  The pattern was super cute and I really loved it.  It doesn't add a whole lot of heat because it is light weight fabric but there is also enough fabric that it feels substantial.  Looks great!!  The only downside for this scarf is that it is a hand wash item which is a bit of a hassle.  I get around that by machine washing in a mesh bag, but you may not like to take risks like I do!I got a free or discounted sample of this item for the purposes of this review.

I was excited to get these because they are shatter proof which is something you want with kids and pets in the home.  However despite that very important feature I didn't like these as much as I thought I would because of the glitter.  Maybe if the glitter had stayed on the ornaments, but I had glitter all over my fingers and the table.Eventually, I suppose, the glitter that is coming off will wear off and then you'd be left with a non messy bulb that is also shatterproof.  I also didn't think these looked any more fancy than the bulbs that I can get at the dollar store.  So I think in the end you are paying for the shatterproof feature which is not found on cheaper bulbs.I received my set of bulbs for free in exchange for an honest review, which I have done.

I have to disclose up front, I love Argan Oil products.  This one is no exception.  It left my hair super soft and manageable.  This hair mask has a faint orange smell to it unlike most others.  It's pleasant and it dissipates once you put it on.The directions for this instruct to put it on for a certain length of time and then wash out, but you don't have to wash it out until the next time you shower, and then I go ahead and re-apply right away.  So pretty much this is in my hair 24/7.You can use a lot of this and still you won't have a greasy build up in your hair.  I'd say this would be good for any hair type.  I happen to have fine hair that is prone to frizz.  This is perfect for my hair.  I got this complimentary product sample for the purposes of this review.

The ornament box arrives flat and you have to assemble it, which is pretty easy.  By the time you fold out all the parts and put the reinforcing pieces in, it is actually fairly sturdy.  Not sturdy enough to store with anything stacked on top of it though, but sturdy enough that your ornaments should stay pretty secure.There are three trays and each have 9 compartments.  The compartments are HUGE.  My ornaments are not nearly that big so I will be able to put two or three in one slot, probably wrapped up in tissue paper to keep them from jiggling around too much. (My ornaments are stained glass).  If your ornaments are fragile, and smaller than the provided space it's probably advisable to wrap them up in something to prevent them from moving around too much.I took one star off because when I pulled on one of the handles it broke off and frayed.  I will probably sew it back in place - but kind of an extra hassle since this is brand new.  None of the other handles pulled off and broke like that one did, so perhaps it is just a fluke - I can't be sure.All in all it's an attractive box that neatly houses your ornaments, even your biggest ones, with ease.I got this complimentary ornament box sample  for the purposes of this review.

This Keratin shampoo and conditioner set is different than other brands.  I appreciated the pump style dispensers (so I don't have to turn them upside down in the shower to get the last bit out).  I also LOVED the fragrance of both of them.The shampoo does not lather as much as some other brands might.  But I feel like it got my hair pretty clean.  The conditioner does not leave that slick slimy residue that others do.  It was actually a little odd to me because my hair didn't feel even the slightest bit slick, but after I got out of the shower and dried off a comb went through it with no problems so I know it had to have worked because ordinarily I'd have a lot of tangles to get through.I'd say that this is a very unique formula and you'd do well to try it out for yourself.  I got my shampoo and conditioner at no charge for the purposes of this review.

They are not kidding when the box says use "a drop".  My first time out I used a drop, and thought - there is no way that is going to do anything so I used about two dime size handfuls.  That really was overdoing it.  My hair looked pretty greasy.  It was soft though.  So next time I used half that amount, maybe two squirts if that.  That was even bordering on too much... but now at least I know how much to use.This bottle will last you a long time.  There is no odor associated with this either.  It's just something that makes your hair smooth and soft, especially if you flat iron your hair like I do.  I felt it was fairly good (not perfect) at holding my frizzies at bay as well.  I got my sample at no charge for the purposes of this review.

I was pleasantly surprised by the Luseta Volume Reviving Dry Shampoo & Conditioner.  I have tried other "dry shampoos" before and they didn't seem to do anything.  This one seemed to work, and has the bonus of the conditioner, which I didn't see much of a difference using, just left a pleasant smell.You spray this on your hair, holding the can back a little bit so you don't get too much concentrated in one area.  Then you rub it through your hair.  What I did is I turned my head upside down and sprayed that way so the spray could get all over more easily.  It seemed to take the greasiness out.  I couldn't tell what if anything the conditioner did, besides make my hair a little softer and smell nice.  I could have just as easily went without that step.  The trick here is to spray just enough, but not too much.I received this product at no charge for the purposes of this review.

4:27 Mins I have to admit I had no clue what this was until I used a little Google-Fu and did a little reading.This is the first result offered and gives a little insight (and an image).Gua shaÂ (Chinese: åˆ®ç—§; pinyin: guÄ shÄ), meaning "scrapingÂ sha-bruises", is a traditional Chinese medical treatment in which the skin is scraped to produce light bruising. Practitioners believeÂ gua shaÂ releases unhealthy elements from injured areas and stimulates blood flow and healing.I found the image was a little scary really but I like the idea of increased health and massage after so many years of medical issues so I figured why not give it a shot.I personally only use this for my face and I must say it does cause the redness somewhat like a sunburn as it is supposed to and this brings a flushed warmth to the face. Obviously this means blood flow has increased and assuming the healing is also happening I think it is pretty cool.I think this is a review that would have to be updated down the road after a prolonged period of use so I am setting a reminder for several weeks from now. Hopefully sometime in the first week of Dec I can update this review and speak about my thoughts beyond initial impressions.You can actually perform this Gua Sha technique with almost anything but it is nice to have this attractive looking jade piece and it is smooth so you won't accidently cut yourself like you might with some other item. (I've read of people using bottle caps but I'd much rather use this).Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

I used to use an adapter that required me to need a power outlet and with this that is no longer a requirement. 9:06 Mins I had been using a small keyboard pretty much like this one but without the backlighting and a few other option.The other option I really like is the battery can be replaced if or when needed.The addition of the backlighting makes it easy to see at night (as intended) and all keys are registered quickly as expected.The size is pretty much perfect, range is nice, works great with a Mini PC as well as an Android TV box I use occasionally.I haven't measured the distance but it is rated at 10m which is right at 33 feet. 6:21 Mins I really like the switch design on this particular light.I have many solar lights and the way this one blinks to indicate the chosen mode, the label clearly outlining each mode and the rubber cover over the switch makes this one a much nicer design than several other lights on the market.It offers a nice amount of light, is sensitive to motion even of my little 10lb dog and it needs only sunshine to work, I'm happy.The video shows the light output and design.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

4:18 Mins I was actually more pleased than expected with the sound quality and even the amount of bass this headset offered. Almost always smaller in the ear type headsets have a lacking in the bass they offer but this set does really well and maintains clarity even with higher volume levels.They are comfortable in the ear and easy to operate. They are listed as having the option to answer and reject calls with a simple "Yes" or "No", something that is becoming more common and is a very useful feature.Battery life is average to above average with the claim of 5-6 hours of use and 150-175 hours of standby time. Charge time is around 1 and a half hours.Being designed for the athletic individual sweat and even a little rain should create no problems, personally due to medical reasons sweat isn't an issue but knowing a little rain won't hurt is nice peace of mind. The charging port is exposed though so I wouldn't get them any more wet than you have to just to be on the safe side.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

4:07 Mins I have so many solar lights and I like them all a great deal so when this set became available I hopped on the chance to review them.Normally in my video I show and mention the battery replacement options but this unit sadly does not allow that. Inside this unit there is a 1000mAh AA battery that is soldered in place and is non replaceable. Since I know there are times when the battery could need replacing this does take away from this unit.The lighting is attractive and water should not pose any problems, with 100 LEDs and 39 feet you will have a nice look wherever you decide to use these. Keep in mind you will get longer illumination when in flashing mode than in the steady on mode.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

4:10 Mins Very quick to become useable and automatic shut off makes use this very simple.Nice that it can be used as a humidifier if you wish but as a facial steamer it is a really nice unit to have. It produces a lot of steam and as stated it does so very quickly.The product page is accurate on the runtime, it lasted nearly 10 minutes and produced a very fine mist of steam. They also speak of the UV lamp...well I saw the blue illumination which was nice but knowing the UV is also taking the water to another level of clean before it reaches my face is great.It is a very relaxing experience and combined with my other new cleaning routine I expect a very refreshing experience in my future.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

5:09 Mins Typically with many scuba diving flashlights you don't really want to run them when out of the water. This light however is a LED equipped light and can be useful in and out of the water.I particularly like that the seller lists it as a 500 Lumen light. I say this because yes it is bright but many sellers list the Lumens WAY beyond what they actually are capable of and mislead customers. I also like that this light comes in a decent plastic case and provides a wrist strap as well. Having this on your wrist when diving is ideal but in other situations like working on things, a car perhaps or riding a bike you don't have a free hand so it is also useful to have it right there on your wrist.Waterproof means rain and mud and dust and such won't pose any issues and you can also dive with it if you like (up to 80ft).It seems the plastic and aluminum will be durable and it is bright in color so it should be easy to keep track of as well.The seller did well with listing information on the light, they mention the depth of 80feet, its composition, that it uses an LED and the power and runtime of the LED. (10W Runtime: high-2hours; Low-5hours ) They also mention the 3 modes if offers, High, Low, and Strobe. Beyond that they even listed the distance of illumination as beyond 650ft and a 50K hour life expectancy of the LED. I am so glad they were so detailed as often times there is so little info provided.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

5:12 Mins Gold plating and stainless steel...should hold up fairly well with proper care. Of course it also has a dial window that is highly scratch resistant and a good automatic movement that should work well for a long time.The gold color is a little more yellow than I normally prefer but I can deal with it as I think overall this is a really nice looking watch.Being automatic it should continue to run for a day or two without movement but beyond that you're going to be setting it, winding it, or need to store it in an automatic winding watch case.It is my understanding that automatic watches will gain/lose time a little more than a normal style watch but I haven't observed any major issues with time loss as of yet so I am very pleased with this watch.The inclusion of a band adjustment tool is great as well as the presentation with the gift bag, envelope and such. Setting the watch is also very easily accomplished and the band operates with no difficulty.Still weird a men's watch includes a hair clip but they do this with every watch so it's apparently just the way it is with Burei.Some specs that make me like this watch in addition to the looks and no need for a battery as well as a nice "tip" from the seller:Water resistant to 330 feet (100 M): suitable for snorkeling, as well as swimming, but not diving.Japanese Miyota automatic movementProtective Anti-Reflective Sapphire Crystal dial windowKindly note:Â It needs no battery, but it will stop if you have been physically inactive for an extended period of time. If this happens, wind the crown 40 times clockwise to start the watch and give it some reserve power.Â Personally I no longer scuba dive but I find it odd this watch is rated down to 330 feet yet it is clearly stated it is not for diving. I don't know anyone that is swimming around and hitting 330 feet so it seems weird to specifically state this in the product description. IF this is because it lacks any diving type function I suppose it makes sense but it isn't marketed or designed as a diving watch so I just felt it was odd.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

I found the smell very pleasant but this is not a high lather shampoo which I sort of expected.It goes on and comes off fine since I have rather short hair but I don't notice any major changes. It does feel nice and clean and because it rinses away as well as it does there seems to be no residual left behind.The natural or safe ingredients make me feel good about using it but with no major difference I cannot say I "love it". I do however like the smell a lot and the way my hair feels is maybe a little better than with a much cheaper quality shampoo so for that I certainly "like it".Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

I was fortunate enough to get a chance to try both Olive and Jojoba oil and also Macadamia hair oil awhile back.I use them both for the same couple uses...those are:Beard oilHair managementDry handsI have a very soft beard and both these oils help to manage the fuzzy or strays and keep it looking and feeling great.I wash my hands a lot and as it gets colder outside the dryness increases, these oils help remove that completely.I dislike hair sprays so I just use a little oil and run my fingers through my hair then allow it to dry. My hair stays soft to the touch but doesn't have the fly aways.The key to this stuff is it takes VERY little to make a major difference. If you use a lot I'd imagine it will feel oily but I use only a little and it works without leaving my hands or hair (head and face) feeling oily or weighed down.They both also has a very pleasant smell that I do not find overly powerful.Review sample provided free or at a discounted price for a fair, unbiased, and honest review.

I have always liked coconut smells but this is in my opinion a lot more pleasant than most products with a coconut scent.I got a compliment on the look and feel of my hair while using this product (but to be fair I've always had compliments on my hair over the years).
