However compared to the much more expensive and feature loaded 920, this 635 has turned out to be the better phone: this immediately recognized my home wifi network. When I put the SIM card in from Consumer Cellular, I was immediately able to make calls. Cortona worked the first time I set it up. The screen is bright, the signal is strong and so far I am pleased !The 920 is another story: no wifi connection at my house, did not recognize my SIM card  (this is a HUGE problem per Google) and even after downloading updates on my neighbor's wifi, still no Cortona despite 8.1 being downloaded. I gave up and am returning it.So I bought another 635 as my backup phone. Hope it works as well as the first one I have !

I am somewhat familiar with Android devices but had hoped this would work for my needs. I am not a heavy user but wanted to be able to access the Internet if I needed to. I charged the battery in the phone, turned it on, set the language to English and then it told me to connect to WiFi since I did not have a SIM card to install. I pushed everything I could to to access my  home network to no avail so I powered the phone off to work on it another time. The next time I powered the phone on I got a screen telling me to install a SIM card and emergency calls only could be made. I tried to get to a screen to set up the phone to no avail. Nothing would get me past that yellow screen asking for the SIM card.  I'm returning the phone for a Windows OS phone....a Nokia.....it has to be easier than an Android OS even tho there are not so many apps etc. I don't know if this phone is defective but I am moving on.

I initially wanted to return this phone due to the weight. All reviews said it was heavy and they were not mistaken. It takes some getting used to....But my problems ran deeper than just the weight. I was constantly going on U Tube looking at how to fix something. First I had Chinese on the keyboard along with English and even a hard re set did not correct that problem. I was slowly learning Chinese. Then it would not recognize my WiFi even tho my new Nokia 635 picked up my home network (and my neighbor's too) right away without any problems.The last straw was when I put in the SIM card from Consumer Cellular and it was not recognized...Another Google search showed pages and pages of entries for this problem  on the 920 and suggested remedies that got way too complicated for this technology challenged senior lady.So this is going back despite the fabulous features....Oh I updated the OS so I could get Cortona and she still does not show up or work. She works great on my Nokia 635. The 635 may not have all the bells and whistles this 920 does but it is working perfectly right out of the box.

I tried to remove the back to check if there was a battery that needed a tab removed etc. When the phone arrived, it came from Amazon Warehouse Deals and there was NO battery in the box and no plastic wrap to indicate there was supposed to be a battery. in the box altho the box had been re taped shut. The instruction book is pitiful with the gross grammar and spelling errors. It never mentions how to take the back off the phone and the POSH web site offers no clues either. There was an offset on one corner but even with a sharp knife I could only barely lift one edge of the back up and it just would come off....I was afraid if I slid the knife's edge along the side of the phone, it might damage something inside the phone....So I'm returning it and I won't order another one....I might need to remove the back at some point where I don't have access to a sharp knife or something that would fit in that slot offset....This is ridiculous !

I have a rescue pure bred Border Collie who goes ballistic at the sight of a flea and chews all her fur off when/if they bite her despite all my best attempts to keep fleas out of my yard and off my pets. She will literally be bald on her hind quarter in 5 minutes and hairless in 1 day. She is pitiful !  This is the ONLY thing that I have found that gives her relief, clears up her skin and allows the fur to grow back in. She is stunning in the winter and looks like an abuse case in the summer but if I didn't use this, she would be miserable and so would I.  I cut her hair almost to a surgical cut so that makes her feel good too. Atlanta's nasty hot humid is no friend of hers either.I highly recommend this spray for a lot of the skin conditions dogs and cats get. It does not sting, they seem to like having it sprayed on them and it works to cut out the itching and allow the skin to heal quickly.

I'm an artsy fartsy kinda senior lady who has done all manner of DIY projects and have used Contact Paper in ways even the Contact Paper people never envisioned That said the only way I can describe this product is "from hell" ! It was a nightmare to TRY to use. Even with help we were both at our wit's end with attempted installation of a 36 x 41 piece on an end counter top. We attempted to practice great patience & watched so many videos from various sites I think we could have made a pretty good one IF we had been successful.  First of all the paper is wound way too tight in a roll. There should be some other way to ship this product out besides wound in a tight roll....Perhaps shipped on a piece of flattened cardboard with rounded edges like fabric is put on....We even cut our piece one day, put weights on the corners over night and came back the next day to work the piece. It did no good. As soon as the weights were removed, it rolled back up as if it had never been flattened or....attempted to be flattened. It was as if the backing was smaller than the top vinyl piece and so there was just no way it was going to lay flat. When we held it down with our hands on each corner, you could see the top had bubbles and rolls all in it....  We used the "wet method" which is supposed to be easier but it was not. The backing did not tear cleanly off the vinyl front....We had to get tweezers to pull the backing off when it came off in pieces and apart....Picture pulling the backing, which is coming off in pieces and the paper is STILL CURLING !!! Gr-r-r-r-r-r  To shorten this story, we trashed the piece and I ordered a faux granite painting kit for less than what this "experiment from the devil" cost.I just can''t recommend this product under any circumstances to anyone. I know there are success stories out there but my experienced friend and I are stumped as to why and how others successfully used this product. We've called it "The Kitchen Nightmare Project"...never to be attempted by us again in this life time !!!

Nothing special. Not soft as I had wanted. Colors not as vibrant as shown here. Just barely acceptable to me. Thankfully they will not be personal gifts but items to raffle off for a travel club. Not nice enough to give as a gift in my opinion.Shipping was a bit faster than expected. Just wish product had not been such a disappointment. China again....When will I learn????

Cheap,cheap,cheap....The fabric is on the level of cotton gauze and is so thin I could shoot straws through it. The hem ,if you can call it that, is poorly rolled and even more poorly sewn. Some areas the fabric edge are not even caught in the stitch leaving raw edges !There is no way I would (1) wear this or (2) give it as a gift. It's just too cheap and tacky looking...Also the colors shown are NOT what you get....The print was light and some sort of tannish ick that looked like....well...nothing.... Boy was this product picture photo shopped !!! Threw all three of them in the trash can. Could not think of a single use for them and too expensive to send back. Lesson learned: no more scarves from China no matter how good they look on amazon.com !!!

It works great ! Pollen is horrible in the spring in Atlanta. This helps me breathe! I am also highly allergic to my many rescue dogs and cats. I sleep with this mask on so the animal hair on the pillows and bed linens doesn't get up my nose during the night, which used to make me wake up coughing and choking....Now I sleep all night and the animal hair stays out of my nose ! Highly recommend !  It is only $11.99 at homedepot.com and I had it shipped to my local store for FREE !!! I'm getting another one !

so-oo-o-o- soft ! This is a great looking robe. The first one was lost by the USPS but amazon.com replaced it right away and thankfully so ! It fits great, is well made and again just about the softest fabric you could use for a robe ! Great style and a "10" all the way around !!! You will not be disappointed in any way !

These arrived 2 days after the maximum delivery date...From China, of course. I should have known better.They are thin. They are contoured to some small extent but the major problem with these and the reason they went straight in the trash can, is that they do not block the light. Light comes in all around the nose area no matter how the mask is adjusted on your face. It just is not designed or made well. So for $3.07 they are a total waste !Do not recommend under any circumstances: long delivery time, crammed into a teeny tiny plastic envelope and above all, they do not fit well enough to block the light around the nose and nose bridge area. The whole reason you wear a mask is to block light !!!
It was a gift and the recipient loves it. Can't speak to the quality etc. Sorry. Know this is not helpful but the seller keeps sending me e mails to review the product.....

Doesn't seem to work for me. I had taken Align for years and was satisfied with it. I kept myself "regular" had minimal stomach bloating and generally felt better. I also did not get sick when friends all around me were sick with the "crud" so I felt like I had a strong immune system thanks to the good bacteria in my gut. I saw a show on my local PBS channel about the bacteria in this supplement and why it was a more complete bacteria as a probiotic.I've been on it daily for 3 wks and really can't tell that I've gotten in benefit from it. To the contrary, I've been sick with a cold for a few days, had an upset stomach and gastro problem before the cold set in. I know I can't blame it on this supplement but I'm giving away the 2 bottles I ordered and going back to Align. I know it works well for me. Everyone's system is different so this may work well for you. I am disappointed especially at the high price !

A friend just gave me her iPhone 4 since she got a new 6 on sale at walmart. She said she paid "a lot" for this Otter Box cover which is in pink. I'm having to replace it. I have no idea how long she's used this phone/cover.  The covers for the various ports do not stay in place but stand out from the phone cover waiting to be torn off. They will stay for a couple of seconds if I really cram them into the opening (this can't be good) but they pop out and the covers just hang open. The right hand top of the outside cover is stretched out of shape so that it no longer hugs the curves of the phone on the top right. In addition, the covered part at the bottom that rests on top of the button is also stretched so that debris can get into the phone case, which it did. When I took the case apart, I was shocked at the amount of dust and debris that was inside the cover. She said she carried the phone in her purse most of the time. Probably what most women would do.  Because of the shape of this cover, I won't order this kind again. I am willing to pay more to get a better cover. At least more dust proof.
Too big....Did not realize that the large piece exceeds the airlines maximum combined measurement of.....62 inches....Bummer ! Can't use this to fly unless you want to pay an over charge.....

I've had this for almost 3 wks. I wish I could return it but it came from an amazon.com vendor who wants me to pay return shipping.It is so noisy I have to only run it in my bedroom when I am awake. It would wake the dead on low. I have tried everything to get it to keep from rattling and nothing and I mean nothing works....I am about to resort to the bunji cords that another reviewer uses to stop the rattling....ugly but I guess it works....I also am enduring a moldy, musty smell even though it is cleaned on a regular recommended basis and I use a humidifier additive. Now I have the filter in the bathtub airing out....It's not grungy or discolored but the whole room smells terrible....I never let the humidity get over 45% so I am stumped and not a happy purchaser....Between the stinky odor and the rattling and the loud fan, this will not be used past this season....I'm going back to the room size Vicks units that I get at Walmart.....Save your money and buy something else.....This is a bust and I had such high hopes......

My Italian Greyhound, Antonio, wears this to stay warm this winter in the No. Georgia mountains. It's so soft, I almost wish I had a set of pjs like this ! It launders beautifully without fabric softener. The shipping is so very slow, but be patient and you will be rewarded with a great hoodie for your baby. Runs very small. Antonio wore a XXL !!! He weighs 12 lbs....

Antonio, an Italian Greyhound, wears this to bed and is snuggly warm! I  have washed it several times and it launders beautifully. SO soft !!!!! A very good value even if the shipping is very slow. Be patient and you will be rewarded with a great warm hoodie for your baby.Highly recommend.
Gave it to a good friend who is my handy man since my husband passed away. He said it fit him perfectly and is so warm he can't believe it.Highly recommend !

Really nice charm and you can actually read what's on the charm, unlike some other ones with writing I have ordered. I gave it to my real estate agent who found my perfect house and had me close on it within 3 wks.  This charm said if all for both of us !!! Very well made too !Highly recommend.
Very well made ! Gave it to my Daddy for Christmas and he liked it very much. Would buy this item again.

So tiny you can barely make out the LSU....If you did not know what was on there, you would think it was just some design. For that reason, I would not recommend....My friend is an LSU grad. and I had to show her where the LSU was and still she could barely see it....Not worth it for the money....
Very small but very cute. My friend loved it since it looks exactly like her small dog ! Highly recommend !

I washed this in cold water on "hand wash" cycle. When it came out of the washer, all the letters  & dog bone images had washed off or were peeling off.....He got to wear it 1 time. What a waste and needless to say POOR QUALITY....In addition, while he was wearing it, just from  him turning while he was sleeping, it got loaded with "pills"....really not nice to look at or feel from the outside. Inside was soft, though.Do not recommend !

but this light bulb hurts my eyes ! I do not find it restful, soothing or any of the other things that people said it did for them...I could not wait for it to cool off to take it out of the socket.I put it in the lamp beside my bed in hopes it would help me sleep or get in the mood to sleep....I felt like I was in a Halloween party room.....I certainly could not read a book by this light or watch TV with this orange light in my peripheral vision. I swear I just don't understand the high ratings this bulb got. I have a bunch of them that I will save to donate to the Community Thrift store next Halloween. They should go fast and be a hit with the kids....I'll stick to my LED bed side lamp bulb and be happy. At least I gave it a try !

I got this little stove on sale at Ace for $99.00 with free shipping. What a great price !The flame is very realistic and it has lots of logs vs some stoves that have only 1 piece of "wood" in the fire box. The stove heats a bedroom well and I don't seem to  have a noise issue with the flame effect. All in all this was a great price for a great little heater. The ability to view from 3 sides is a great plus !

It's just ok....much, much, much smaller than I envisioned. It arrived with 1 stone missing and it was not in the black pouch so the seller shipped it out that way. Easy to notice I saw it right away. Now seller wants ME to pay for return shipping. I won't order again. It's just not that nice looking......This was to be a Christmas gift. Do I need to say how angry I am at receiving a defective item????

This stove may be made of metal but that's about the only thing it has going for it ! I didn't realize that it does not have a 2 speed heater. Just "on"...and trust me when I tell you there is absolutely no way this will heat 1,000 sq ft. I have a 12 x 16 bedroom that was heated by a Hearth Trends infared heater just fine until the thermostat malfunctioned & I had to send it back for repair. I got this to use in the mean time. I put the thermostat on 68, when the room temp is 64 and even though it runs all night long, the room never gets to 68 degrees so the heater will turn off ! 1,000 sq ft to heat ??? No Way !!!  Also the fan sounds like wind blowing through a cracked door or window.....up and down in sound as the wind speed and direction would change. It is impossible to sleep with this noise, so I moved to another bedroom. Duraflame tells me this is "normal"....  When I get my Hearth Trends heater back, this is going away to live some place else where no one sleeps and the room is tiny. That's about all it's good for. A huge, huge, expensive buying mistake. There are better and less expensive choices out there in Internet land. Cannot recommend this one !

I bought this heater stove at nothingbutsavings.com for $117.00 including free shipping.I kept it for several weeks and found that it just did not produce the heat I needed here in the livingroom area. The fire was nice and very realistic but the heat performance was sadly lacking.I gave it to a young couple friend who have a much smaller home and need supplemental heat for their small bedroom. The wife reports that it works fine for them but she says there is no way it would heat a larger area, which I already knew.So visual is a 5 heat performance is nil resulting in a 3 rating. There are much better choices out there.

The last sentence in both the product description and manufacturer description states that film is applied to BOTH THE TOP AND BOTTOM OF THE UNDERLAYMENT FOR DOUBLE THE PROTECTION.....NOT true....This is just regular run of the mill 2 mm foam underlayment with a 1 mm poly film applied to ONE side only....You can get this for much less at many, many places !I am returning all 7 rolls at Amazon's cost since it is a product description error and not my error. Very disappointing since I wanted the double vapor barrier protection for my particular installation application. I should have opened the box when I first rec'd it a week ago. Now I have contractors coming Monday and I have to go buy whatever I can find locally. No time to shop online where prices are much better. bestlaminate.com as an example.

Hole at the end of the bag is way, way too big for a 1/8 inch grout line !!! It's a great tip if you need to enlarge it but otherwise it's too small for my needs. It's going back.Bag itself seems well made and would probably hold up well.Just wish the tip was smaller.

Came in a # 10 envelope with instructions which are not the same as the way it says it will come in the product information portion on  Amazon.com web page.This is the direction I received: " Initial Instruction: 1) Do not rush 2) Use a Credit Card item to RUB on the Masking tape. 3) SLOWLY peel off the masking tape from the backing paper (SLOWLY). 4) Stick decal on CLEAN surface. 5) Use a Credit Card to RUB on the Masking tape again. 6) Slowly peel off the masking tape from the surface." ????? About as clear as mud !Makes absolutely NO sense to me ! It's going in the garbage. Not worth returning which is what the seller is probably counting on !!!

Like all the rest of the purchasers, I have those stupid letters that mean absolutely NOTHING in English...I put the sweater in the freezer for 30 min. and then peeled the letters off fairly easily....That's the remedy for getting off chewing gum....The sweatshirt part of the outfit is made from really heavy sweat shirt material. I was impressed. The check cloth portion of the outfit is really, really cheap ! Poorly stitched and will probably ravel away after a few washes at which time, I'll just cut the sleeves off etc.... The collar is double cloth so it should launder fine.I got it in about 3.5 weeks by mail. It does run really small !!!

Got a # 14 large for my rescue 12 lb Italian Greyhound. It has a taped neck like a well made human polo shirt and the pique knit fabric should wear well. Machine wash cold and tumble dry medium. The bottom has a squared off area so the shirt should not get soiled when males are doing their business.I got a pink shirt since there was no way to select a color that I could find....My dog is a male but he's color blind so he won't mind ! I'm curious as to what color the other purchasers got....I would order more IF I could figure out how to select a different color !!

This size box of Cheerios at Walmart is $2.97 ! At Costco it is....strangely enough....a bit higher for 2 boxes....But this price is so ridiculous I barely know what to say. Surely it must be an error !!!

Fits my rescue Italian greyhound well and he looks so "hot" in it and he knows it. It does need to be rolled up when he goes out to pee and during the course of pulling it back down on his back, it's now beyond his tail ! So it does stretch out a bit if you pull on the fabric. That said, it washes and dries much, much better than a light blue one by another maker. This one is well made and I think will hold up over time.I like the fact that it has a reinforced hole for his dogcollar loop to click on the leash. The other shirt did not have that and I had to pull the dog collar loop out on top of his collar to attach the leash.... IBut right now, Antonio Italiano Extraordinaire The First and I highly recommend this polo shirt !

I bought this from nothing but savings dot com for one hundred seventeen dollars, no sales tax and free shipping. It was delivered on time. I gave the lower price to Amazon but they would not match it so I ordered it from this other seller.The stove is plastic, of course. It appears to be well made, however, there was something loose rattling around in the stove. It turned out to be a tiny silver screw when I removed the back panel. This is the fault of the maker who obviously has zero quality control.The "flame" is really disappointing ! It is not nearly as realistic as the Duraflame stoves that I have in other rooms in my home. There is a stationary piece of metal that has been cut out in the design of a "flame". So when the "flame" is turned on this shadow is stationary and does not move. There is a small area that has the moving flame effect which is a roller of alumnium rectangular cut outs that rolls over the 2 light bulbs. (not LED) I tried to capture this in the pics I will post. (The picture of the stove on the web page totally, totally, totally misrepresents the "flame" effect in the stove. Do not be fooled !)IF the flame had been more realistic, this would have been a killer stove with the viewing area on 3 sides, but as it is, it's just barely acceptable and will never ever be confused with a real glowing flame. The glow of the logs is good and there are many logs. That's probably the best feature of this stove. It's a shame the flame is so cheesy. It is not close to the quality of the new 3D flame effects on stove not much more money than this one at the lower price. Comfort Glow has a long way to go in perfecting a realistic flame !!!The controls are behind the door. There is a dial for changing the temp. An on/off power switch and an on/off for the flame. There is only 1 setting for the flame.I will use this in my breakfast room this winter. I plan to buy 4 brick pavers to put under the feet to raise the height a bit and improve my viewing area from the table. Cheesy or not a "fire" is mentally warming in the cold winter !Regarding the heat output: it's still too warm here for me to run the heat feature. I will update this review as the temps fall and I begin to use the heater. For now I can only comment on my disappointment with the faux flame part of this stove. But I am not disappointed enough to return this. I just would not recommend this model or order it again, of course.(Sorry but this page does not offer the option to add pictures. I don't know why.....)

I bought a big bottle of these at Costco about a week ago. I wanted to get off the Prevastatin that I have been on for years. It had no side effects but I wanted to try a "natural" alternative.My physician recommended red rice yeast. Not knowing they came in capsules, and never having had any issues with taking large tablets, I bought the big bottle at Costco.Big mistake ! The short time these tablets are on the back of my tongue are enough to almost make me vomit and if I do get them down with a glass of milk, the taste stays in my mouth forever. I can't seem to overcome the taste with peanut butter or any other food. I mean the red coating is just disgusting !So I am trashing these before I even find out if they work due to the horrible red coating on the tablets.Another 1 star reviewer has addressed what the red coating is made of, which may answer why these tablets are so disgusting to take. I'm going to a capsule from another company. I'm so done with these nasty tasting red huge tablets !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Just like the first reviewer, this unit make an annoying noise when the "fire" is on high. No noise with the heater or when the unit is on low "fire". I am undecided on whether or not to return. I'm going to install in my fireplace and see how noticeable the noise is when it's in place. I was not expecting the unit to be totally silent but this noise is annoying !It seems to put out a fair amount of heat but we have not had low enough temps for me to tell you how well the heater performs as far as square feet heated. I'll add an update to this review after I can assess the heating unit.The grate and unit are plastic. The grate looks nice and realistic. There is a remote control, thankfully, since all the controls are on the SIDE of the unit which is terribly inconvenient and awkwardly placed,

Got it for much less money on nothing but savings dot com. One hundred seventeen dollars with free shipping and no sales tax ! What a deal ! I love this stove. It heats up my breakfast room in the morning in nothing flat and I get to watch the pretty realistic flames from the kitchen due to the 3 sided box.I also like that the infrared heating does not dry out the air as my central Trane propane powered unit does. All forced air furnaces dry out the air and my house was loaded with humidifiers in the winter before this little stove. I'm going to save a fortune on humidifier filters ! I bought several other infrared heating units for the other floor of the house and I am comfortable on cool mornings. I can't wait for it to snow and sit in front of my little stove with a hot cup of coffee !I highly recommend this little stove !

Bought this as a gift for a friend who is beginning nursing school in October. She has used it several times on family members and said it seems to be accurate and easy to use. She is an MA now so she has some knowledge of using a blood pressure cuff as opposed to an automatic blood pressure machine. I got her the lavender and she loves it !

My sister recommended this product to me and it has performed flawlessly ! I had been using a variety of other products for the "accidents" provided me by my 5 rescue dogs of assorted mixed breeds and sizes. Nothing worked ......This works if you follow the directions to the letter. I find that it really works on hardwood floors and hard surfaces. You must attack accidents on padded carpet immediately for best long term results. It works great in Spot Bots if you use the carpet shampoo product.

I returned them since the left arch support dug into the arch of my left foot to the point of pain. It took the seller forever to process the refund. I can't recommend these since they did not work for me.

I bought this for a close friend as a house warming gift. She was here when it was delivered so I had an opportunity to see some pieces right out of the box. The pattern is nice but the carving knife was not nearly as heavy as I had hoped. Also on one side of the knife handle, there were numerous scratches while the other side was flawless....I did not make a big deal out of it since it's not a piece that will be used that often....but I do wonder what the handles on the other pieces look like and I intend to bring up the subject with my friend shortly . I'll update my review as I get more information from my friend. It was a good price for so many pieces but I hope this is not a case of being too good to be true and the other pieces have scratches on them too....Stay tuned. The jury is out on this set for now.UPDATE AUG.22,2014My friend reports no rust spots so far. She lives in rural Georgia and is on well water so she has an issue with spots at times despite using several kinds of dishwasher detergent. She says the spots wipe right off. This set is being used by a family with children so it gets a work out each meal. She said that the bottom of a fork says: "18/10 stainless Made in China". There is no name of the manufacturer or name of the pattern. It's probably sold under a number of different pattern names, depending on who is selling it. She likes it ! I'll update IF any rust issues develop in the future.

This is a perfect fit for a love seat that needs protection from my dogs and cats. I love how stretchy it is and it went on in minutes. The separate piece for the bottom cushions looks great. I just could not be happier ! The pattern goes with so much so this is a big win for me ! I highly recommend !

These will be returned to Dr. Scholl's in Memphis for a full refund per their policy. They just did nothing for my fallen arches. I had been wearing the CF430 custom Dr. Scholl's supports but they are $40.00. One of my dogs apparently chewed up the right foot which is the foot with the worst arch support issue. (of course) So I ordered these in hopes that they would at least offer some kind of support but that was not the case. My neighbor has the same foot problem and she too thought they felt like nothing: no support at all. I was and am so disappointed.

I bought two of these for forty dollars each on amazon.com prime shipping about 2 wks. ago. Now I see they are temporarily out of stock. Glad I bought mine when I did !I have 2 wing chairs that needed a cover to protect the fabric from 5 rescue dogs who think it's beneath them to nap on the floor.... These were wrinkled when opened but as they suggested, I put them in the dryer with a damp towel and they came out almost wrinkle free.The fabric is like a canvas duck but made of poly. (I ordered sage which is true to color) It has a very slight sheen to it. It has nice sewn in tags that tell you where each piece goes. It went on in a snap. It fits almost perfectly and much better than any other style I've tried. The wing part is a little too pronounced so I'm going to put it on wrong side out and re fit and sew to more closely to  follow the lines of my chair. This will be easy since the fabric is not all that thick and the other edges are serged for strength. The front T cushion fits perfectly with no adjustments needed. Just the wing part needs to be taken in a bit. The length covers the legs and the front inverted pleat gives a more finished look to the cover. It does not look custom made but it's good enough for me....dogs or no dogs.....Oh and it has 2 ties in the back on each side to pull in surplus fabric which is nice and makes the cover fit even better. Also the original fabric is a stripe and it CANNOT be seen through the chair cover fabric. So no issues with see thru.....I highly recommend and hope they get more in stock soon.

Bought these as a gift for a friend's 16 yr old daughter. She just loves them, says they are a perfect fit and her mother says she practically sleeps in them. So refreshing to see a teen wearing Keds instead of some $100+ celebrity name tennis shoe ! Her mother has a matching pair and loves hers graphite Keds as well. Highly recommend !

My old wireless door bell just died,,,It served me well but I needed to get a new one that was weatherproof. I have rain that blows on to my front porch at times. It was a piece of cake to install and has numerous chime sounds to choose from. I found one that the dogs do not bark at. Thank you ! It's worth the price for that feature alone !!! Highly recommend.

Gave this to a friend who just moved into a new home and had an old round dial type of thermostat. Her husband installed it in no time and they said they love being able to program when they are going to be away and when they know they'll be home. My friend said her first utility bill was just over $50.00 ! For a nearly 2,000 sq ft home North of Atlanta, this is fabulous. She attributes the low bill to a 13.0 EER central a/c unit (Trane) and this programmable thermostat.

but I am going to keep them and not use my ortho supports with them. They will not be worn often but they fit well enough to keep and wear for July 4th and special occasions. They are very comfortable, do not lace up too high and give adequate arch support though not quite as well as the Grasshopper styles I wear. I remember seeing "Deborah" wear this style on "Everyone Loves Raymond" re runs in the navy color and thought at the time they were so cute ! For the average wearer who does not have the ortho support insert issue, these will be perfect and SO cute !!! The red is what I ordered.

And reversible too ! Bought these for a friend's new kitchen but they did not work for her. So I kept them and they are just what I needed in my breakfast room remodel ! In fact, I like them so much, they are what made me decide to redecorate my breakfast room. So out with the old wallpaper, will paint beneath the chair rail in a coordinating (as yet undetermined) color. The reverse side is a floral which I will use. By sheer coincidence, I'd purchased a set of quilted place mats several years ago in this same floral pattern ! What are the chances of that happening, but I'm thrilled it's happened. The colors just make me smile ! Highly recommend !

My friend's son put this on his new bedroom wall with the Scotch Command No Damage hooks and it looks adorable. The boy is 9 yrs. old and lives and breaths Univ. of Ga. (go Bulldogs). So instead of framed pictures he wanted this on his wall and we all agree it's a winner.

Gave this to a friend's son for his new bedroom. He loves it and I think it's a great value. He's 9 yrs old and a huge Bulldogs fan. He uses it for cover with his sheets during the summer. His mother says it has washed and dried without any problems, so at this point, I  recommend this. I will update if I hear otherwise from my friend.

Gave 4 of these to a friend to use in the breakfast bar area of her new home. I've seen them and they look great. I've spoken to her several times and she said they are performing flawlessly and she has no complaints from any of her family members. I will update and edit this review if she tells me otherwise. Right now I recommend these stools !

fitting tennis shoe ! A 9.5B in white stretch canvas ! I am beyond delighted ! I don't even have to use my ortho supports the arch support is so good. I'm going to take the advice of another reviewer, and spray them liberally with Scotchgard fabric protector to keep them as clean looking as possible. The heel depth is perfect for me. Some of the Keds styles are too shallow and I've had to return them. It doesn't lace up too high on my foot yet gives me the feeling that the shoe is securely on my foot and I'm not "walking out of it" with each step. Another issue I had with the Keds styles I ordered.I am so thrilled with the fit and FEEL of this style that I'm on line to order more colors in this style, now that I have found a shoe that truly fits my feet perfectly and look cute ! Highly recommend. PS This is my first try of the Grasshopper brand.

Purchased this in "expresso" not expecting much for the price but praying I would get lucky and get a decent finish on the table.Wrong. It was a mess: gouges on the sides, paint chipping off, the inside of the legs not finished and the outside of 3 of the legs had the finish rubbed off in places. This was either produced on a Monday morning or a Fri. afternoon in China. It was packaged very well but it was packaged with all these defects. The bottom shelf had no pre drilled holes for the supplied 4 screws. I knew it would be expensive to return to amazon.com and I had no expectations that a replacement would be any better. The worst part was that I really needed a table this size and with this configuration. So I asked amazon.com customer service what alternative they could offer me and they came back with 4 options. I chose a 30% discount of $10.85. I will end up sanding this piece down and completely refinishing it.It is veneer over particle board. The legs appear to be solid wood and they are the only solid wood in the piece. But for this small amount of money, you really can't expect much better from China. Buyer beware !

It's a shame the driftwood sets that I bought (6) did not look as good after they were initially laundered as they did before they were washed !I'll post the pic of the lint filter from my dryer on the first drying cycle. Then I ran the load through the air only cycle for 20 minutes and again a full lint filter, then ran them again on air only for 20 min.and again a full lint filter. I was afraid at that point that if I continued to dry them I would eventually end up with a nothing load !Snags: every item had between 12 & 16 snags after laundering. More on the bath towels and hand towels. Several so bad that the backing of the towel is thread bare. Will post pics. There is no excuse for this !I have not used them so I can't speak to durability, but I do know that my other Egyptian towels from Walmart and Overstock.com did not shed and shag like these towels have done. I think it's just a case of "you get what you pay for" and in this case, it's NOT MUCH....Won't order again and won't use for guests.

The wash cloth 4 packs I received are marked "serene blue" but they are about as gray in color as you can get. I am SO, SO tired of receiving items that are nothing like the color in the pictured items for sale. Last week it was "forest green" valances that turned out to be olive green.....Now these wash cloths that are gray. It's not that this lap top shows colors being "off" all the computers and tablets in my house show a beautiful sort of robin's egg blue and nothing close to what I received.Frankly, these look like rags in an auto shop....that dull drab gray.....They are going back as the valances did.

These are the bright white I wanted but the sewing leaves a great deal to be desired. One end of the rod pocket on 1 panel has left raw edges showing. Rod pocket sewing lines are off but not enough to make a difference. Ditto the bottom rolled hems. No deep hems on these panels.So for the staging that I needed, they will be fine. Would not buy them for my personal home though. Too cheap looking.

Probably worth what I paid but not a penny more. Certainly not the $35.00 suggested as a retail price ! Made in China so I will recommend to my friends who get this set as a house warming present, they'd better not use the glass for drinking. No telling if there is lead in the finish or not and best not to take chances. This will be more of a "show set" for their guest bathroom, I think....I would not recommend it. It looks sorta cheap.

I ordered 6 panels from "1kidandaheadache" seller,. The pic shows a nice deep hem. That was a huge selling point for me.What I received was 6 panels of the cheapest sheer fabric I've seen in a long time, NO deep hem. A rolled  bottom hem of about 1/4 inch and very poorly sewn at that. I held the sides together and one end is longer than the other by 1.5 inches. There is no side hem on either side. The top rod pocket was a mess also. Sewn crooked and right in the middle of the lower sewing line, the sewer nicked....picked up a piece of the sheer curtain, in the sewing line and so the panel would never be able to hang down straight !Frankly, the Dollar Stores have better quality than this panel I opened. By the way, these are "no name" panels. Nothing in the clear package but a panel.I have e mailed the seller for paid return shipping and a full refund including my initial shipping charge. I saw on another sheer panel product here on amazon.com that this seller has a product currently under review for "inventory problems"....No wonder !!!What I received was garbage & crammed into a mailing envelope I'll never be able to re use. Someone had to use a crow bar to gets 6 panels in the envelope. Other customers have sent pictures demonstrating this.

The black design is actually braid or ribbon stitched on the white sheer fabric. Gives a great dimensional aspect to the valance. I can see why it would be dry clean only. The black braid would probably run and ruin the white background. It's nice and wide so you get great fullness on a 40 inch window. It was just what I was looking for !

OK call me a comforter snob. This did not impress me at all. The microfiber cover is thin and not all that soft. It's not brushed. Just plain thin microfiber. Absolutely nothing special about it at all.This is a thin, thin, thin comforter ! It is for summer use only. The way the seller has pictured the corners, you can't tell that the corners are NOT sewn down and there is a large area on each corner where the stuffing is free floating in between the top and bottom and when washed will most certainly sink down into one of the open areas of the comforter. There is a Greek Key like sewing design so only every other square is sewn through with the bottom (or 4th side of the square) leaving the corners completely open !!! What this means is that the entire perimeter of the comforter is not sewn through leaving this extremely thin filling to shift and bunch up. When I rubbed my thumb and forefinger on the top and bottom of the comforter, I could tell the filling was so thin I just felt the top and bottom polyester cover.How this comforter has gotten such rave reviews is a mystery to me based on what I received. This is something I think would be comparable to a dollar store or maybe a Walmart "special purchase" comforter. Certainly terribly over priced for what you get !!!And looking at the outside package of the comforter, there is no country of origin information given. You would not know where it is made but the inside tag of course, says CHINA.....I hate to say it but this may end up in a dog bed cover as stuffing for one of my 4 ft crates for my dog. It's just too thin on its own. (note no weight information is given on the amount of stuffing....) No wonder !!!UPDATE: MAY 21, 2014. About a month ago I washed this comforter on gentle and dried per instructions in dryer with a couple of tennis balls to ensure it dried evenly. The dog bed cover was washed separately. You would not believe the pile of junk that I removed from the dryer. As I anticipated, all the stuffing in the corners was wadded in little balls. Mostly there is NO stuffing in the corners. To add to the lousy quality, the inside fabric has apparently frayed, loose threads have become entwined with the stuffing and now pull one side from the inside so that the comforter will not lay flat. I am going to have to rip open the comforter, cut the frayed threads to free them and re sew the comforter so it will lay flat in the dog bed cover.It seems all of us that have rated this piece of over priced junk have had exactly the same issues: the filling does not stay in place nor does it stay flat but becomes wadded balls of stuffing leaving large areas of the comforter with no filling whatsoever. For what it is worth,I am e mailing the seller to complain just to let them know how lousy this product is. It's too late to return it but I won't be fooled by this company again ! Far and away, this is the very worst shopping experience I have had on amazon.com !

Let me say that I foster cats and dogs so there is always pet hair on my carpets and area rugs. I have 2 Hoover Windtunnel upright vacs that I love but they are so heavy and have taken a toll on my shoulders pushing them back and forth. They do however, pick up animal hair extremely well on both carpet and area rugs. Not so good on hardwood but I put up with that. This is a lightweight vac which is nice. I don't think it's too loud but the fact that the only valuable feature of this vac is the rotating stair cleaner, makes it a mighty expensive stair cleaner.I tried it on my dark green carpet in the rec room which had combination dog and cat hair on it. No matter how many times I went over the same path with the carpet attachment, I could not see that ANY hair was removed. NONE ! The suction was good but the hair was just not being removed. So it's worthless on this kind of surface.Then I tried it near cat litter boxes that are on vinyl floors. It seemed to push the litter forward and not pick it up to be sucked into the vac bag. Again excellent suction but the design of the floor/carpet attachment was faulty. It just pushed the litter around. Uprights with a rotating brush just splay the litter in a 360 degree pattern so that's not a solution either. I finally drug out my Shark cordless and it sucked the litter right up. The downside to this vac is that it's not for big litter clean up jobs as the dust pan is not large & must be emptied frequently. But the trade off is that it is very, very effective on cat litter clean ups.So I am back to doing my shoulders in and using my Windtunnels with attachments and trying to balance it on the stairs when cleaning the 2 sets of 17 stairs in my home. The Windtunnels also have the rotating bush stair attachment but it doesn't work quite as well as the Eureka does.Too much trouble and expense to return so I will just donate to local human society thrift store after I clean it up of my pets' hair etc.I am just mystified as to how this vac can get such high marks and good reviews. I consider it basically worthless and grossly over priced !

The USB cord length is barely 13 inches and therefore is too short to reach the USB ports on my lap top ! I don't want to have to use a hub so this is being returned.Also I had a huge issue with my lap top staying  on the cooling pad. It kept slipping forward.It is a good design and if the USB length issue was improved as well as adding some kind of rubber on the edges of the pad instead of just the thin low smooth plastic lip to hold the lap top on the pad, this would be a good product.But as it stands now, I can't recommend this for anyone. It gets 2 stars for good ventilation design.

I had a MG3220 that I'm giving to a friend who needs a printer. I wondered if this one would be the workhorse that the 3220 has been. It's that and more ! I've been using Canon printers for a long time and have had no issues with any of the models. I update about every 2 yrs or so. I like that this has just the 2 ink cartridges and I can filled them myself or have a membership store do it for next to nothing. I also am a fan of the front loading paper. I bought this at the big blue box store for fifty nine ninety five and got a two year service/replacement agreement for five dollars and sixty cents. What a deal !!!Highly recommend. I have no issues with this printer's performance as promised !

I installed this water filter 4 different times. The first 3 times it kept leaking from the unit itself and not where the unit connects to the faucet. It even leaked around the handle that turns from filtered to non filtered water. I was about to return it as defective when I decided to get some pliers, a soft cloth and really screw the unit to the faucet. The 4th time was a charm and I know to remove it I will have to use the pliers and cloth again. It is on to stay !. It  did seem to waste a lot more water clearing the new filter than my old Brita did. I wish I had filled pots to measure but I had no reason to believe it would take more water to clear the charcoal out of the new filter than a Brita would. I am on a privately owned water system and our water is terribly expensive, so every drop counts. I could just see dollars running down my sink drain while I waited for the "OOO" on the meter to tell me the filter was ready for drinking water. It is NOT easy to see the filter. It's got a blue back light, so you have to bend down to get at eye level of the filter reader and the light only stays on 5 seconds. I won't be checking the water as frequently as I originally thought. Taste wise the water is good. No chlorine taste which was what I hated most about our water. I thought I was drinking out of a swimming pool before I began using filters. I bought this model so I could know when to replace the filter. I was tired of guessing with the Brita and it's electronic light system that failed more times than it worked. This unit is much bigger and seems to be made better than the Brita and especially the new PUR filter systems. It's plastic but it has a solid feel to it.At this point, I recommend this filter system. Just be prepared for possible connection leaks. My faucet had outside threads so no adapters, rings etc. were needed.UPDATE Feb.27, 2014:Still liking this filter and am glad I changed from the Brita to this one. I am amazed at how long this 200 gal filter will last. I guess I thought I was filtering more water than I actually was. I fill up my plastic water bottles, put them in the fridge to chill so I'll have water beside my bed at night. No more naming a landfill after all the plastic bottles I bought and used. I make my iced tea and cook with the filtered water also. I've even put filters on my shower heads to remove the chlorine in the shower water. Better for my hair and skin. This water filter is a keeper !

It shows a zipper which led me to think this mattress protector was zippered around the mattress. It is NOT ! It has elastic sides just the same an any other mattress pad !Very disappointing in the fact that the item description does not say how the mattress pad is attached to the mattress.....zipper, which is pictured on the pkg. or elastic which is the reality of the mattress pad. In my experience with my long time asthma, only zippered mattress covers can really prevent dust mites. This is nothing more than a water proof mattress pad and there is absolutely nothing special about it. Even the elastic nylon tricot sides are thin, thin, thin as well as the single piece of elastic stitched on. There are much better choices out there. This is going on a seldom used guest bed or I would return it just on principal of false visual advertising. Next time I will make a written inquiry if the pic shows a zipper and nothing is mentioned in the item description. I do not recommend this for dust mite prevention. I can't address its water proof properties or lack thereof.UPDATE 1/15/2014..... the seller left a message on my phone that he was sorry that I was disappointed in the mattress protector in thinking that it was an "encasement" instead of being elastic. He asked me to remove my negative review and offered "a $10.00 check for your inconvenience."I have not responded and will not remove my review. It is true as it stands and even though the seller said they would change the packaging, there are probably thousands of these mattress covers out there selling with the misleading zipper showing on the front of the package. When the packaging is changed there won't be any negative reviews about misleading package pictures and purchasers will KNOW it has elastic all the way around the edge of the pad and NOT a zipper as shown.

This pack of washcloths really surprised me. I of course have tons of cotton washcloths but these ones are made of Bamboo and that made me very interested in them. So I found out that Bamboo fiber naturally prevent microorganisms and mildew from growing on the towel. Cotton washcloths towel can have a bad odor after a short period of being unwashed but this is not an issue with bamboo fiber towels. Bamboo fiber is a natural deodorant effect that can fight bacteria that causes odors from lingering on the towel. I have found this to be very true I tested both towels for the same period of time and the bamboo not only out lasted the cotton one for 2 days (that's all I gave it) in smell but how soft it was still too. The cotton one got dry and stiff but the bamboo one was still soft. As soon as I got these in the mail before I washed them they were so soft. I washed them right away and was really happy that they were still just as soft.The bamboo washcloths have bamboo fibers that cover the washcloths with loops. That is what makes the towels to feel exceptionally soft and smooth on the skin. Even after using these and washing them the towels stay silky and soft. Bamboo fiber washcloths are said to be the best thing to use on baby's sensitive skin. I am so glad I got the 6 pack and I love that they come in different colors so each one of us have a different color and my daughter and I also have the other two colors for our faces next to the sink.  Their is dark and light pink , Purple , white , light green and light blue.  The colors are great and the towels are double stitched making them really durable.  I am happy to have received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

I am happy to have received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

After having a car accident and experiencing numbness in my hands when waking in the morning and tingling during the day, I talked to my doctor and he suggested compression gloves may help.So, after reading the reviews and looking at the pictures online (where it showed how to measure the size) I ordered the small size, but they were entirely too small.  After about 5 minutes of them being on, the circulation was being cut off in all my fingers.  I was going to get the size larger, but as I went to put on the the second glove, I noticed the stitching was fraying on the top of the middle finger and entire sleeve of that finger was coming apart.PRO:  the concept of compression, and ability to work with them on all day, colorCON:  Quality, sizing chart, lack of wrist support

I know this may sound crazy but I have gone through so many vacuums in the last 5 years of owning Saint Bernards and everyone of them stated they can handle heavy volumes of pet hair....but not so much.  When my husband told me his wet/dry vac broke (small one on sale 5 black friday's ago) it got me thinking....why don't I invest in a more powerful wet/dry vac and we can use it inside the house...not just for the cars and garage.  So instead of wasting $30.00 on a small unit for the garage, I went looking for a larger size and larger hose that I know will not have any problems sucking up dog hair.When looking at the selection on Amazon, I found myself gravitating towards this machine.  It seemed to have all the things we needed but it was not a BEAST!!  The things that were important to me were the sound, the large canister and the HP.  After reading the reviews of others and this one, I found this one really had all that we needed and even a blower (which we really don't need but will come in handy).Sound:  It is not as loud as the small one we used just prior to this one.  In fact, its about the quietest wet/dry vac I have ever heard.  Many vacuums are even louder.  Keep in mind it is a wet/dry vac, so its not like a dyson for being quiet, but its the best I have ever heard.Large canister:  Being a 12 gallon unit, it was a good size for us, not too small like the former one but not so huge that it takes 2 people to maneuver it.  But it really hold a lot.HP:  This was important because many of my former vacuums had decent HP, but that dog hair needs extra!  The HP seems to me to be more than 5 peak HP....and I have to be careful around small objects..because it can suck them up even when they are a foot away....and when I used it to clean my car, it sucked up a couple tools that were under the seat.....WOW!Hose size:  This was also very important to me.  I am tired of the regular vacuums with the small hoses, even with good HP, they get clogged with the dog hair.  This one has yet to get clogged...and between a husband that brings in the dirt, the dog hair, the dust bunnies and whatever else ends up on the floor, let me tell you that says something!Overall, this is a great unit and I have no complaints so far!!

This is quite a deal!!  I searched and did not find anything close to this package.  I purchased a new Nikon l330 for husband for christmas and he needed a bag to keep the camera in.  So, I went looking.  Checked out Amazon first, and not only did he get a bag, but all this other cool, very useful, stuff!  This is not poor or cheap quality materials.  The tripod is sturdy and the bag is nicely sewn.  And the price was FANTASTIC!So now instead of 1 gift, I can individually wrap all of these so he will be opening several presents!

Hubby drinks lots of coffee and he needed a larger coffee maker....his 4 cup was not enough....so after reading the reviews on Amazon, I decided on this one.  We were used to having a permanent filter in the other one, but this one did not come with it, however, I found a permanent filter that fit just fine into this maker.This unit is perfect size for the counter, easy to fill the water, the coffee pot is well made, not flimsy, and perfect size.  We love the programmable feature, works like a charm!No issues with this maker....running strong, simple to use and on time!  Hubby says coffee is awesome!!

I love these TOO much!  I have to "hide" them from myself...(haha)....not too sweet, but just perfect....I am eating Paleo and Primal, so these are really not approved food on those eating programs (because they have sugar and peanut oil, but cashews are approved), but I can tell you its minimal...and they are a treat.....I don't eat a lot of sugar or salt....but these had the right balance in them...and really the flavor of the nut was incredible....not too oily either!I would advise that if you love nuts and specifically cashews....you will LOVE these....so take a handful, put them in a bowl....and "hide" the rest in the container somewhere you won't get to them easily.....because its too easy to just keep eating out of the canister....and well....then "poof" they are all gone!Amazon had the BEST price on these anywhere....and I love the 3 pack.....the other 2 packs are "hidden".....

Love Himalayan salt....used it for years....so many uses for it:  to eat, foot and body detox in tub, fill my inhaler and use it when sick, etc....and its difficult to find in this size with the "fine" grain (which is the eatable kind that can go through a regular salt shaker).  I was really glad to find Amazon had it in this size and at the best price!!Many friends ask me why my salt is "pink" and I provide them with the literature on the healing properties of pink salt or refer them to the Internet that has plenty of info about all the great things about Himalayan salt and its healing properties....as well as how it makes everything taste so much better!!  Most people think of salt as "white" not "pink" but they don't realize the pink is the natural salt and has not had the minerals stripped from it....NOTE:  Anything smaller than the "fine" grain, is like a powder, so if you use it for eating, order the "fine" grain....IF you have a grinder, get the next size up...

My husband likes to transition after working in working boots all day, into a slip on shoe at night.  And after I looked at his old ones a little closer, they had holes in the bottom, I surprised him by purchasing these new ones for him.  I had not purchased this brand before, but I thought after reading the reviews, I would give them a try.  Really glad I did!Husband loves the fit, (I was worried about the size, because so many times I find one has to go one size smaller or larger) and that varies with everyone with nearly every shoe.  So, without trying on the shoe its difficult to really get it right.  However, Amazon reviewers are great with detail and usually include the fit in their reviews.  So, I felt confident that I needed to go a 1/2 size larger than he normally wears (9 is his normal size) and the 9 1/2 fit PERFECT!  Thanks Amazon Reviewers!!They are not heavy at all, but they are not paper thin either.  Just the right feel.  He loves the suede on them, super soft!  The grip on tread is great for the outdoors and winter!  He says they are warm, but do not make his feet sweat.  He does not wear a heavy sock, so maybe that helps.  They slip-on easy and are easy to remove.  No heel slipping either.Hubby has a foot issue from when he got hurt in Iraq, so its difficult to find good supportive shoes for him.  He tells me his feet feel fine even after wearing them for hours and they give him just enough support.Really don't have anything negative to say about these shoes....will buy again....

Husband drinks lots of coffee, so he needed a larger coffee maker.  The small one we have (4 cups) came with a permanent coffee filter and we found that just fantastic!  No more waste of filters or wasting money...the 4 cup permanent filter worked really well for us, but it did leave a ring on the filter (after each use) where the coffee grounds topped off in the filter.  It was actually a bit "slimy."  I was hoping this one did not do that, but it does.  Its not that horrible, but one cannot just rinse the grounds out, one has to really clean and wipe that part of the filter.  It does leave a stain on the filter, but if you keep up with washing it daily, it does not get worse.  Not really an issue for me (because I would rather do that than use disposable filters), but it may be an issue for someone else.  Husband says it does NOT affect the taste of the coffee at all.I was also worried about what some other reviewers said that it did not fit into their coffee makers....but we found it fits perfect into the 12 cup hamilton beach coffee maker we purchased....its a #4 cone, and those should fit into any 12 cup coffee maker....We will never go back to using disposable filters, this is a keeper...hope they keep making it!  It is recommended to replace it every 3 years.

I know....this movie may be cheesy to many....but I never see it on TV during the holidays and I just love it!  I am a big fan of Dyan Cannon and Kris Kristofferson so maybe I am biased.  I wish more movies were like this today, simple story, believable, character development, endearing, and cast well with a great ending!  Yes its a hollywood ending, but how they get to the end is where all the fun is...I have a smile on my face the entire movie....I am glad Amazon carried the movie and now its in my Christmas library....brought it to Grandma's house....she loved it too!Its a movie that I can watch over and over and never get tired of it.....

I love this "low" tech monthly day planner refill....I went back to using this "low" tech reliable system that never is subject to a virus, not being backed up, being accidentally deleted....I have been victim to all of those things with my phone and computer and I just decided to go back to what worked everytime....the day planner....I was thankful they still make the day planner refills....yes, I could have printed out a calendar and used my day timer small hole puncher, but its just easier for me to purchase these, they are already to use, perfect, have the holidays marked and inside my planner the colorful tabs are useful to identify quickly....

I have been using the Bender Ball prior to getting this.  It has worked well for doing my ab workout.  I would like to work my back more but the 1 ball method is a bit harder for me since I have a neck issue.  I decided to try this item and it is working great.  It does allow me to work my back better because its level on both sides with the two smaller balls, instead of 1 bigger ball.  The Bender Ball is more flexible, but the Gaiam ball is more rugged and tougher exterior.  I think I will alternate between the two of them during my workout.  Easy to inflate.  I love that I can deflate it when I travel and it won't take up too much room and wherever I am I can use it.

I thought this would be a great idea to lay down on this roller with the spine part cut out so it does not hurt the spine....but, the part was not cut enough so the spine was not disturbed.  It was really hard on my back and it was not comfy to lay on for any length of time.  Also, the roller part on the bottom was hard as a rock so no turning it upside down and using the bottom part.  I was disappointed in this item and thought it was a super idea when I saw it.  I ended up purchasing another OPTP roller and its working better, it holds up even though it provides enough softness so that I can do exercises on it without killing my spine.

I was excited to receive the seat cushion because it does things so many things at one time....but unfortunately, it did not work.  When I sat on it, it just went flat...no wobble at all to help with the core.  The leather is cheap and it sticks to your legs.  I opened the inside to see what it was made from and its just foam.  I am not sure where they come up with the "orthopedic air cells" technology....I did not see anything of the sort.  The item says it can hold up to 450lbs...and I am not even close to that weight, but it still went flat on me.I returned it to Amazon and the company contacted me about my return.  They are a small company and make these items by hand and they wanted to find out why exactly this item did not work for me.  I told them it went flat.  They said they were going to check it once it was returned to them because they have plenty of happy customers that have never reported this type of problem.  Its hard to find that kind of company that wants to know all about why a customer is not satisfied, so I give them a lot of credit for reaching out.  Maybe the one I got was a fluke....but, it did not work for me because it went flat.

I love the concept of these YogaHands....I use the Yoga Toes and LOVE THEM!!....So, I thought I would feel the same about the hand ones....however, that was not the case.PROS:  the concept of extending the fingers to alleviate pain and help with arthritis....CONS:  Cheaply made...the plastic on the outside of the fingers that holds the unit together is so thin and flimsy I thought I was going to break them when I handled them....the most disappointing thing was the fact they must be made for a giant....My fingers got lost in the unit and you could not even see the tips of my fingers when they were on my hands....the picture shows the fingers are extended out about 2 inches...and its not like I have child hands...but just normal woman's hands...but these were made for a giant....they were so tight that my pinky had to turn sideways just to fit onto my hand...and that caused a lot of pain in my pinky....Because the Yoga Toes have worked really well for me and helped heal my bone spurs and PF in my feet...I still believe in this concept of doing the same for  the hands....so I went looking for another product that worked for my hands...and I found the MELT method hand and foot treatment...there are 3 small balls that come with it and you place the balls between your fingers and you can adjust them as needed....incredible concept and very helpful for my hands and arthritis pain....but just not from this product....I have had great results with the MELT Method Hand and Foot Treatment available on Amazon....http://www.amazon.com/MELT-Hand-Foot-Treatment-Kit/dp/B00B60R060/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1413063927&sr=8-2&keywords=MELT

I was excited to receive these boot and start wearing them...however, I was very disappointed in then once I tried them on and wore them in the house on the carpet for a couple hours.PROS:  Soft inside and out, color, style, easy to get in and out ofCONS:  Everything else.  They were not comfortable at all.  Felt like I had no support in them whatsoever.  The heel was not comfortable and my heel slipped out of them because they ran big.  They would not have been warm when they got wet during the snow and rain...also the glue on the sides was showing in several spots and the sole was not completely glued to the top section.  They look like great quality, but the ones I received were far from that.  Also, I would not recommend these for anyone with muscular calves.  I have muscular calves and these were uncomfortable on the calf area.

I was terribly disappointed with these boots....and I really needed them so badly!!  They have a great look to them, seem very durable, and I loved the fact they were waterproof....they fit fine, but the problem was they cut into my leg and gave me shin splints after wearing them on carpet in the house for a few hours.  I love Merrell shoes but these boots were not a good fit.  I did not care for anything higher than these, but the height of these just cut into my leg.  I have worn plenty of other boots at this level, but they were softer and did not cut into me.  These however, were very tough and not bendable at all.  Maybe after wearing them for months they would have become more soft and bent more easily, but I would have been walking around in pain and bruises on my front shins.

This is literally the smartest thing we purchased for our new home....never run out of hot water is correct...and takes up no space....hubby will take a 30 minute shower and it rains hot water on his during the entire time....I can do dishes immediately after and still hot water streaming out non-stop...we can run the water in the sink and do the washing at the same time with little interruption of the water pressure....its very important to make certain you get the right size for your home....we have a 2 bedroom 1 bath and this is more than perfect....we would probably need a larger size when we move and build our next home since it will have 3 bedroooms and 2 bathrooms....but after using this technology we will never go back to a tank water heater....and we are saving a ton of money by not having to heat the entire tank of water all the time....WE LOVE IT!!!

I was sooooo excited to get this sleeping bag to use for camping and traveling....but I was terribly disappointed in a way I never thought I would be.  The first night I used it I woke up and my feet and legs were dyed blue...I looked like a smurf....now, that dye is not good to get on and into your skin....and it took 5 days for it to come off of me...I then took it to the laundromat and washed it inside out thinking that may take care of the problem, but I used it again that night after washing it and it did the same thing.  .I contacted Amazon about it, and sent them pics of the inside of the bag showing the blue dye coming off...and pics of my feet and legs that were blue....Amazon immediately refunded me for the item...and needless to say I got rid of the bag.... I have never had this problem with any other sleeping bag I have purchased before...so not sure if it was just a defective item that stood alone or a bad batch....but whatever it was I was unwilling to try another bag from the same company....

Purchased this for my step-son last Christmas along with the Strathmore 400300 80-pound 24 sheets medium drawing paper pad from Amazon as well, and he is still using these to date. I was excited to receive this back stretcher since I really NEEDED it!!  But, I was disappointed when I used it.  Its like a torture chamber device....I can tolerate a lot of pain, but I think the floor feels better than this.  The other ones I looked at prior to purchasing this one seemed to be arched way too much for me....but this one hardly has any arch at all when you lay on it...and the padding is nearly nothing when you lay on it....the one good thing about it is the middle section is carved out of it so your spine will not be crushed....I have to say that I felt worse after I used it and I did not feel it stretched my back at all....I decided to just use a fitness ball to help me stretch the back....a lot less painful and works better!! I inquired with Net10 prior to purchasing this phone to ensure it would work in my rural area of Idaho....and Net10 said it would with the address I provided to them where I would be using it most....however, once I received the phone, set it up and tried to use it, it did not work at my residence in Idaho....I know its difficult for us to get coverage since we live in a valley between 2 mountain ranges, but our other phones worked but were not smart phones....since we wanted to upgrade to the smart phone but not a new contract with our carrier, we thought this Net10 phone would be a great way to have a smart phone at a cheaper rate and not have to be tied down to a 2 year contract....but no such luck!!  I called Net10 and they tried to help me troubleshoot, but they said we live on the where coverage can work or not work....so its just a matter of trying out the phone to see if it works....they said all the other phones would probably not work as well so exchanging it for another phone would probably not solve the issue....unfortunately, I had to return the phone...and I bit the bullet and purchased a phone with my current carrier and had to sign up for a new 2 year contract....no other cell companies offer service in the area....The day I set up the phone, it seemed simple to do so...so maybe it would be a great phone if you lived where you had 4-5 bars all the time....also I will mention that it is small, very small compared to other smart phones....

Each one of them worked for about a month each but after that the tips did not work or came off.  Cheap, not meant to hold up for an extended period of time apparently.....and I did not even use them all the time...but when I did they just fell apart after about a month...would not purchase again...

It just works, fits into the plug on my tablet on the first try and without effort.
